2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Patrick Reed, who played college golf at Augusta State University, looked in command on a familiar course that caused problems for several other contenders, including Jordan Spieth, who lost his two-stroke advantage after Thursday’s round with a double bogey right on the first hole. Reed, on the other hand, finished with nine birdies to shoot 66, the low round of the day, for a two-shot lead over the Australian Marc Leishman (-7) heading into the weekend.
2018-04-06.headline_main: How Patrick Reed Dominated the Masters on Day 2

2018-04-06.abstract: The Trump administration, carrying out sanctions pressed by Congress for election interference, announced new penalties against Russia’s richest men.
2018-04-06.snippet: The Trump administration, carrying out sanctions pressed by Congress for election interference, announced new penalties against Russia’s richest men.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration imposed new sanctions on seven of Russia’s richest men and 17 top government officials on Friday in the latest effort to punish President Vladimir V. Putin’s inner circle for interference in the 2016 election and other Russian aggressions.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Trump Administration Imposes New Sanctions on Putin Cronies

2018-04-06.abstract: Friday: California vs. Trump, the Stephon Clark shooting, the Good Witch house is for sale, and a Brown birthday.
2018-04-06.snippet: Friday: California vs. Trump, the Stephon Clark shooting, the Good Witch house is for sale, and a Brown birthday.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2018-04-06.headline_main: California Today: Villaraigosa on Not Backing Impeachment (Yet)

2018-04-06.abstract: Despite the wall-to-wall Facebook news of the past few weeks, lots of important things are happening in the tech world that don’t involve the company.
2018-04-06.snippet: Despite the wall-to-wall Facebook news of the past few weeks, lots of important things are happening in the tech world that don’t involve the company.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Each week, Kevin Roose, technology columnist at The New York Times, discusses developments in the tech industry, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Kevin’s Week in Tech: Extra! Extra! News Beyond Facebook!

2018-04-06.abstract: In a time of political uncertainty, turmoil and real-life cliffhangers, home improvement shows offer soothing, escapist optimism.
2018-04-06.snippet: In a time of political uncertainty, turmoil and real-life cliffhangers, home improvement shows offer soothing, escapist optimism.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: On a recent Sunday evening, I was glued to the T.V. as Janna and Jason, newlyweds in matching leather jackets, agonized over their decision: Would they buy the historic downtown Tudor or the sprawling house in the suburbs?
2018-04-06.headline_main: Who Doesn’t Love to Hate-Watch HGTV?

2018-04-06.abstract: If you are getting ready to upgrade your e-reader or tablet and want to take your existing e-book library along, consider your options.
2018-04-06.snippet: If you are getting ready to upgrade your e-reader or tablet and want to take your existing e-book library along, consider your options.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Q. Is it possible to read Nook books on a Kindle? Is there an e-reader that handles books from multiple e-bookstores?
2018-04-06.headline_main: Moving Your E-Book Collection to One Device

2018-04-06.abstract: The White House announced on Friday that for the second year in a row, President Trump will skip the White House Correspondents Association Dinner.
2018-04-06.snippet: The White House announced on Friday that for the second year in a row, President Trump will skip the White House Correspondents Association Dinner.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump will not attend the White House Correspondents Association Dinner this year, continuing a boycott that began his first year in office, the White House announced on Friday, but the president will “actively encourage” members of his administration to go in celebration of the First Amendment.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Trump Will Once Again Skip the White House Correspondents Dinner

2018-04-06.abstract: Mike Pompeo is President Trump’s pick to be the next secretary of state, and John R. Bolton is the choice for national security adviser. Civil rights groups are concerned.
2018-04-06.snippet: Mike Pompeo is President Trump’s pick to be the next secretary of state, and John R. Bolton is the choice for national security adviser. Civil rights groups are concerned.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Nearly two months after the Boston Marathon bombing, Mike Pompeo, then a congressman from Kansas, took to the floor of the House to denounce American Muslim leaders for what he called their “silence” in response to the heinous terrorist attack.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Pompeo and Bolton Appointments Raise Alarm Over Ties to Anti-Islam Groups

2018-04-06.abstract: Though the protest and casualties were smaller than those last week, they made a point: portraying Gaza as a prison with Israel as the jailer.
2018-04-06.snippet: Though the protest and casualties were smaller than those last week, they made a point: portraying Gaza as a prison with Israel as the jailer.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: NAHAL OZ, Israel — With tear gas and burning tires fouling the air and gunfire periodically ringing out from one direction, Palestinian demonstrators and Israeli soldiers faced off along the fence hemming in the Gaza Strip for a second week on Friday. Nine Palestinians were killed, including two teenagers, and a thousand were wounded, Palestinian officials said.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Nine Killed in Gaza as Palestinian Protesters Face Off With Israeli Soldiers

2018-04-06.abstract: The basic story of a strong labor market remains intact, but a disappointing report is a sign that the U.S. is not in some extraordinary boom.
2018-04-06.snippet: The basic story of a strong labor market remains intact, but a disappointing report is a sign that the U.S. is not in some extraordinary boom.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: The March employment numbers were a disappointment, but only relative to extremely optimistic expectations. The basic story of a robust United States job market remains very much intact — though with an important asterisk.
2018-04-06.headline_main: The March Jobs Numbers Show the Economy Is Sound, but Far From Invincible

2018-04-06.abstract: Konstantin V. Kilimnik, a 47-year-old former Russian military interpreter, is nicknamed “the midget.” But he’s looming large in the special counsel’s inquiry.
2018-04-06.snippet: Konstantin V. Kilimnik, a 47-year-old former Russian military interpreter, is nicknamed “the midget.” But he’s looming large in the special counsel’s inquiry.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: KIEV, Ukraine — The man sat at a restaurant table, grasping a glass of white wine. His sandy hair was close cropped, he wore a cardigan sweater and in the afternoon bustle he looked like just another office worker at lunch.
2018-04-06.headline_main: He Says He’s an Innocent Victim. Robert Mueller Says He’s a Spy.

2018-04-06.abstract: Ms. Jacobson of “Broad City” talks about her dramatic turn in “6 Balloons,” a harrowing look at addiction, and being a woman in the comedy boys’ club.
2018-04-06.snippet: Ms. Jacobson of “Broad City” talks about her dramatic turn in “6 Balloons,” a harrowing look at addiction, and being a woman in the comedy boys’ club.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Abbi Jacobson — who, with her enabler, Ilana Glazer, mines stoner-slacker millennial angst in Comedy Central’s “Broad City” — can usually feel the unmistakable rhythm that means things are working.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Abbi Jacobson Discovers Her Dark Side

2018-04-06.abstract: The 30-year-old guitarist combines an eclectic mix of inspirations and interrogates his relationship to his main instrument on “Breaking English.”
2018-04-06.snippet: The 30-year-old guitarist combines an eclectic mix of inspirations and interrogates his relationship to his main instrument on “Breaking English.”
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: The inspirations for Rafiq Bhatia’s new album, “Breaking English,” include but are not limited to: Jimi Hendrix concert videos, blaring prayer calls from Turkish mosques, East African archaeological sites, the death of Trayvon Martin and Flying Lotus sound collages.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Rafiq Bhatia Is Writing His Own Musical Language

2018-04-06.abstract: “Mute,” “The Ritual” and “Ravenous” are three Netflix Originals that deliver genre thrills in differing measures.
2018-04-06.snippet: “Mute,” “The Ritual” and “Ravenous” are three Netflix Originals that deliver genre thrills in differing measures.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Netflix put up more than 50 original programs on its streaming service in March, including series, specials and movies. Thus truly began a long-promised deluge of what the kids call “content,” and just how much original content Netflix will put up before the year is over is something not even Netflix can say.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Chipping Away at the Huge Block of Netflix Originals

2018-04-06.abstract: The next generation of a New York real estate family steps up to play a much bigger role in an apartment tower on the east side.
2018-04-06.snippet: The next generation of a New York real estate family steps up to play a much bigger role in an apartment tower on the east side.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: As an apartment tower rises in Murray Hill overlooking the East River, the reins of one of New York’s highest profile family-owned development firms are being passed from one generation to the next.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A Real Estate Dynasty Passes the Torch

2018-04-06.abstract: The choreographer and dancer Jack Ferver made this duet, part of his new show “Everything Is Imaginable,” for himself and his old friend Reid Bartelme.
2018-04-06.snippet: The choreographer and dancer Jack Ferver made this duet, part of his new show “Everything Is Imaginable,” for himself and his old friend Reid Bartelme.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: #SpeakingInDance is a weekly visual exploration of dance on Instagram. Watch the video from our most recent post below, and follow us at@nytimes.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Haunted by the Familiar

2018-04-06.abstract: Jennifer Clement’s “Gun Love” is the author’s second novel examining Americans’ fascination with firearms.
2018-04-06.snippet: Jennifer Clement’s “Gun Love” is the author’s second novel examining Americans’ fascination with firearms.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: GUN LOVE By Jennifer Clement 247 pp. Hogarth. $25.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A Florida Trailer Park Awash in Lethal Weapons

2018-04-06.abstract: The mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato, who argues that the art form is “the opposite of elitist,” stars in Massenet’s “Cendrillon” at the Met Opera.
2018-04-06.snippet: The mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato, who argues that the art form is “the opposite of elitist,” stars in Massenet’s “Cendrillon” at the Met Opera.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Joyce DiDonato, the star mezzo-soprano, admits she was slightly fearful when she first visited the Sing Sing maximum-security prison in 2015. She had agreed to sing there as part of Carnegie Hall’s Musical Connections program, but wasn’t sure how an operatic voice would be received.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Opera’s Miss Congeniality Takes On a Rare ‘Cinderella’

2018-04-06.abstract: For each 10-point increase in pre-pregnancy diastolic blood pressure, there was a 17 percent increase in the risk of pregnancy loss.
2018-04-06.snippet: For each 10-point increase in pre-pregnancy diastolic blood pressure, there was a 17 percent increase in the risk of pregnancy loss.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Women whose blood pressure is high before they are pregnant may be at increased risk for miscarriage, a new study has found.
2018-04-06.headline_main: High Blood Pressure Tied to Pregnancy Loss

2018-04-06.abstract: That great war horse of the Chinese-restaurant menu, beef and broccoli, awaits.
2018-04-06.snippet: That great war horse of the Chinese-restaurant menu, beef and broccoli, awaits.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Good morning. I wrote about beef and broccoli for The Times this week, that great Chinese-restaurant menu war horse. And, thanks to the chef Jonathan Wu, with an assist from the chef Dale Talde, I managed to put together a beef and broccoli recipe (above) that I think could become a regular part of your weeknight dinner rotation. It is ridiculously good.
2018-04-06.headline_main: What to Cook This Weekend

2018-04-06.abstract: In “Never Remember,” Masha Gessen and Misha Friedman insist on the horrors of a Stalinist system that Russians today would rather deny or even praise.
2018-04-06.snippet: In “Never Remember,” Masha Gessen and Misha Friedman insist on the horrors of a Stalinist system that Russians today would rather deny or even praise.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: NEVER REMEMBER Searching for Stalin’s Gulags in Putin’s Russia By Masha Gessen Photographs by Misha Friedman 160 pp. Columbia Global Reports. $27.99.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Illuminating the Dark World of the Soviet Gulag, in Photos and Text

2018-04-06.abstract: The average property tax bill was up 3 percent in 2017, a new report says. And with the new tax law, experts are expecting more homeowners to fight back.
2018-04-06.snippet: The average property tax bill was up 3 percent in 2017, a new report says. And with the new tax law, experts are expecting more homeowners to fight back.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: If your property tax bills are increasing, you’re not alone.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Higher Property Taxes? You May Be Able to Appeal

2018-04-06.abstract: A divorced woman seeking no-strings-attached liaisons learns a sobering lesson about men and marriage.
2018-04-06.snippet: A divorced woman seeking no-strings-attached liaisons learns a sobering lesson about men and marriage.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: I’m not sure it’s possible to justify my liaisons with married men, but what I learned from having them warrants discussion. Not between the wives and me, though I would be interested to hear their side. No, this discussion should happen between wives and husbands, annually, the way we inspect the tire tread on the family car to avoid accidents.
2018-04-06.headline_main: What Sleeping With Married Men Taught Me About Infidelity

2018-04-06.abstract: Unabashedly packed with anchovy and garlic, bagna cauda works with vegetables, fish, eggs and even pasta.
2018-04-06.snippet: Unabashedly packed with anchovy and garlic, bagna cauda works with vegetables, fish, eggs and even pasta.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: You either love it, or you don’t. But honestly, it’s pretty easy to love bagna cauda.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A Dressing (or Dip) That’s Easy to Love

2018-04-06.abstract: In “No Turning Back,” Rania Abouzeid describes the people who suffer and endure in the Syrian civil war.
2018-04-06.snippet: In “No Turning Back,” Rania Abouzeid describes the people who suffer and endure in the Syrian civil war.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: NO TURNING BACK Life, Loss, and Hope in Wartime Syria By Rania Abouzeid 378 pp. W.W. Norton & Company. $26.95.
2018-04-06.headline_main: War Without End

2018-04-06.abstract: Victory could be difficult to verify, much less achieve, as the U.S. protests Beijing’s effort to retool Chinese industries for the 21st century.
2018-04-06.snippet: Victory could be difficult to verify, much less achieve, as the U.S. protests Beijing’s effort to retool Chinese industries for the 21st century.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — At the heart of the intensifying trade dispute between the United States and China is a fundamental question: Which country is more willing to endure short-term pain for the long-term gain of playing a leading role in high-tech industries.
2018-04-06.headline_main: U.S. and China Play Chicken on Trade, and Neither Swerves

2018-04-06.abstract: This week, Darius embarks on a typically impulsive jaunt that unexpectedly turns into a Southern gothic nightmare.
2018-04-06.snippet: This week, Darius embarks on a typically impulsive jaunt that unexpectedly turns into a Southern gothic nightmare.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: It might be best for all parties concerned if Al, Earn and Darius go back to just getting high on the couch. Lately, whenever they’ve ventured out of their living room, disaster has followed.
2018-04-06.headline_main: ‘Atlanta’ Season 2, Episode 6: Whatever Happened to Teddy Perkins?

2018-04-06.abstract: In which we consult the Book Review’s past to shed light on the books of the present. This week: Liesl Schillinger on Meg Wolitzer.
2018-04-06.snippet: In which we consult the Book Review’s past to shed light on the books of the present. This week: Liesl Schillinger on Meg Wolitzer.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Lena Dunham reviews Meg Wolitzer’s “The Female Persuasion” for this week’s cover. Five years ago, Liesl Schillinger reviewed “The Interestings” and considered Wolitzer’s place in American fiction. Below is an excerpt.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Notes From the Book Review Archives

2018-04-06.abstract: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2018-04-06.snippet: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Paperback Row

2018-04-06.abstract: An uncompromising artist, Mr. Taylor argued against reductive definitions of what a musician of his training and background could or should do.
2018-04-06.snippet: An uncompromising artist, Mr. Taylor argued against reductive definitions of what a musician of his training and background could or should do.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Cecil Taylor, a pianist who challenged the jazz tradition that produced him and became one of the most bracing, rhapsodic, abstract and original improvisers of his time, died on Thursday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 89.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Cecil Taylor, Pianist Who Defied Jazz Orthodoxy, Is Dead at 89

2018-04-06.abstract: The Bengsons are a folk-rock duo adapting their personal stories for the stage. But their new show, “The Lucky Ones,” posed a painful challenge: “Is it possible to tell the truth kindly?”
2018-04-06.snippet: The Bengsons are a folk-rock duo adapting their personal stories for the stage. But their new show, “The Lucky Ones,” posed a painful challenge: “Is it possible to tell the truth kindly?”
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: There’s a line near the start of the new musical “The Lucky Ones” that’s a deliberate hedge — an explanation of the rules of the show that also leaves those rules a little murky.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A Childhood Eden Seared by Violence. Set to Music?

2018-04-06.abstract: In Hungary and Poland, the liberal West used to be the promised land. Not anymore.
2018-04-06.snippet: In Hungary and Poland, the liberal West used to be the promised land. Not anymore.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Hungary had a horrendous 20th century of lost territory and freedom, but Budapest, a handsome city set on a broad sweep of the Danube, suggests its wounds have healed. Trams hum along boulevards lined with elegant cafes and clogged with the cars German companies manufacture here. The country has escaped what Milan Kundera, the Czech writer, called the “kidnapped West,” the great swath of Europe yielded to the Soviet empire after World War II, and has returned to the Western family.
2018-04-06.headline_main: How Democracy Became the Enemy

2018-04-06.abstract: The horror franchise’s newest installment is an origin tale featuring Marisa Tomei, Y’lan Noel and Lex Scott Davis.
2018-04-06.snippet: The horror franchise’s newest installment is an origin tale featuring Marisa Tomei, Y’lan Noel and Lex Scott Davis.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: “The First Purge” is actually the fourth “Purge.” Back in 2013, the original horror hit introduced the idea of an annual event in which all crime was legal for 12 hours in the United States, allowing people an outlet for their anger. The latest installment, which has just released its first full trailer, flashes back to show how the Purge began, with Marisa Tomei as its founder.
2018-04-06.headline_main: ‘The First Purge’ Trailer Hits Political Notes

2018-04-06.abstract: Norse sagas refer to “sunstones,” and new computer simulations shore up a hypothesis that they were used to guide ships as far as Greenland when weather was poor.
2018-04-06.snippet: Norse sagas refer to “sunstones,” and new computer simulations shore up a hypothesis that they were used to guide ships as far as Greenland when weather was poor.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: When the Vikings left the familiar fjords of Norway for icy, uncharted territories, they were at the mercy of weather. They had no magnetic compasses, and no way to ward off stretches of heavy clouds or fog that made it difficult to navigate by sun. How the explorers traversed open ocean during these times is a mystery that has long captivated scholars.
2018-04-06.headline_main: The Crystals That May Have Helped Vikings Navigate Northern Seas

2018-04-06.abstract: Can the Labour Party that welcomed my family have changed so much? I’m not sure.
2018-04-06.snippet: Can the Labour Party that welcomed my family have changed so much? I’m not sure.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: As I’ve read about the furor over anti-Semitism in Britain’s Labour Party, I’ve thought of my grandfather and wondered what he would have made of it.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Anti-Semitism and Britain’s Hall of Mirrors

2018-04-06.abstract: Food tastes different on a plane. An airline chef needs to take the effects of the dry cabin environment and the lower air pressure into account.
2018-04-06.snippet: Food tastes different on a plane. An airline chef needs to take the effects of the dry cabin environment and the lower air pressure into account.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: William Gillen, 53, is the director of culinary excellence for the North America region of LSG Sky Chefs, based in Irving, Tex.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Catering to Fliers’ Tastes at 30,000 Feet

2018-04-06.abstract: Subway riders have been overcompensating for delays, leading to a conundrum when the trains are on time: The subway’s been making people early.
2018-04-06.snippet: Subway riders have been overcompensating for delays, leading to a conundrum when the trains are on time: The subway’s been making people early.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Zach Emig has arrived so early to pick up his children at their Brooklyn elementary school that he has turned the cafeteria into his ad hoc congressional campaign office, working on speeches until school lets out.
2018-04-06.headline_main: The Subway Is So Late, It’s Making New Yorkers Early

2018-04-06.abstract: Jacqueline Winspear was mired in London gridlock when her beloved fictional detective, Maisie Dobbs, popped into her head.
2018-04-06.snippet: Jacqueline Winspear was mired in London gridlock when her beloved fictional detective, Maisie Dobbs, popped into her head.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Jacqueline Winspear was mired in London gridlock back in 2001 when her fictional detective, Maisie Dobbs, popped into her head. “Stoplights were at red as far as I could see,” the novelist remembers. “In my mind’s eye I saw a woman walk up the old wooden escalator at the Warren Street underground station, dressed in the garb of the mid-1920s. She spoke to the newspaper vendor, then made her way along the street to a building, where she took an envelope with two keys from her bag ... I was shaken out of my daydream by honking from cars stuck behind me. I could not wait to get home to start writing.” Maisie Dobbs — nurse turned private eye — now has a devoted following (Hillary Clinton is a fan), and the 14th book in the series, “To Die but Once,” debuts at No. 5 on the fiction list.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A Traffic Jam Changed Her Life

2018-04-06.abstract: Yes, it’s never been more crowded or more frustrating. But at the same time: How cool is the J train at sunset?
2018-04-06.snippet: Yes, it’s never been more crowded or more frustrating. But at the same time: How cool is the J train at sunset?
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: The New York City subway system includes more than 6,000 cars and 665 miles of track, but when you’re riding it, every inch can seem like an epic journey. Is your express train making all local stops? Are you being held in the station because of an earlier incident? Or maybe the guy in the next seat finally achieved a 180-degree manspread. What time is it? C’mon, man. It’s always showtime.
2018-04-06.headline_main: The Miracle, After All, of the Subway

2018-04-06.abstract: The star tenor, along with Camilla Nylund and Andris Nelsons, discussed the opera’s long love duet, which they will perform at Carnegie Hall on April 12.
2018-04-06.snippet: The star tenor, along with Camilla Nylund and Andris Nelsons, discussed the opera’s long love duet, which they will perform at Carnegie Hall on April 12.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — The love duet at the heart of Wagner’s “Tristan und Isolde” makes little sense. Breathless ecstasy is conveyed through made-up, often bafflingly long words as the titular lovers declare their devotion — over and over — for 40 minutes.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Jonas Kaufmann: Wagner’s ‘Tristan’ Is ‘Like a Drug’

2018-04-06.abstract: When disaster knocks out cell towers, gas-powered drones can restore service. Verizon and AT&T are experimenting with the technology.
2018-04-06.snippet: When disaster knocks out cell towers, gas-powered drones can restore service. Verizon and AT&T are experimenting with the technology.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Law enforcement and emergency responders have been using drones to give them an eye in the sky for years. But the unmanned aerial vehicles may soon provide ears as well. Two of the country’s largest mobile phone companies are exploring using drones as flying mobile hot spots to provide phone and other services when cell towers are down or in areas where service does not exist.
2018-04-06.headline_main: It’s Not a Bird or a Plane. It’s a 17-Foot Drone, and It’s Here to Save Your Cellphone Service.

2018-04-06.abstract: Asparagus has a short season and high esteem among cooks. Set off its delicate flavor with classic ingredients and bursts of tanginess.
2018-04-06.snippet: Asparagus has a short season and high esteem among cooks. Set off its delicate flavor with classic ingredients and bursts of tanginess.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: In Britain, where I live, asparagus is a god among vegetables. It is greeted with real reverence in spring, as if nothing worth eating has been available for months. With a deep sigh of relief at the end of a long winter of roots, cabbages and more roots, we finally spot those fresh green shoots, and everybody is happy.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A God Among Vegetables

2018-04-06.abstract: How do you stop sabotaging your own happiness? The Sugars Advise.
2018-04-06.snippet: How do you stop sabotaging your own happiness? The Sugars Advise.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: How do you stop sabotaging your own happiness? The Sugars Advise.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Listen to ‘Dear Sugars’

2018-04-06.abstract: Putting borrowers into income-based repayment plans can help — but that decision can be arbitrary, and lenders aren’t sufficiently supervised.
2018-04-06.snippet: Putting borrowers into income-based repayment plans can help — but that decision can be arbitrary, and lenders aren’t sufficiently supervised.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Student loans are central to financing college educations, yet millions of borrowers are in default. That is clear evidence that the system is in dire need of improvement.
2018-04-06.headline_main: How to Clean Up the Student Loan Mess

2018-04-06.abstract: New Rochelle High had three incidents, including a fatal stabbing, in just nine days, leaving the unusually diverse school to figure out the best way to respond.
2018-04-06.snippet: New Rochelle High had three incidents, including a fatal stabbing, in just nine days, leaving the unusually diverse school to figure out the best way to respond.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: NEW ROCHELLE — Just before 3 p.m. on a recent Tuesday, a line of cars pulled up in front of New Rochelle High School and waited for its students to pour out into the afternoon sun. There was an old Honda Odyssey and a black Cadillac Escalade. A dingy Toyota Camry idled near a sparkling Audi A5 and a row of short yellow school buses.
2018-04-06.headline_main: After Violence, a High School Tries to Regain Its Balance

2018-04-06.abstract: In a spate of recent incidents, experts have questioned the authenticity of works said to have been painted by the Russian masters of the period.
2018-04-06.snippet: In a spate of recent incidents, experts have questioned the authenticity of works said to have been painted by the Russian masters of the period.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: WIESBADEN, Germany — Multiple art experts were brought in as witnesses here in a case, decided last month, of two men accused of having trafficked in hundreds of forged paintings, all said to have been created by masters of the Russian avant-garde.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Unknown or Unreal? The Shadow on Some Russian Avant-Garde Art

2018-04-06.abstract: Barry Levinson directed this film about the Penn State sex-abuse scandal and the downfall of the university’s legendary football coach, Joe Paterno.
2018-04-06.snippet: Barry Levinson directed this film about the Penn State sex-abuse scandal and the downfall of the university’s legendary football coach, Joe Paterno.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: HBO’s “Paterno” is a film about a real-life sex-abuse scandal in which the abuser and the abused are relegated to supporting roles. A dogged reporter (Riley Keough) and one brave victim (Benjamin Cook) get a fair bit of screen time to help fill in the historical record, but they’re not at the center of the story. Jerry Sandusky, the perpetrator, is relegated to a cameo.

2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Like a lot of golfers, I’m rooting for Tiger Woods this weekend, even though I don’t really expect him to win another Masters. He was 1-over at the end of the first round, seven shots off the lead. But that he’s there at all seems a near miracle. This is the same Tiger Woods who not so very long ago was playing in agonizing pain, spraying the ball all over the place, flubbing his chip shots, misjudging his putts. He’s 42 years old now, he’s losing his hair, his knees ache, he’s had so many spine surgeries his back must look as if he’s had a zipper installed.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Tiger Woods, Nearly Human

2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: The rose-themed third issue of Pleasure Garden magazine abounds with flower porn: Blush-pink petals spill out of a sculptural table arrangement, wilted bouquets decorate horses’ manes, a long-stem rose emerges from a pair of perky butt cheeks. Named after the pleasure gardens of 18th-century London — cradles of art, society and sex — the biannual British publication was conceived in 2017 to reframe the narrative around gardens and plants. “I wanted to do a magazine that didn’t tell people how to prune and grow things, but to delight in the art of the garden,” says John Tebbs, the magazine’s editor in chief and a professional gardener for 15 years. To that end, the third issue of Pleasure Garden is a 200-page rumination on the rose. One article unpacks the myth of a rose-loving empress, another captures a flower-filled parade during the Portland Rose Festival and a third visits the artist Robert Tatin’s eccentric concrete sculpture garden in Northwest France. “There is so much beauty within gardens and the natural world that I am never short of inspiration,” says Tebbs. Available online on April 18 and at Totokaelo in New York on May 19, thegardenedit.com — ZIO BARITAUX
2018-04-06.headline_main: 6 Things T Editors Like Right Now

2018-04-06.snippet: Congress created a fix-it fund for borrowers in the public service loan forgiveness plan. Many categories of educators, lawyers and others are ineligible.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Two weeks ago, Congress created a $350 million pot of money to help teachers, firefighters and others in public service who thought they were enrolled in a program that would forgive their student loans after 10 years of payments. Many of them were not getting credit for their loan payments after all.
2018-04-06.headline_main: A $350 Million Fund Helps Many Public Servants. Meet the Ones Left Out.

2018-04-06.snippet: Two experts testified Yoselyn Ortega was too psychotic to grasp her actions when she killed two children, but a prosecutor challenged their analyses.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: After hours of unrelenting questioning and a number of heated exchanges with the prosecutor, a psychiatrist testifying this week on behalf of a nanny who stabbed two small children in her care finally turned to the judge and wearily asked for a break.

2018-04-06.abstract: A growing percentage of medical devices and drugs used in American operating rooms are made in China, and many of them are on the White House’s list.
2018-04-06.snippet: A growing percentage of medical devices and drugs used in American operating rooms are made in China, and many of them are on the White House’s list.

2018-04-06.headline_main: Why Trump’s Tariffs Could Raise the Cost of a Hip Replacement

2018-04-06.abstract: Representative Blake Farenthold of Texas, who settled a sexual harassment case with $84,000 in taxpayer funds, abruptly resigned from Congress on Friday.
2018-04-06.snippet: Representative Blake Farenthold of Texas, who settled a sexual harassment case with $84,000 in taxpayer funds, abruptly resigned from Congress on Friday.
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative Blake Farenthold, the Texas Republican who used $84,000 in taxpayer funds to settle a sexual harassment case with his former communications director, abruptly resigned from Congress on Friday afternoon.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Texas Congressman Who Settled Harassment Case With Taxpayer Funds Resigns

2018-04-06.abstract: A more or less unbelievable performance
2018-04-06.snippet: A more or less unbelievable performance
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: I’m an aging baby boomer, raised to believe that good music ended sometime in the 1970s. But around 2010 I discovered that this is anything but true — if anything, the end of the CD era and the shift to live performance as a source of income has brought on a renaissance of incredibly talented musicians. If anything I worry that there’s too much good music out there — how can all of those who deserve to make it?
2018-04-06.headline_main: Friday Night Music: Samantha Fish

2018-04-06.abstract: With Hayao Miyazaki, Mr. Takahata founded Japan’s premier anime studio, Ghibli, and directed sophisticated films like “Grave of the Fireflies.”
2018-04-06.snippet: With Hayao Miyazaki, Mr. Takahata founded Japan’s premier anime studio, Ghibli, and directed sophisticated films like “Grave of the Fireflies.”
2018-04-06.lead_paragraph: Isao Takahata, a film director who founded Japan’s premier animation studio, Studio Ghibli, with Hayao Miyazaki in 1985 and made sophisticated animated films like the elegiac World War II drama “Grave of the Fireflies,” died early Thursday in Tokyo. He was 82.
2018-04-06.headline_main: Isao Takahata, Leader in Japanese Animation, Dies at 82

2018-04-07.abstract: Two Republican state senators said this week that they would support expansion, enough votes to pass a widely popular proposal.
2018-04-07.snippet: Two Republican state senators said this week that they would support expansion, enough votes to pass a widely popular proposal.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Elections have consequences, goes the old saw, and in Virginia a Democratic wave in November remade the political landscape on one of the state’s longest-running and most contentious issues: whether to expand Medicaid to 400,000 low-income residents.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Virginia Is Close to Expanding Medicaid After Years of Republican Opposition

2018-04-07.abstract: In his inaugural speech, the new Fed chairman tried to focus on the strength of the economy even as a spiraling tariff battle with China spooked investors.
2018-04-07.snippet: In his inaugural speech, the new Fed chairman tried to focus on the strength of the economy even as a spiraling tariff battle with China spooked investors.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: The rapidly escalating trade conflict with China has upended the prevailing economic dynamic of falling unemployment and faster growth, leaving policymakers and investors scrambling to figure out the way forward.
2018-04-07.headline_main: More Jobs, Faster Growth and Now, the Threat of a Trade War

2018-04-07.abstract: Saheed Vassell, a black man, was killed by gunfire from four officers. Two of them were white, one was black, and one was Indian, the police said.
2018-04-07.snippet: Saheed Vassell, a black man, was killed by gunfire from four officers. Two of them were white, one was black, and one was Indian, the police said.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Two days after police officers in Brooklyn shot and killed a man holding a slim metal pipe as if it were a gun, the police offered the first information about the officers involved and released 911 call transcripts, though some details of what happened in the moments before the shooting remained hazy.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Police Release First Details of Officers Who Shot Man in Brooklyn

2018-04-07.abstract: The ousted national security adviser, who departed the White House on Friday, broke with President Trump on Syria and Russia, but sought to hold the line for his commander in chief.
2018-04-07.snippet: The ousted national security adviser, who departed the White House on Friday, broke with President Trump on Syria and Russia, but sought to hold the line for his commander in chief.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s national security adviser, Lt. Gen. H. R. McMaster, handed off his duties to John R. Bolton on Friday, a bittersweet departure from the White House in which he played down personal animosities with Mr. Trump but left little doubt that he and the president had differences on issues like Syria and Russia.
2018-04-07.headline_main: For McMaster, Pomp Under Bittersweet Circumstances

2018-04-07.abstract: Trump’s inability to find legal representation is only the latest sign that elites don’t support him.
2018-04-07.snippet: Trump’s inability to find legal representation is only the latest sign that elites don’t support him.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: In what is becoming one of the most remarkable chapters in American legal history, the president of the United States is in serious need of top-notch legal help, but apparently cannot find top-notch lawyers to represent him.

2018-04-07.abstract: The president’s rhetoric suggests he’s moving America toward a trade war with China. But what will he actually do?
2018-04-07.snippet: The president’s rhetoric suggests he’s moving America toward a trade war with China. But what will he actually do?
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s recent threat to escalate his trade skirmish with China into a full-scale trade war is a foolish gambit with little historical precedent. It is also hard to take seriously, given how quickly Mr. Trump changes his mind and how rarely and clumsily he tends to follow through on tough talk.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Putting Trump’s Trade Bombast to the Test

2018-04-07.abstract: By withdrawing from Syria, he is abdicating America’s role in achieving peace in the region.
2018-04-07.snippet: By withdrawing from Syria, he is abdicating America’s role in achieving peace in the region.

2018-04-07.headline_main: Is Trump Sowing the Seeds for ISIS 2.0?

2018-04-07.abstract: Experts said the much-criticized decision might have been made because there are not many curators and academics of African-American or African descent who specialize in African arts.

2018-04-07.abstract: Are they a good thing? Yes. We should be happy that grace is still considered a goal of fair play.
2018-04-07.snippet: Are they a good thing? Yes. We should be happy that grace is still considered a goal of fair play.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: One day earlier this week, the Minnesota Twins were pounding the Baltimore Orioles 7-0 in the ninth inning when Chance Sisco, one of the Orioles’ rookies, bunted for a hit. Bunting when you’re that far behind (or ahead) and it’s that late in the game is a violation. Not an official violation, but it goes against one of baseball’s many unwritten rules.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Baseball’s Unwritten Rules

2018-04-07.abstract: Reed shot a six-under-par 66 and held a two-stroke lead over Marc Leishman. Lurking behind them were eight major winners, while Tiger Woods barely made the cut.

2018-04-07.snippet: President Trump’s new national security adviser mislabels a preventive attack plan, which would be illegal, as a more permissible pre-emptive strike.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: John Bolton will assume office Monday with his first controversy as President Trump’s national security adviser awaiting him. Six weeks ago, he outlined his advocacy of an attack on North Korea in a Wall Street Journal op-ed titled “The Legal Case for Striking North Korea First.”
2018-04-07.headline_main: Bolton’s Illegal War Plan for North Korea

2018-04-07.abstract: Mark Diehl serves us a chewy, spicy snack.

There are debuts galore, unfamiliar “notable names,” and endearing but hardly simple running references to noshing. As icing on the cake, it’s a pangram; every letter appears at least once in the grid.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Little Firecracker

2018-04-07.abstract: From Italy, a different type of immigrant story.
2018-04-07.snippet: From Italy, a different type of immigrant story.

I’d say there are millions of such stories across Europe.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Risotto From Sri Lanka Is Just as Good

2018-04-07.snippet: Kids will keep Juuling until we make vaping as uncool as smoking. Is the Juul craze almost over? Probably not!
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: When Brennan McDermott was an underclassman at Simsbury High in Connecticut, he found himself in a timeless situation, familiar to watchers of horny 1980s comedies and after-school specials alike. “A couple of my buddies were like, ‘Hey, let’s go to the bathroom,’” said Mr. McDermott, now Simsbury’s senior class president. “I was like, ‘Whoa, what’s going on here?!’ I got kind of uncomfortable with it. They were all passing it around. I didn’t take it.”

2018-04-07.abstract: Home to one of the world’s oldest and, in centuries past, biggest Jewish communities, Bukhara, Uzbekistan, now has only 100 to 150 Jews clinging to the faith in this fabled city.

2018-04-07.headline_main: In Bukhara, 10,000 Jewish Graves but Just 150 Jews

2018-04-07.abstract: The British capital has witnessed an average of more than three killings a week this year, prompting alarm and political argument.

2018-04-07.abstract: Skate parks, once considered a menace, are booming everywhere around the world. Now we head toward the first skateboarding Olympics.
2018-04-07.snippet: Skate parks, once considered a menace, are booming everywhere around the world. Now we head toward the first skateboarding Olympics.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: In July 1995, the artist Maura Sheehan installed a skateable sculpture in the anchorage of the Brooklyn Bridge, over on the Brooklyn side. Ms. Sheehan became fascinated with skateboarders after observing large groups of them careening through the streets downtown in the era before 9/11.

2018-04-07.abstract: A Princeton sociologist chronicled the human toll of eviction in one city in a 2016 book. A new project may reveal just how widespread the problem is.

2018-04-07.abstract: After paying $750 for a roof deck and other amenities that haven’t been completed, a tenant would like the money back.
2018-04-07.snippet: After paying $750 for a roof deck and other amenities that haven’t been completed, a tenant would like the money back.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Q: Last spring, my girlfriend and I signed a two-year lease on new construction in Brooklyn. In November, we paid a $750-a-year amenity fee to use the gym, pool and outdoor space because we were told that all the features — including a business center, party room, dog run and roof deck — would be available soon. But it took months for some of these features to open, and some, like the roof deck, still aren’t ready. Our lease does not hold the owner liable for delays, and the agreement, which we signed with the company that operates the amenities, does not list completion dates. Yet we’re paying for services we cannot use. Do we have any recourse to recoup the $750 fee we paid?
2018-04-07.headline_main: Should a Landlord Refund a Fee for Amenities That Aren’t Available Yet?

2018-04-07.abstract: Saporè DownTown is an intriguingly experimental contemporary pizzeria that is easy to miss — but make sure you don’t.
2018-04-07.snippet: Saporè DownTown is an intriguingly experimental contemporary pizzeria that is easy to miss — but make sure you don’t.

2018-04-07.headline_main: In Verona, Pizza That Is All About the Crust

2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Entering the ring marks the end of one battle and the beginning of another, one that can feel simpler to Heather Hardy than life’s day-to-day struggles. People often ask Ms. Hardy: Doesn’t it hurt to fight?
2018-04-07.headline_main: ‘I Love to Fight. I Live to Fight.’

2018-04-07.abstract: Viktor Orban’s campaign for another term as Hungary’s prime minister has been dominated by false news stories, dirty tricks and perceived enemies all around.

2018-04-07.snippet: A number of teams will stage cheerleading auditions this weekend and many women will try out. But in a #MeToo world, rigid rules and meager pay may be coming under more scrutiny.

2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: FAYETTEVILLE, N.C. — The state of North Carolina paid $750,000 to Henry McCollum in 2015 to compensate him for the 30 years that he, an innocent man, spent on death row.

2018-04-07.abstract: Dear Sugars returns to Portland, Ore., for another raucous and uplifting live show. The Sugars answer letters and questions from the audience with the special guest Omar El Akkad.
2018-04-07.snippet: Dear Sugars returns to Portland, Ore., for another raucous and uplifting live show. The Sugars answer letters and questions from the audience with the special guest Omar El Akkad.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Dear Sugars returns to Portland, Ore., for another raucous and uplifting live show. The Sugars get a surprising update from a letter writer from their past; discuss a new letter with a special guest, Omar El Akkad; and ask the audience, “What’s the ‘bad story’ you tell yourself?”
2018-04-07.headline_main: Listen to ‘Dear Sugars’ Live: A Night of Bad Stories

2018-04-07.abstract: Big corporations — giant retailers and health insurance companies — are teaming up to become your doctor.
2018-04-07.snippet: Big corporations — giant retailers and health insurance companies — are teaming up to become your doctor.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Is the doctor in?
2018-04-07.headline_main: The Disappearing Doctor: How Mega-Mergers Are Changing the Business of Medical Care

2018-04-07.abstract: How did ISIS stay in power for so long? Grace Jones vulnerable? Maybe. Martin Luther King Jr. 50 years after his assassination. And more.
2018-04-07.snippet: How did ISIS stay in power for so long? Grace Jones vulnerable? Maybe. Martin Luther King Jr. 50 years after his assassination. And more.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the weekend. Is it spring yet? Doesn’t look like it from where I’m sitting. If it’s still too cold (wet, dark, snowy) for a morning stroll, no worries. We’ve got stories for you. Some are serious (about ISIS and private prisons) some are less so (imagining travel in Wakanda and sitting down with Grace Jones). Pick one or all 11. Who knows, by the time you’re finished reading, the sun might be out.
2018-04-07.headline_main: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

2018-04-07.abstract: A new study found that male college students expressed greater confidence in their own abilities than their female classmates did.
2018-04-07.snippet: A new study found that male college students expressed greater confidence in their own abilities than their female classmates did.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: It’s no secret that men are overrepresented in certain technical disciplines. So is their self-confidence, a new study suggests.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Do Men Think They’re Better at Science Than Women Do? Well, Actually …

2018-04-07.abstract: Mr. Khan’s bail was set at some $1,500. His lawyers also called for the suspension of a five-year prison sentence delivered on Thursday.
2018-04-07.snippet: Mr. Khan’s bail was set at some $1,500. His lawyers also called for the suspension of a five-year prison sentence delivered on Thursday.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — The Bollywood star Salman Khan was granted bail on Saturday while he appealed a conviction for killing two rare antelopes, which came with a five-year jail sentence. It’s a further twist in a case that has gone on for almost two decades.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Salman Khan, Bollywood Superstar, Gets Bail After Poaching Conviction

2018-04-07.abstract: The death of Judge Stephen Reinhardt, combined with other vacancies, gives President Trump a chance to remake a court that has bedeviled him.
2018-04-07.snippet: The death of Judge Stephen Reinhardt, combined with other vacancies, gives President Trump a chance to remake a court that has bedeviled him.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the spring of 2014, a friend tried to nudge Judge Stephen Reinhardt, then an 83-year-old liberal stalwart on the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, into stepping aside from full-time duties so President Barack Obama could nominate a successor.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Judge’s Death Gives Trump a Chance to Remake a Vexing Court

2018-04-07.abstract: Ms. Childs used to be the antithesis of Martha Graham. But now she’s reworking a 1999 dance in a way that synthesizes their approaches.
2018-04-07.snippet: Ms. Childs used to be the antithesis of Martha Graham. But now she’s reworking a 1999 dance in a way that synthesizes their approaches.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: One summer during the early 1960s, Lucinda Childs signed up for a master class with Martha Graham at Connecticut College. Graham’s expressive modern dance wasn’t to Ms. Childs’s taste — she was really there to study with the avant-garde choreographer Merce Cunningham — but what dancer would turn down such an experience?
2018-04-07.headline_main: Lucinda Childs Gets Off the Floor in Piece for the Graham Company

2018-04-07.abstract: Courts have found his orders on lead paint, pesticides and other issues to be poorly crafted, and have struck them down.
2018-04-07.snippet: Courts have found his orders on lead paint, pesticides and other issues to be poorly crafted, and have struck them down.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As ethical questions threaten the Environmental Protection Agency administrator, Scott Pruitt, President Trump has defended him with a persuasive conservative argument: Mr. Pruitt is doing a great job at what he was hired to do, roll back regulations.
2018-04-07.headline_main: In His Haste to Roll Back Rules, Scott Pruitt, E.P.A. Chief, Risks His Agenda

2018-04-07.abstract: Miso chicken, chicken scaloppine, and more recipes for the weekend.
2018-04-07.snippet: Miso chicken, chicken scaloppine, and more recipes for the weekend.

2018-04-07.headline_main: Our 15 Most Popular Chicken Thigh Recipes

2018-04-07.abstract: Here’s all our stories, photos, explainers, profiles, wedding announcements, and tales of infidelity all in one place.
2018-04-07.snippet: Here’s all our stories, photos, explainers, profiles, wedding announcements, and tales of infidelity all in one place.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Amos Barshad dives into the extreme attachment teens feel for the Juul, the market’s most popular vaping hardware. Juul has more than half the market share in e-cigarettes — exceeding the ownership Marlboro once had for the cigarette market. As documented elsewhere in our fine institution recently, schools and parents can’t even begin to confront the meme-friendly juggernaut that is the Juul. Now we talk to the actual kids who love Juuling. In class mostly. :/
2018-04-07.headline_main: Everything to See, Read, Feel, and Learn this Weekend

2018-04-07.abstract: There were life-size prop horses and a trove of guitars, paintings and jewelry among the 227 lots put up for sale at Sotheby’s Australia on Saturday.
2018-04-07.snippet: There were life-size prop horses and a trove of guitars, paintings and jewelry among the 227 lots put up for sale at Sotheby’s Australia on Saturday.

2018-04-07.abstract: A creative community gathers around the stage at LayeRhythm, an occasional party where random ideas turn into music and movement.
2018-04-07.snippet: A creative community gathers around the stage at LayeRhythm, an occasional party where random ideas turn into music and movement.

2018-04-07.abstract: The civil rights leader answered questions about his experience in the struggle for equal rights and the current state of the nation.
2018-04-07.snippet: The civil rights leader answered questions about his experience in the struggle for equal rights and the current state of the nation.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: In an Op-Ed article this week, the Rev. Jesse Jackson wrote about the need to remember the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. as a radical, ecumenical, antiwar, pro-immigrant and scholarly champion of the poor. Readers shared their own reminiscences about Dr. King and their thoughts on the changes in the country since his assassination 50 years ago. Here are some of their comments and Mr. Jackson’s responses. — The Editors
2018-04-07.headline_main: Jesse Jackson on Race Relations, Trump and the Right to Vote

2018-04-07.abstract: The site has been under increasing pressure in recent years, partly because it featured ads that included what child advocates said were code words for underage girls.
2018-04-07.snippet: The site has been under increasing pressure in recent years, partly because it featured ads that included what child advocates said were code words for underage girls.

2018-04-07.headline_main: U.S. Seizes Backpage.com, a Site Accused of Enabling Prostitution

2018-04-07.abstract: Two were killed and about 20 injured on Saturday after a vehicle crashed into a group of people in the heart of the old city, the police said. The driver, a German citizen, killed himself afterward.
2018-04-07.snippet: Two were killed and about 20 injured on Saturday after a vehicle crashed into a group of people in the heart of the old city, the police said. The driver, a German citizen, killed himself afterward.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Two people were killed and about 20 injured on Saturday in Münster, in western Germany, after the driver of a small truck crashed into a group of people in the heart of the old city, the police said.
2018-04-07.headline_main: 2 Dead in Münster, Germany, After Truck Driver Crashes Into Crowd

2018-04-07.abstract: This diagramless grid by David Steinberg is definitely a puzzle.
2018-04-07.snippet: This diagramless grid by David Steinberg is definitely a puzzle.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — I would never, ever have filled in this blank grid correctly without the use of graph paper on the side. David Steinberg has created a tightly clued theme puzzle, with four long entries related to a very specific painting, by an artist whom I particularly adore (and have drawn from to illustrate this column in the past).
2018-04-07.headline_main: Variety: Diagramless Crossword

2018-04-07.abstract: For Gazans, even a tentative experiment with nonviolent protest is a significant step.
2018-04-07.snippet: For Gazans, even a tentative experiment with nonviolent protest is a significant step.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — The “Friday of Tires” protest ended with another nine Palestinians killed along the fence hemming in Gaza despite a smokescreen of burning rubber and a second round of international criticism over Israel’s use of lethal force.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Though Deadly, Gaza Protests Draw Attention and Enthusiasm

2018-04-07.abstract: President Trump is moving to fulfill one of his central campaign promises, but a get-tough stance with China could reverberate badly in the nation’s heartland.
2018-04-07.snippet: President Trump is moving to fulfill one of his central campaign promises, but a get-tough stance with China could reverberate badly in the nation’s heartland.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As President Trump moves to fulfill one of the central promises of his campaign — to get tough on an ascendant China — he faces a potential rebellion from a core constituency: farmers and other agricultural producers who could suffer devastating losses in a trade war.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Farmers’ Anger at Trump Tariffs Puts Republican Candidates in a Bind

2018-04-07.abstract: Why did an Afghan polio patient shoot a Spanish physiotherapist in the heart last year? The motive is still a mystery.
2018-04-07.snippet: Why did an Afghan polio patient shoot a Spanish physiotherapist in the heart last year? The motive is still a mystery.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: MAZAR-I-SHARIF, Afghanistan — Mohammad Nasim knew he would not be searched at the gates of the International Committee of the Red Cross orthopedic center because he was a polio patient who had been going there for 19 years.
2018-04-07.headline_main: He Killed a Red Cross Worker: ‘I Will Go to Hell for What I Did’

2018-04-07.abstract: Kenneth Lonergan’s adaptation of the E.M. Forster novel delivers a bracing, and contemporary, vision of a tale about class, money and sexual mores.
2018-04-07.snippet: Kenneth Lonergan’s adaptation of the E.M. Forster novel delivers a bracing, and contemporary, vision of a tale about class, money and sexual mores.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: GODALMING, England — With a surprisingly cheerful air, the director Hettie Macdonald surveyed the damply gray British version of a spring day. “What can you do?’” she said. “It’s England!”
2018-04-07.headline_main: A ‘Howards End’ True to Then and Now

2018-04-07.abstract: The writer Abe Streep describes his year with the Flathead Indian Reservation basketball team as they struggled with a cluster of suicides.
2018-04-07.snippet: The writer Abe Streep describes his year with the Flathead Indian Reservation basketball team as they struggled with a cluster of suicides.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: In March 2017, I was on a reporting trip, traveling through Montana’s Flathead Indian Reservation. I saw a sign in Arlee, a small town in the foothills of the spectacular Mission Range, indicating that the boys’ high school basketball team, the Warriors, had won a state championship. I proposed a profile of its star, Phillip Malatare, who was then a junior, to my editor at The Times Magazine, Charles Homans. The plan was to follow Phil, a Division I prospect, as he tried to reach a college program.
2018-04-07.headline_main: When There’s More to the Story Than Basketball

2018-04-07.abstract: At 6 feet 5 inches and 220 pounds, he was intimidating on the ice. Now he has the final say on league suspensions and fines for infractions.
2018-04-07.snippet: At 6 feet 5 inches and 220 pounds, he was intimidating on the ice. Now he has the final say on league suspensions and fines for infractions.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: George Parros has an Ivy League degree in economics, but he made a living for nine years as an N.H.L. enforcer, protecting his teammates by being willing to drop his gloves.
2018-04-07.headline_main: George Parros Used to be an N.H.L. Enforcer. Now He’s in Charge of Player Safety.

2018-04-07.abstract: Emails reviewed by The Times show that the tour company whose helicopter crashed into the East River was aware of concerns over its equipment.
2018-04-07.snippet: Emails reviewed by The Times show that the tour company whose helicopter crashed into the East River was aware of concerns over its equipment.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: For months before an open-sided helicopter capsized in the East River, drowning five passengers who had been strapped inside, pilots for the company that operated the flight warned their bosses about dangerous conditions, including equipment that could make escape difficult.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Months Before Deadly Crash, Helicopter Pilots Warned of Safety Issues

2018-04-07.abstract: How racist federal policy brought Jim Crow to housing in the North.
2018-04-07.snippet: How racist federal policy brought Jim Crow to housing in the North.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Ben Carson, the secretary of housing and urban development, showed utter contempt for his agency’s core mission last month when he proposed deleting the phrase “free from discrimination”  from the HUD mission statement. Yet Mr. Carson is not the first housing secretary to betray the landmark Fair Housing Act of 1968 — which turns 50 years old this week — by failing to enforce policies designed to prevent states and cities from using federal dollars to perpetuate segregation.
2018-04-07.headline_main: America’s Federally Financed Ghettos

2018-04-07.abstract: They’re not just short on textbooks. They’re crumbling. They lack tornado shelters in Oklahoma and aren’t built to withstand earthquakes in Utah.
2018-04-07.snippet: They’re not just short on textbooks. They’re crumbling. They lack tornado shelters in Oklahoma and aren’t built to withstand earthquakes in Utah.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Last week, thousands of teachers in Oklahoma and Kentucky walked out of their classrooms. West Virginia teachers did the same thing in February, and Arizona may be next. They are protesting state governments that are failing to pay teachers a decent wage, replace outdated textbooks, ensure manageable class sizes and fix school buildings in need of repair.
2018-04-07.headline_main: America’s Deathtrap Schools

2018-04-07.abstract: Education advocates outline the ways to keep the less than wealthy on track for a degree.
2018-04-07.snippet: Education advocates outline the ways to keep the less than wealthy on track for a degree.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2018-04-07.headline_main: College for the Disadvantaged

2018-04-07.abstract: I have spent a lifetime in education. Now I am dying. There are a few things I want to get off my chest.
2018-04-07.snippet: I have spent a lifetime in education. Now I am dying. There are a few things I want to get off my chest.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: This time of year, there’s a lot of optimism in the air about college. As acceptance notices come in, it seems like the smartest, hardest-working young people with the greatest potential are being matched to institutions of higher learning that will prepare them for success and promote a free and open society. We might conclude that colleges are greasing the gears of social mobility, which have slowed as of late.
2018-04-07.headline_main: How to Level the College Playing Field

2018-04-07.abstract: A group of philosophers is trying to persuade the courts to rule on this question.
2018-04-07.snippet: A group of philosophers is trying to persuade the courts to rule on this question.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: You might be aware that chimpanzees can recognize themselves in a mirror, communicate through sign language, pursue goals creatively and form long-lasting friendships. You might also think that these are the kinds of things that a person can do. However, you might not think of chimpanzees as persons.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Should Chimpanzees Be Considered ‘Persons’?

2018-04-07.abstract: My Proustian madeleine, the thing that brought back the Belgrade of my childhood, was the Marlboros my mother smoked (even while I was in utero — it was the ’80s).
2018-04-07.snippet: My Proustian madeleine, the thing that brought back the Belgrade of my childhood, was the Marlboros my mother smoked (even while I was in utero — it was the ’80s).
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: When I was 5, the night before we left Yugoslavia and a few years before that country embarked on the Balkan wars and eventually dissolved, my mother put me to bed. Before starting on the hour of lullabies I demanded, out of nowhere she said, “The smells of your childhood will always stay with you and will make you remember home.”
2018-04-07.headline_main: Smells Like Home

2018-04-07.abstract: Hearts melt seeing the wildlife in the Dzanga Sangha rain forest. But is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering?
2018-04-07.snippet: Hearts melt seeing the wildlife in the Dzanga Sangha rain forest. But is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering?
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: BAYANGA, Central African Republic —   The cutest primates on earth may be Inguka and Inganda, gorilla toddler twins who playfully tumble over each other here in the vast Dzanga Sangha rain forest, one of the best places to see gorillas, antelopes and elephants play.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Choosing Animals Over People?

2018-04-07.abstract: He has the power to protect Facebook users and reform the online ecosystem.
2018-04-07.snippet: He has the power to protect Facebook users and reform the online ecosystem.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: The news about Facebook is not getting better. The company has sharply increased the number of users whose data was improperly shared with an outside company connected to President Trump’s campaign, to possibly 87 million. Amid an outcry, Mark Zuckerberg, the company’s chief executive, is expected to testify before Congress on Tuesday and Wednesday.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Mark Zuckerberg Can Still Fix This Mess

2018-04-07.abstract: One of the best things about pets is convincing yourself that they share your taste.
2018-04-07.snippet: One of the best things about pets is convincing yourself that they share your taste.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: On the morning after Thanksgiving, I woke up to a text from my boyfriend. He was spending the holiday with his family in New Jersey while I was with mine in Massachusetts. It was a picture of a parakeet in a blue wire cage, the recognizable brick wall of our living room in the background. “Meet our new daughter” was all he wrote.
2018-04-07.headline_main: My Parakeet Loves RuPaul

2018-04-07.abstract: The Senate race in Texas just might be the happiest political fable ever.
2018-04-07.snippet: The Senate race in Texas just might be the happiest political fable ever.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Count me among the swelling ranks of the infatuated. I, too, have been Beto-struck.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Watch Out, Ted Cruz. Beto Is Coming.

2018-04-07.abstract: Why would a woman go home with a man, decide she’s not attracted to him but have sex with him anyway?
2018-04-07.snippet: Why would a woman go home with a man, decide she’s not attracted to him but have sex with him anyway?
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — I’ve noticed a weird pattern, in fiction and life, about sexual encounters: Women decide they’re not attracted to a guy they’re nestling with. Limerence is not in the cards. But they go ahead and have sex anyhow.
2018-04-07.headline_main: What’s Lust Got to Do With It?

2018-04-07.abstract: What Kevin Williamson and his critics have in common.
2018-04-07.snippet: What Kevin Williamson and his critics have in common.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, The Washington Post’s deputy editorial page editor, Ruth Marcus, wrote two columns explaining why, had either of her children been diagnosed with Down syndrome in utero, she would have accepted the “ghastly” nature of a second-trimester abortion and terminated the pregnancy. She conceded that people with Down syndrome can be happy and fulfilled, that both they and their parents might be understandably disturbed by the way abortion can effectively cull them from the world. But she concluded with self-acknowledged bluntness: “That was not the child I wanted.”
2018-04-07.headline_main: Among the Abortion Extremists

2018-04-07.abstract: What it looks like to re-enter life in Stockton, Calif., after a long stint in prison.
2018-04-07.snippet: What it looks like to re-enter life in Stockton, Calif., after a long stint in prison.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: STOCKTON, Calif. — In California, known for decades as one of the nation’s most avid jailers, the trajectory of law and order is shifting. Through litigation, legislation and a series of ballot initiatives, the state’s prison population has dropped 25 percent over the past decade.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Life After ‘17 to Life’

2018-04-07.abstract: Long-term use of the medications is surging in the United States, according to an analysis by The Times. One reason: withdrawal symptoms that make it difficult to stop.
2018-04-07.snippet: Long-term use of the medications is surging in the United States, according to an analysis by The Times. One reason: withdrawal symptoms that make it difficult to stop.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Victoria Toline would hunch over the kitchen table, steady her hands and draw a bead of liquid from a vial with a small dropper. It was a delicate operation that had become a daily routine — extracting ever tinier doses of the antidepressant she had taken for three years, on and off, and was desperately trying to quit.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Many People Taking Antidepressants Discover They Cannot Quit

2018-04-07.abstract: Three members walked out and a fourth threatened to quit the organization that awards the Nobel Prize in Literature.
2018-04-07.snippet: Three members walked out and a fourth threatened to quit the organization that awards the Nobel Prize in Literature.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM — The Swedish Academy, which awards the Nobel Prize in Literature, was hit this past week by one of its worst crises in decades after three members walked out and a fourth threatened to quit in the wake of abuse accusations against a cultural figure with close ties to the institution.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Swedish Academy in Crisis as 3 Members Quit Amid #MeToo Scandal

2018-04-07.abstract: Scoring two goals in the first half, Manchester City had the Premier League trophy in its grasp. Then United came out for the second half and scored three.
2018-04-07.snippet: Scoring two goals in the first half, Manchester City had the Premier League trophy in its grasp. Then United came out for the second half and scored three.

2018-04-07.abstract: Lifers released from California’s prisons try to find their way.
2018-04-07.snippet: Lifers released from California’s prisons try to find their way.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: Lifers released from California’s prisons try to find their way.

2018-04-07.abstract: At Augusta National, caddies and players receive yardage books that provide rudimentary information compared with what is often available at other tournaments. So they have to fill in the blanks.
2018-04-07.snippet: At Augusta National, caddies and players receive yardage books that provide rudimentary information compared with what is often available at other tournaments. So they have to fill in the blanks.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga. — The caddie William Lanier was standing behind Augusta National’s 13th hole on Monday, scribbling in a notebook roughly the size of a king-size candy bar, when he overheard a patron ask her husband, “What’s inside those books?”
2018-04-07.headline_main: At the Masters, Low-Tech Data Still Rules

2018-04-07.abstract: The imprisonment of the former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva was a remarkable fall for a statesman who transformed Brazil — and who was leading in the polls for October’s presidential election.
2018-04-07.snippet: The imprisonment of the former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva was a remarkable fall for a statesman who transformed Brazil — and who was leading in the polls for October’s presidential election.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: CURITIBA, Brazil — After vowing for months that a conviction on corruption charges would not stand in the way of his bid for a third term as Brazil’s leader, former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva surrendered to the police on Saturday evening to begin serving a 12-year sentence.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Ex-President ‘Lula’ of Brazil Surrenders to Serve 12-Year Jail Term

2018-04-07.abstract: Puggle up with Patrick Berry’s snortifying muzzle.
2018-04-07.snippet: Puggle up with Patrick Berry’s snortifying muzzle.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Today’s puzzle is inspired by William Archibald Spooner, a reverend and Oxford don from about a century ago who is a hero to paronomasiacs for unintentionally getting his tongue twisted in amusing ways. It’s an oddball but interesting life lesson, that sometimes a person can quietly put his heart and soul into honest hard work, only to gain lasting celebrity for slipping on a banana peel and distracting a political assassin, or something like that. So if you still want to be famous, there’s hope, is what I’m saying. Hope and Instagram.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Triple Spoonerisms

2018-04-07.abstract: More than 200 firefighters responded to the blaze, which broke out on the 50th floor. The victim’s apartment was “virtually entirely on fire,” an official said.
2018-04-07.snippet: More than 200 firefighters responded to the blaze, which broke out on the 50th floor. The victim’s apartment was “virtually entirely on fire,” an official said.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: A 67-year-old man died after being injured in a fire at Trump Tower in Midtown Manhattan on Saturday, the police said.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Fire at Trump Tower Kills One, Police Say

2018-04-07.abstract: A lineup filled with substitutes thrashed the Orioles the day after an extra-inning loss in which various Yankees succumbed to illness or injury.
2018-04-07.snippet: A lineup filled with substitutes thrashed the Orioles the day after an extra-inning loss in which various Yankees succumbed to illness or injury.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ 7-3 loss to the Baltimore Orioles on Friday night was not the kind of baseball game any manager would want to take home with him. It lasted 14 innings, over more than five hours, and by the time it was over, four Yankees had left the game either sick or injured. Better to forget about the whole thing for a few hours and go to bed.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Yankees Rebound Emphatically After Their Friday Miseries

2018-04-07.abstract: Anti-government activists accused the Syrian government of attacking a rebel-held suburb of Damascus with poison gas, estimating that dozens were killed.
2018-04-07.snippet: Anti-government activists accused the Syrian government of attacking a rebel-held suburb of Damascus with poison gas, estimating that dozens were killed.
2018-04-07.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Anti-government activists accused the Syrian government of attacking a Damascus suburb with poison gas on Saturday as Syrian forces stepped up their campaign to retake the last rebel-held pocket near the capital.
2018-04-07.headline_main: Poison Gas Attack Reported by Syrian Anti-Government Activists

2018-04-08.abstract: The Mets have a 6-1 record and have now beaten the rival Nationals in two straight games on the road. No, the Yankees are not in first place. But the Mets are.
2018-04-08.snippet: The Mets have a 6-1 record and have now beaten the rival Nationals in two straight games on the road. No, the Yankees are not in first place. But the Mets are.
2018-04-08.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A good number of the Mets’ main position players are older than  30 and while they bring assets to the lineup — smarts, experience, power — speed is not something they generally possess. So in spring training, the Mets’ new manager, Mickey Callaway, and his coaching staff emphasized the importance of smart, aggressive base running, the kind that can make slow-footed players seem a little faster.
2018-04-08.headline_main: Mets May Be Lacking in Speed, but They’re Off to a Very Fast Start

2018-04-08.abstract: McIlroy posted a seven-under-par 65 on Saturday and ended the third round three strokes behind Reed, who has yet to win a major.

A thicket of trees shielded the Playboy Club from public view, and it was set at the end of a long driveway, reachable only by winding country roads. Members had to show a card — a key, they called it — to get inside, where, in its prime, stars like Frank Sinatra and Ann-Margret performed and women in bikinis and bunny ears served drinks by the pool.

2018-04-08.abstract: Don Graham’s new book tells the story of how the epic starring James Dean and Elizabeth Taylor was made.
2018-04-08.snippet: Don Graham’s new book tells the story of how the epic starring James Dean and Elizabeth Taylor was made.
2018-04-08.lead_paragraph: “In Texas, as ‘Giant’ so brilliantly points out, big is always better than small; and if the only way to be big is to lose big, then well, so be it,” Larry McMurtry wrote in The New York Times in 1996. The director George Stevens’s film, starring Elizabeth Taylor and James Dean, and based on Edna Ferber’s 1952 novel of the same name, was released in 1956. It earned Stevens an Oscar and was nominated in several other categories, including Best Picture. (It lost to “Around the World in 80 Days.”) Don Graham’s new book tells the story of how this epic about the ranching life, the oil business, clashing cultures and the changing fortunes of generations made it to the screen. Below, Mr. Graham, an English professor at the University of Texas at Austin, discusses how his students’ reaction to the movie helped inspire the book, how Stevens’s experiences during World War II influenced the film and more.
2018-04-08.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Bringing ‘Giant’ to the Big Screen

2018-04-08.lead_paragraph: When it begins Monday, Bill Cosby’s retrial on sexual assault charges will appear very similar in some respects to the first trial that ended inconclusively nearly 10 months ago with a deadlocked jury. The courthouse in Norristown, Pa., will be the same. Andrea Constand, 44, will take the stand again to give her account of an encounter at Mr. Cosby’s home outside Philadelphia in 2004 that turned, she said, into a drugging and an act of sexual molestation. Mr. Cosby’s defense will still center on the argument that this was a consensual act.

2018-04-08.snippet: Why are there so many Williamson-type debacles? Because media orgs want to hire a species that doesn’t exist.
2018-04-08.lead_paragraph: The hiring-then-firing of Kevin Williamson followed a familiar script. A mainstream media organization hires a conservative in the name of intellectual diversity, then is shocked, shocked to discover that he’s dishonest and/or holds truly reprehensible views – something that the organization could have discovered with a few minutes on Google. But when the bad hire is let go, the right treats him as a martyr, proof of liberal refusal to let alternative viewpoints be heard. Why does this keep happening?
2018-04-08.headline_main: Unicorns of the Intellectual Right
