2018-04-17.abstract: Our tax money makes us complicit in the awful things our government does. But we also chip in for Pell grants.
2018-04-17.snippet: Our tax money makes us complicit in the awful things our government does. But we also chip in for Pell grants.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: There must have been a lot of Abu Ghraib-inspired loitering in post offices that year. The first time I had to turn in a tax return after seeing those photos of Iraqi prisoners of war being tortured by United States Army reservists, I stood in front of a mail box for 45 minutes, hesitating to contribute to the federal coffers and envying the folk singer Pete Seeger. Mr. Seeger’s wife, Toshi, used to cover their tax return with a blank sheet of paper so he saw only the one line he had to sign and not the amount of money he was sending to Washington to pay for wars he disapproved of.
2018-04-17.headline_main: It’s Tax Day. Don’t Forget to Read Thoreau.

2018-04-17.abstract: “Power to the People” at the Schirn Kunsthalle Frankfurt focuses on the universal subject of politics in art, rather than on the political issues themselves.
2018-04-17.snippet: “Power to the People” at the Schirn Kunsthalle Frankfurt focuses on the universal subject of politics in art, rather than on the political issues themselves.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — A sea of 100 multicolored banners in the atrium of the Schirn Kunsthalle here, roughly assembled using plywood, fabric and adhesive tape, provides the first indication that this art gallery is in protest mode. The 2015 installation by the British artist Phyllida Barlow is a pertinent symbol of our turbulent times — an epoch of #MeToo, Black Lives Matter, marches for women and in defense of science, and demonstrations against gun violence.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Protesting Artists Step Off the Streets and Into the Gallery

2018-04-17.abstract: In monasteries in remote Assam, prayer is expressed through dance. That style, Sattriya, is coming to New York this weekend.
2018-04-17.snippet: In monasteries in remote Assam, prayer is expressed through dance. That style, Sattriya, is coming to New York this weekend.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — In the West, our idea of monastic ritual involves prayer and quiet reflection. But there are monasteries in Assam, in the far reaches of northeastern India, where prayer has always been, and continues to be, expressed through dance. The monks in these communities, or sattras, perform with and for each other, and for the deity.
2018-04-17.headline_main: The Indian Monks’ Dance, Flowering With the Aid of Women

2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: You’re most likely to notice it in the abstract, if you notice it at all. The work of a good expediter is in the pacing of your dinner. It’s in the steadiness of the room. It’s in the sense that everyone in the restaurant is moving to a single, unbreakable rhythm.

2018-04-17.snippet: To protect the public without overreacting, the issue for legislators and regulators to weigh is how much the data-driven ecosystem is worth to us.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: One of the most telling moments in the spectacle of Mark Zuckerberg’s congressional testimony last week was when Representative Billy Long, a Missouri Republican, warned the co-founder of Facebook of what Congress was likely to do about its multiple concerns surrounding the social network. “Congress is good at two things: doing nothing, and overreacting,” he said. After years of the former, he said, “we’re getting ready to overreact.”
2018-04-17.headline_main: Facebook Is Creepy. And Valuable.

2018-04-17.abstract: After a long stretch of steady gains, the stock market has come under pressure, and bonds have been a source of headaches, too. What’s an investor to do? For insight and perspective, check out our quarterly report on investing.

2018-04-17.abstract: The rapper’s win for “DAMN.” is overdue recognition for hip-hop but raises concerns about the shrinking number of platforms for noncommercial work.
2018-04-17.snippet: The rapper’s win for “DAMN.” is overdue recognition for hip-hop but raises concerns about the shrinking number of platforms for noncommercial work.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: The Pulitzer Prizes startled a lot of people this year with an award that’s usually greeted as an afterthought: the music prize, which went to Kendrick Lamar’s album “DAMN.” It was not only the first time a music Pulitzer was given to a hip-hop album, but also to any work outside the more rarefied precincts of classical and, occasionally, jazz composition — indeed, to an album that reached No. 1 on the pop chart. And while it has been reported that “DAMN.” was the unanimous choice of the Pulitzer music jury, the award was met in other quarters with disgruntlement and even outrage. Here, Zachary Woolfe, the classical music editor of The New York Times, and Jon Pareles, the chief pop music critic, discuss the choice.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Kendrick Lamar Shakes Up the Pulitzer Game: Let’s Discuss

2018-04-17.abstract: Memorable moments in comics on the hero’s way to this milestone, from his debut to his marriage to Lois Lane and more.
2018-04-17.snippet: Memorable moments in comics on the hero’s way to this milestone, from his debut to his marriage to Lois Lane and more.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: Superman, created by the writer Jerry Siegel and the artist Joe Shuster, was introduced on April 18, 1938, in Action Comics No. 1. The Man of Steel struck a chord with readers and, faster than a speeding bullet, he became a multimedia sensation, with his adventures chronicled on radio, stage, film and television, and his image on a kaleidoscope of merchandise and collectibles. “If everybody doesn’t know by now who Clark Kent and who Lois Lane is, you’re not paying attention,” said Maggie Thompson, a senior editor of the Comic Buyer’s Guide, which covered the industry from 1971 to 2013. On Wednesday, Superman turns 80 years old and — great Caesar’s ghost! — DC Entertainment will publish Action Comics No. 1,000. Here are some memorable issues on his journey to that milestone. Happy Birthday, Kal-El!
2018-04-17.headline_main: Superman Turns 80. The Red Trunks Still Fit.

2018-04-17.abstract: “A lot of girls have been waiting for this moment here in Saudi,” a stylist told Elizabeth Paton at Riyadh’s first fashion week.
2018-04-17.snippet: “A lot of girls have been waiting for this moment here in Saudi,” a stylist told Elizabeth Paton at Riyadh’s first fashion week.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It was an unexpected invitation. Two years ago it would have been an unthinkable one. But last month an email arrived in my inbox requesting my presence in Riyadh, the capital city of Saudi Arabia. The desert kingdom, one of the most conservative societies in the world and historically known as a place with a resistance to anything new, was in the final stages of preparations for its first official fashion week. Now the organizers wanted a reporter from The New York Times to attend.
2018-04-17.headline_main: As Saudi Arabian Society Opens, a Fashion Reporter Looks Past the Runway

2018-04-17.abstract: Chat ‘n’ Chew returns, Paul Liebrandt is the new executive chef at Racines NY, and more restaurant news.
2018-04-17.snippet: Chat ‘n’ Chew returns, Paul Liebrandt is the new executive chef at Racines NY, and more restaurant news.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: LUMOS KITCHEN Baijiu, the spirit that sells more than any other in the world, takes center stage at this eclectic new Chinese restaurant, which represents a step up for the owner, Qifan Li. Four years ago she created Lumos Bar on Houston Street, specializing in baijiu, with Orson Salicetti, a baijiu lover, behind the bar. Now she is opening Lumos Kitchen because she and Mr. Salicetti felt they had to serve more food. “Baijiu is usually drunk with food,” Ms. Li said. (She has since closed Lumos Bar, replacing it with Railways, a gastro pub.) Hok Chin, a Hong Kong native and a veteran of some of New York’s French kitchens, including at the Essex House and the Mark Hotel, fuses French and Chinese cuisine, in dishes like pan-seared quail with foie gras in a Chinese wine sauce, black bass glazed with baijiu-miso sauce, wok-fried tiger prawns, and foie gras fried rice. To go alongside, Mr. Salicetti has come up with cocktails like a sesame colada with mangosteen, and the El Paso, combining baijiu with Lillet, lime, Sichuan pepper, cucumber and cilantro. His bar is stocked with more than 30 baijius, including some infused with herbs in-house. The airy restaurant, with splashy blue leaves decorating the walls, has a semi-open kitchen: 188 Second Avenue (12th Street), no phone, lumoskitchen.com.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Restaurant With Focus on Baijiu Opens in East Village

2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump was watching television on Sunday when he saw Nikki R. Haley, his ambassador to the United Nations, announce that he would impose fresh sanctions on Russia. The president grew angry, according to an official informed about the moment. As far as he was concerned, he had decided no such thing.

2018-04-17.abstract: A look at Anne O’Hare McCormick, who broke through into a field dominated by men — way back in 1921.
2018-04-17.snippet: A look at Anne O’Hare McCormick, who broke through into a field dominated by men — way back in 1921.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: In 1921, Anne O’Hare McCormick had little journalism experience when she wrote to Carr V. Van Anda, the managing editor at The New York Times. It might have been a long shot, but she asked if she could submit articles to the newspaper when she went to Europe with her husband.

2018-04-17.abstract: By a 5-to-4 vote, the Supreme Court ruled that a law allowing the deportation of some immigrants who commit serious crimes was unconstitutionally vague.
2018-04-17.snippet: By a 5-to-4 vote, the Supreme Court ruled that a law allowing the deportation of some immigrants who commit serious crimes was unconstitutionally vague.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Tuesday struck down a law that allowed the government to deport some immigrants who commit serious crimes, saying it was unconstitutionally vague. The decision will limit the Trump administration’s efforts to deport people convicted of some kinds of crimes.

2018-04-17.abstract: Diamonds and humans have more in common than you might think.
2018-04-17.snippet: Diamonds and humans have more in common than you might think.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: I’m attracted to diamonds because they are part of my family: My father is descended from a long line of jewelers, and my brothers now work in jewelry as well. For this film, I wanted to use my father’s voice to tell an animated story using diamonds as a metaphor for mankind through the ages. To me, the place of diamonds in society is as multifaceted as the gemstones themselves, full of paradoxes and intrigue.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Diamonds and Lies

2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: More than 2,400 years ago, the Greek playwright Aristophanes wrote “Lysistrata,” an antiwar satire in which a group of women endeavor to stop the Peloponnesian War by withholding sex from their husbands. The story has staying power; modern-day adaptations on the stage (“Lysistrata Jones”) and the screen (Spike Lee’s “Chi-Raq”) have kept the outline while grappling with contemporary gender politics.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Review: In ‘ms. estrada,’ Campus Feminists Say No to Sex, Yes to Hip-Hop

His hundreds of posts earned him a follower count comfortably in the six figures, but still he craved more.

2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: One of the most exciting parts of Arab Fashion Week Riyadh, the first official fashion week hosted in Saudi Arabia, which took place last week, was the sheer amount of Saudi girl power on display. It was an all-woman, all-the-time event — young student volunteers setting up and monitoring the tents, Make Up For Ever backstage beauty teams that had been trained specially for the shows  — and an opportunity to spotlight some of the female design talent emerging from the desert kingdom. Here, four names to remember.

2018-04-17.headline_main: Carl Kasell, NPR Newsman Who Discovered Laughs, Dies at 84

2018-04-17.abstract: Hundreds of you shared your thoughts about what disorder might be affecting our patient Angel. Let’s keep the conversation going.
2018-04-17.snippet: Hundreds of you shared your thoughts about what disorder might be affecting our patient Angel. Let’s keep the conversation going.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: Last week, I posted the story of Angel, a 23-year-old woman with devastating daily muscle pain and frequent hospitalizations for rhabdomyolysis, the destruction of muscle fibers, often accompanied by coffee-colored urine. We asked you, the readers of The New York Times, to use your collective knowledge and wisdom to help us come up with possible diagnoses that would help her and her primary care provider find an answer. The response has been gratifying. Hundreds of you filled out answer forms, sharing your thoughts about what Angel might have and what she might do to relieve her symptoms or get a diagnosis.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Readers Respond to Our Call for Help With a Diagnosis

2018-04-17.abstract: John P.A. Greenwood pleaded guilty to disorderly conduct and admitted using a racial slur, but denied the assault that left a black student with a bloody nose.

2018-04-17.headline_main: Cornell Student Admits Using Slur as Hate Crime Charges Are Dropped

2018-04-17.abstract: At Villa Necchi Campiglio in Milan, we toasted the launch of the Salone del Mobile design week with negronis — and installations by the architect Andrea Tognon.
2018-04-17.snippet: At Villa Necchi Campiglio in Milan, we toasted the launch of the Salone del Mobile design week with negronis — and installations by the architect Andrea Tognon.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: Despite the threat of rain in Milan last night, the only thing that got wet at T’s party in celebration of Salone del Mobile was a series of curving polystyrene sculptures that bobbed in the pool of the legendary Villa Necchi Campiglio as guests sipped negronis in the surrounding gardens. The sculptures were studies for massive concrete planters recently stationed outside Milan’s La Rinascente department store by the Italian architect Andrea Tognon. To celebrate T’s Design issue, for which Tognon created a special one-off chair from concrete and fur, editor in chief Hanya Yanagihara invited Tognon to fill the villa inside and out with prototypes and models of his furniture. “We played a little bit with the idea that the Villa Necchi is our design workshop,” he said.
2018-04-17.headline_main: About Last Night: T Magazine Celebrates Salone del Mobile

2018-04-17.abstract: To celebrate the design world’s biggest week, T invited guests to a cocktail party at the legendary Villa Necchi Campiglio.

2018-04-17.snippet: The E.P.A. administrator’s appalling environmental policies aside, his unethical and bullying behavior has sullied his agency and demoralized its employees.
2018-04-17.lead_paragraph: Despite stiff competition, Scott Pruitt, the administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, is by common consensus the worst of the ideologues and mediocrities President Trump chose to populate his cabinet. Policies aside — and they’re terrible, from an environmental perspective — Mr. Pruitt’s self-aggrandizing and borderline thuggish behavior has disgraced his office and demoralized his employees. We opposed his nomination because he had spent his career as attorney general of Oklahoma suing the federal department he was being asked to lead on behalf of industries he was being asked to regulate. As it turns out, Mr. Pruitt is not just an industry lap dog but also an arrogant and vengeful bully and small-time grifter, bent on chiseling the taxpayer to suit his lifestyle and warm his ego.
2018-04-17.headline_main: Scott Pruitt Has Become Ridiculous

2018-04-18.snippet: Milan’s arts complex, which opened in 2015, is complete with the addition of the architect’s new building.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: “Milan is a very harsh and impenetrable city, but behind closed doors there are unbelievable creative things, which is the point of making a public place like this that brings that creativity into the light,” the architect Rem Koolhaas says of his zigzagging new tower at the Prada Foundation, which opens during Salone del Mobile this week. The nine-story tower completes Koolhaas’s plans for the 200,000-square-foot site, the city’s largest arts destination, after three years of construction. It vastly expands the foundation’s already-extensive exhibition spaces with new galleries reserved for Miuccia Prada’s private collection of contemporary art, and adds a new restaurant and roof-deck bar to the premises as well.
2018-04-18.headline_main: The Prada Foundation’s New, Rem Koolhaas-Designed Tower

2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: She knew who she was, and she saw no need to apologize for it. In the spring of 1990, the administration of Wellesley College — the alma mater, as it happened, of Hillary Rodham Clinton — invited Barbara Bush, then the first lady of the United States, to speak at commencement and receive an honorary degree. Students at the women’s college protested, declaring in a petition that Mrs. Bush had “gained recognition through the achievements of her husband,” and adding that Wellesley “teaches us that we will be rewarded on the basis of our own merit, not on that of a spouse.”
2018-04-18.headline_main: Barbara Bush, a First Lady Without Apologies

2018-04-18.abstract: Apply pressure. If the blood flow is heavy after 20 or 30 seconds, use a tourniquet.
2018-04-18.snippet: Apply pressure. If the blood flow is heavy after 20 or 30 seconds, use a tourniquet.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: “Apply pressure where the blood is coming out,” says Christopher B. Colwell, the chief of emergency medicine at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital and Trauma Center. You may need to remove or rip open some of the victim’s clothing to access the injury. “Grab a shirt, a towel, a fabric bag — it doesn’t have to be clean,” Colwell says. Put the cloth over the wound, and push down continuously and forcefully on it with both hands until the bleeding stops.
2018-04-18.headline_main: How to Control Bleeding

2018-04-18.abstract: This generation’s Doctor Spock popularized the swaddle and simple techniques for soothing infants. Why is he now selling a $1,160 robotic bassinet?
2018-04-18.snippet: This generation’s Doctor Spock popularized the swaddle and simple techniques for soothing infants. Why is he now selling a $1,160 robotic bassinet?
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Harvey Karp, the pediatrician, parenting expert and inventor-slash-entrepreneur, cuts an unimposing figure. Lean and agile, with wispy dark hair, blue-rimmed glasses and a bounce in his step, Karp hugs like the Angeleno he has become and deadpans like the New Yorker he once was. Gray has infiltrated his beard and his eyes are a little hooded, but he still makes for a young 66. He used to dress only in blue button-up shirts with matching sweater vests and bulbous ties in a seemingly self-conscious take on the Nutty Professor, but he has graduated to a darker navy, with slim-fitting jeans, an occasional blazer and a pair of Converse or laceless Vans: his transformation into a hip West Coast chief executive — Prius included — complete.
2018-04-18.headline_main: How Harvey Karp Turned Baby Sleep Into Big Business

2018-04-18.abstract: Agriculture could pull carbon out of the air and into the soil — but it would mean a whole new way of thinking about how to tend the land.
2018-04-18.snippet: Agriculture could pull carbon out of the air and into the soil — but it would mean a whole new way of thinking about how to tend the land.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When John Wick and his wife, Peggy Rathmann, bought their ranch in Marin County, Calif., in 1998, it was mostly because they needed more space. Rathmann is an acclaimed children’s book author — “Officer Buckle and Gloria” won a Caldecott Medal in 1996 — and their apartment in San Francisco had become cluttered with her illustrations. They picked out the 540-acre ranch in Nicasio mostly for its large barn, which they planned to remake into a spacious studio. Wick, a former construction foreman — they met when he oversaw a renovation of her bathroom — was eager to tackle the project. He knew the area well, having grown up one town away, in Woodacre, where he had what he describes as a “free-range” childhood: little supervision and lots of biking, rope-swinging and playing in the area’s fields and glens.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Can Dirt Save the Earth?

It’s a challenge to make a compelling visual of dirt, but Robin Broadbent’s image of it shaking loose from spidery roots and cascading down the cover lends it dynamism and beauty.”

2018-04-18.abstract: Are they good for the environment? Or are they just sheds?
2018-04-18.snippet: Are they good for the environment? Or are they just sheds?
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Taylor writes: My girlfriend and I live off-grid in a tiny house that I built. I do this because I have a libertarian streak and value self-sufficiency above all. She believes that our lifestyle is actually creating a positive environmental impact. I do feel good about that part of it, but I don’t believe that we actually have any impact on climate change. I seek judgment from the court regarding the true value of our lifestyle.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Judge John Hodgman on the True Value of Tiny Homes

2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: John Brebner swept his binoculars over a fissure-ridden rock face that towered over a grove of acacia trees. Candy-colored striations of dolomite and quartz ran through the tan granite, and human figures painted by Khoisan Bushmen three millenniums ago were faintly visible on the facade.

2018-04-18.abstract: On facing pages, text and image can be brought into intimate conversation.
2018-04-18.snippet: On facing pages, text and image can be brought into intimate conversation.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Design-wise, the most famous collaboration between a writer and a photographer did not end up looking like much of a collaboration at all. Walker Evans contributed a preface to the 1960 reissue of “Let Us Now Praise Famous Men,” the study of poor tenant farmers in Alabama, originally published in 1941; “Walker” crops up a number of times in James Agee’s text, but a formal separation is maintained between the tenderly austere photographs of families and their homes — printed at the beginning — and the 400 pages of Agee’s highly wrought, much-agonized-over text. This, for Gore Vidal, was no bad thing, because it left Evans’s “austere” photos untainted by what “good-hearted, soft-headed admirers of the Saint James (Agee) version” so loved about the sharecroppers’ gospel.
2018-04-18.headline_main: The Magic of Books Where Photography Meets Essays

2018-04-18.abstract: And was it nothing — or something dangerous to worry about?
2018-04-18.snippet: And was it nothing — or something dangerous to worry about?
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: The 40-year-old man stared into the mirror. Lowering his razor, he lifted his chin to see if the lima-bean-size lump was still visible on the right side of his neck, just under his jawbone. His fingers quickly found the small double-lobed bulge. When he first saw it, while shaving maybe a couple of weeks earlier, it was a little tender. The soreness had gone away, but still, the lump made him nervous. Years ago, a friend had found a lump near her collarbone and ended up dying of cancer. He was due for his yearly physical, so he made an appointment to see his doctor. It was probably nothing — but he wanted to hear it from a professional.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Why Wouldn’t the Lump Under the Patient’s Jaw Go Away?

2018-04-18.abstract: In 2006, Jeremiah Foxwell became the Navy’s first known chemical-warfare casualty after the Iraq invasion, but the service refuses to award him a Purple Heart.
2018-04-18.snippet: In 2006, Jeremiah Foxwell became the Navy’s first known chemical-warfare casualty after the Iraq invasion, but the service refuses to award him a Purple Heart.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: The improvised explosive device that Petty Officer Third Class Jeremiah Foxwell approached in September 2006 resembled hundreds of others he had destroyed in and around Baghdad. On the ground was a damaged artillery shell that had been ejected by a roadside blast. Brown crystals around its nose looked like a homemade explosive that local insurgents often used.
2018-04-18.headline_main: He Inhaled Mustard Agent in Iraq, but the Navy Denied Him a Purple Heart

2018-04-18.abstract: Selected by Terrance Hayes.
2018-04-18.snippet: Selected by Terrance Hayes.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Bivocal, dialogical, interruptive — what’s the technical term for this poem’s gracefully woven structure? It forces you to read between the lines. Maybe everything after the first line is an answer to “the opposite of water.” Or maybe the indented sentence is a sort of swan song floating through the questions. “Cygnus” is Latin for “swan” and the name of a constellation. Any way you read it, the poem’s interrogative uncertainty shimmers like the mirrors of that dazzling final image. Selected by Terrance Hayes
2018-04-18.headline_main: Poem: Cygnus

2018-04-18.abstract: Barbara Bush gave it to you with the bark off. But when you earned her affection, it meant all the more. You knew it was real.
2018-04-18.snippet: Barbara Bush gave it to you with the bark off. But when you earned her affection, it meant all the more. You knew it was real.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: I met her in 1981, when I went to work for her husband as a speechwriter. I was a bit in awe of her — who wasn’t? — and, I confess, a bit scared. A few weeks in, I wrote a speech that went over well, in no small part due to George H. W. Bush’s solid delivery. After the event as we boarded Air Force Two, Barbara Bush spotted me and said, “That’s the best speech he’s ever given.” I replied, “Well, we all worked hard on that speech.” Her face went stony as she brushed past my seat. She said, “Oh, don’t be such a Pollyanna.”
2018-04-18.headline_main: Mrs. No-Nonsense

(Today, female comedians are often stand-ups — Ellen DeGeneres, Samantha Bee — who don’t morph into someone else in the middle of their shows.)
2018-04-18.headline_main: The Last Day I Spent With Gilda Radner

2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: For design-minded travelers, the principal calling cards of Mexico City, Lima or São Paulo — Latin America’s megacities, each of them larger than New York — have been their delirious modernist structures. 2018-04-18.abstract: Symphonies are among America’s least racially diverse institutions. A new program aims to help musicians of color land orchestra jobs.
2018-04-18.snippet: Symphonies are among America’s least racially diverse institutions. A new program aims to help musicians of color land orchestra jobs.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Orchestras are among America’s least racially diverse institutions. African-American musicians accounted for only 1.8 percent of the nation’s orchestra players in 2014, according to an industry study, which found that the figure had not grown in over a decade.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Seeking Orchestras in Tune With Their Diverse Communities

2018-04-18.abstract: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey called for voting on June 24, 18 months earlier than had been expected, citing instability in Syria and Iraq.
2018-04-18.snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey called for voting on June 24, 18 months earlier than had been expected, citing instability in Syria and Iraq.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey on Wednesday called elections for June 24, almost a year and a half earlier than scheduled, saying the situation in Syria and Iraq, as well as economic stability, demanded it.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Erdogan Calls Early Turkish Elections in Bid to Solidify Power

2018-04-18.abstract: In his first interview following Barbara Bush’s death, George W. Bush, the 43rd president, remembered his mother’s personal warmth and biting wit.
2018-04-18.snippet: In his first interview following Barbara Bush’s death, George W. Bush, the 43rd president, remembered his mother’s personal warmth and biting wit.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even in the final days of her life, Barbara Bush retained the sharp tongue that belied her grandmotherly image. When her eldest son, former President George W. Bush, visited about 10 days before her death, the two playfully needled each other in the way they always did.
2018-04-18.headline_main: In Barbara Bush’s Final Days, Faith, Courage and a Little Last Needling

2018-04-18.abstract: The deal fits what appears to be an accelerating trend, as oil and gas companies invest in a wide range of activities, particularly in cleaner energy.
2018-04-18.snippet: The deal fits what appears to be an accelerating trend, as oil and gas companies invest in a wide range of activities, particularly in cleaner energy.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: LONDON — One major energy company has invested in a solar power developer. Another is lifting its investments in wind energy. One has even placed a small bet on nuclear fusion.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Total, With Energy Industry in Flux, Makes $1.7 Billion Bet on a Utility

2018-04-18.abstract: As the momentum grows for a meeting with the North Korean leader, President Trump acknowledged that it was a risky undertaking, and one that could still end in failure.
2018-04-18.snippet: As the momentum grows for a meeting with the North Korean leader, President Trump acknowledged that it was a risky undertaking, and one that could still end in failure.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: PALM BEACH, Fla. — President Trump declared on Wednesday that he would scrap a planned summit meeting with North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, or even walk out of the session while it was underway, if his diplomatic overture was not heading toward success.
2018-04-18.headline_main: If North Korea Talks Are Not Fruitful, ‘I Will Respectfully Leave,’ Trump Says

2018-04-18.abstract: Why is President Trump so determined to prevent spouses of H-1B visa holders from living the American dream?
2018-04-18.snippet: Why is President Trump so determined to prevent spouses of H-1B visa holders from living the American dream?
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: I came to America from India at age 23. That was in 1985, a golden age of immigration to this country. It didn’t feel like it, though, because it still took my husband, a medical physicist, and me a good seven years to trade up from our student visas for an H-1B for him and an H-4 spouse visa for me. Eventually we got the ultimate prize: green cards — which, to our amusement, weren’t even green back then.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Fixing the ‘Involuntary Housewife Visa’

2018-04-18.abstract: A quick look at some of the latest collections from top bridal designers.
2018-04-18.snippet: A quick look at some of the latest collections from top bridal designers.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: The biggest names in bridal fashion showcased their spring and summer 2019 collections during Bridal Fashion Week April 11-14 in New York. It was no surprise that many designers, like Theia and Reem Acra,  drew inspiration from this year’s royal wedding in Britain, with reimagined contemporary looks for the soon-to-be-duchess, Meghan Markle. Other designers like Ines Di Santo and Vera Wang presented gowns that were both bold and unabashedly feminine, laden with floral appliqués and colorful details. Here’s a look at what we saw at Bridal Fashion Week.
2018-04-18.headline_main: What We Saw at New York Bridal Fashion Week

2018-04-18.abstract: Some brides are opting for a more au naturel look: faces dewy, eyes unshadowed, lips unstained. Others are wearing just a hint of makeup.
2018-04-18.snippet: Some brides are opting for a more au naturel look: faces dewy, eyes unshadowed, lips unstained. Others are wearing just a hint of makeup.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: For some brides, regular trips to Sephora and test-driving makeup artists aren’t on the wedding to-do list. They are opting instead for a more au naturel look on their big day: faces dewey, eyes unshadowed, lips unstained.
2018-04-18.headline_main: No Makeup on My Wedding Day

2018-04-18.abstract: An Arizona teacher invents a game that helps students in her memoir class tackle essential questions — and learn to close-read for answers.
2018-04-18.snippet: An Arizona teacher invents a game that helps students in her memoir class tackle essential questions — and learn to close-read for answers.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: What can your students learn about literature from the weekly New York Times Book Review? A teacher in Phoenix has an imaginative answer.
2018-04-18.headline_main: FON, FAIIN, FIIM? A Classroom Game About Literary Genre

2018-04-18.abstract: Seven Myanmar military personnel convicted in a massacre of Rohingya Muslims went free in a mass amnesty, a TV station said. The report was quickly taken down.
2018-04-18.snippet: Seven Myanmar military personnel convicted in a massacre of Rohingya Muslims went free in a mass amnesty, a TV station said. The report was quickly taken down.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — For about an hour on Wednesday, the website of Myanmar National Television carried a surprising report: A mass prisoner amnesty the previous day, it said, had included seven members of the country’s military who were briefly jailed for a massacre of Rohingya Muslims.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Did Soldiers Jailed for Killings Go Free? Myanmar TV Says Yes (Briefly)

2018-04-18.abstract: Junichi Fukuda has denied the allegations. But his resignation was a sign that Japan might be joining the international reckoning in the #MeToo movement.
2018-04-18.snippet: Junichi Fukuda has denied the allegations. But his resignation was a sign that Japan might be joining the international reckoning in the #MeToo movement.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The highest-ranking civil servant in Japan’s Finance Ministry offered his resignation on Wednesday amid swirling accusations that he had sexually harassed several female journalists.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Top Finance Official in Japan Resigns Over Harassment Accusations

2018-04-18.abstract: By 2050, twice as many women as men will have the disease. But we may be able to change that.
2018-04-18.snippet: By 2050, twice as many women as men will have the disease. But we may be able to change that.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: In the next three minutes, three people will develop Alzheimer’s disease. Two of them will be women.
2018-04-18.headline_main: The Menopause-Alzheimer’s Connection

2018-04-18.abstract: A grilled cheese is the ultimate no-recipe recipe, especially when you add some shredded duck, and a hoisin-spiked mayonnaise.
2018-04-18.snippet: A grilled cheese is the ultimate no-recipe recipe, especially when you add some shredded duck, and a hoisin-spiked mayonnaise.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Good morning. I got it into my head to make a fancy grilled cheese sandwich. I didn’t have a recipe because you don’t really need a recipe to make grilled cheese sandwiches, especially in the middle of the week. You just need desire, and a triangle in your head: salt; crunch; melting ooze.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Cooking Without Recipes

2018-04-18.abstract: The free concert series will include performances by Big Daddy Kane and Talib Kweli, as well as Rhiannon Giddens and Met Opera singers.
2018-04-18.snippet: The free concert series will include performances by Big Daddy Kane and Talib Kweli, as well as Rhiannon Giddens and Met Opera singers.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When summer arrives in New York City, so will a cavalcade of hip-hop acts spanning generations. While the Pulitzer Prize-winner Kendrick Lamar and ASAP Ferg will embody the genre’s present at Hot 97’s Summer Jam on June 10, the City Parks Foundation’s SummerStage Festival will look further into hip-hop’s past, with free shows by Big Daddy Kane, Talib Kweli, Pete Rock and the Lox.
2018-04-18.headline_main: SummerStage Will Celebrate Hip-Hop’s Past

2018-04-18.abstract: The two, who recently made their own Broadway debuts, will host the ceremony on June 10; much of it will be broadcast on CBS.
2018-04-18.snippet: The two, who recently made their own Broadway debuts, will host the ceremony on June 10; much of it will be broadcast on CBS.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Josh Groban and Sara Bareilles, two pop singers who recently made their Broadway debuts, will host this year’s Tony Awards.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Josh Groban and Sara Bareilles to Host Tony Awards

2018-04-18.abstract: The singer and songwriter’s first album of his own new music since 2005 confronts loneliness and mortality.
2018-04-18.snippet: The singer and songwriter’s first album of his own new music since 2005 confronts loneliness and mortality.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: The cheerful and the bleak face off on “The Tree of Forgiveness,” John Prine’s first album of his own new songs since “Fair and Square” back in 2005. He has undergone some wear since then: In 2013, he had surgery for lung cancer, after surviving neck cancer in 1998. While at 71 his voice is gruffer and scratchier than ever, the album is unapologetic about it; vocals are recorded close-up over sparse arrangements, with melodies that relax into cozy countryish territory and sometimes stray toward speech.
2018-04-18.headline_main: John Prine Returns to Songwriting, Jaunty and Dark, on ‘The Tree of Forgiveness’

2018-04-18.abstract: A popular, Verdi-loving Italian immigrant who dominated the ring for a record 11 years in the 1960s and ′70s and insisted that he never took a dive.
2018-04-18.snippet: A popular, Verdi-loving Italian immigrant who dominated the ring for a record 11 years in the 1960s and ′70s and insisted that he never took a dive.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Bruno Sammartino, an Italian immigrant who was heavyweight champion of the World Wide Wrestling Federation for a record 11 years in the 1960s and ′70s, long before the federation admitted that its matches were scripted and largely choreographed entertainment shows, died on Wednesday at 82.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Bruno Sammartino, Durable Champ in WWE Hall of Fame, Dies at 82

2018-04-18.abstract: Passengers hailed Captain Shults as a hero after an engine exploded on Flight 1380. She started out as one of the first female fighter jet pilots in the Navy.
2018-04-18.snippet: Passengers hailed Captain Shults as a hero after an engine exploded on Flight 1380. She started out as one of the first female fighter jet pilots in the Navy.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: About 20 minutes after takeoff on Tuesday, Capt. Tammie Jo Shults was steering a Southwest Airlines plane toward cruising altitude, generally considered the safest part of a flight. But then the left engine exploded.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Southwest Pilot of Flight 1380 Is Navy Veteran Hailed for Her ‘Nerves of Steel’

2018-04-18.abstract: The move would be accomplished by pardoning convicted felons on parole, allowing Gov. Andrew Cuomo to sidestep the State Legislature.
2018-04-18.snippet: The move would be accomplished by pardoning convicted felons on parole, allowing Gov. Andrew Cuomo to sidestep the State Legislature.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: ALBANY — Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced on Wednesday that he intends to restore voting rights to felons on parole, a move that could open the ballot box to more than 35,000 people.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Cuomo Plans to Restore Voting Rights to Paroled Felons

2018-04-18.abstract: For Elliott Puckette, who opens a new show this week, simple lines have been a career-long fascination.
2018-04-18.snippet: For Elliott Puckette, who opens a new show this week, simple lines have been a career-long fascination.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When I arrive at the Dumbo, Brooklyn building where the artist Elliott Puckette keeps a studio, it’s as if I’ve traveled back in time — to, say, 1989, when Puckette first rented the Pearl Street space and the building was still a working paper factory. Warped wooden floorboards creak under my feet, and exposed pipes and electrical wiring line the unfinished hallway. It smells of paint and turpentine. The contrast to the sleek, granite-floored lobby is striking. “They’re renovating the building in the most absurd way, floor-by-floor,” she explains good-naturedly. “Eventually I’m getting kicked out.”
2018-04-18.headline_main: In the Studio With an Artist Devoted to the Line

2018-04-18.abstract: The major failure, nearly seven months after Hurricane Maria ravaged Puerto Rico, could take up to 36 hours to fix.
2018-04-18.snippet: The major failure, nearly seven months after Hurricane Maria ravaged Puerto Rico, could take up to 36 hours to fix.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — After seven months and close to $2.5 billion, almost everybody in hurricane-ravaged Puerto Rico had their lights back on — until a freak accident on Wednesday plunged the entire island once again into darkness.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Puerto Rico Is Once Again Hit by an Islandwide Blackout

2018-04-18.abstract: The first season of this HBO robo-serial was more puzzle than story. The second one gets its head out of its own maze enough to develop a personality.
2018-04-18.snippet: The first season of this HBO robo-serial was more puzzle than story. The second one gets its head out of its own maze enough to develop a personality.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Earlier this month, the creators of “Westworld” announced a plan to foil the online theorizers who had guessed so many plot twists during the first season: They would post a video on Reddit that spoiled the entire second season. The curious fans who couldn’t resist pressing “Play” were instead treated to the star Evan Rachel Wood singing Rick Astley’s “Never Gonna Give You Up.”
2018-04-18.headline_main: Review: ‘Westworld’ Gets a Partial Upgrade for Season 2

2018-04-18.abstract: Producers said the symbols were crucial to a performance highlighting the dangers of fascism. But the opening-night offer has prompted complaints to the police.
2018-04-18.snippet: Producers said the symbols were crucial to a performance highlighting the dangers of fascism. But the opening-night offer has prompted complaints to the police.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A play based on Adolf Hitler’s youth is sparking controversy for an unusual opening-night deal: Audience members willing to wear a swastika (provided by the theater) during the performance get in free. Those who prefer to pay full price are asked to wear the Star of David.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Get In Free if You’ll Wear a Swastika: A German Theater’s Provocation

2018-04-18.abstract: The author of “The Looming Tower” and “Going Clear” captures the Lone Star State in all its shame and glory.
2018-04-18.snippet: The author of “The Looming Tower” and “Going Clear” captures the Lone Star State in all its shame and glory.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Lawrence Wright’s new book begins at a truck stop and ends in a graveyard. The subtitle of “God Save Texas” is “A Journey Into the Soul of the Lone Star State,” but Wright, having spent most of his life in Texas — embracing it, rejecting it, defending it to naysayers even as it lets him down — wants to show how this soul isn’t as abstract (and therefore incorruptible) as the mythmakers like to believe. It’s too rooted in the place’s particulars for that. Even the Buc-ee’s at the truck stop is a gigantic repository of meaning: “It is the largest convenience store in the world — a category of achievement that only Texas would aspire to.”
2018-04-18.headline_main: In ‘God Save Texas,’ Lawrence Wright Ranges Far and Wide

2018-04-18.abstract: Attempts by the country’s internet watchdog to impose a ban on the popular messaging app were opposed by, among others, Edward J. Snowden and a member of Pussy Riot.
2018-04-18.snippet: Attempts by the country’s internet watchdog to impose a ban on the popular messaging app were opposed by, among others, Edward J. Snowden and a member of Pussy Riot.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Russia’s communications watchdog was locked in an intensive game of whack-a-mole on Wednesday with Telegram, the popular and highly secure messaging app, as its stuttering attempts to block the service inadvertently knocked out the websites of scores of small businesses.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Russia Tried to Shut Down Telegram. Websites Were Collateral Damage.

2018-04-18.abstract: Sapna Maheshwari, who covers advertising for The Times, discusses how she tracks the online ads that track us.
2018-04-18.snippet: Sapna Maheshwari, who covers advertising for The Times, discusses how she tracks the online ads that track us.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Sapna Maheshwari, a reporter who covers advertising for The Times, discussed the tech she’s using.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Following the Trail of Online Ads, Wherever It Leads

2018-04-18.abstract: Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are up against Rafe Spall and other adversaries in this sequel.
2018-04-18.snippet: Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard are up against Rafe Spall and other adversaries in this sequel.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: For anyone who felt the first two teasers for “Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom” didn’t make the sequel look significantly different from its 2015 predecessor, the final trailer should quell those complaints. The mission to rescue the endangered Blue from the now-shuttered theme park is revealed to be a ruse to keep her in captivity and exploit her as an attraction ... and maybe something worse.
2018-04-18.headline_main: ‘Jurassic World’ Trailer: A Rescue Mission Gets Underway

2018-04-18.abstract: His company’s program at the Joyce Theater featured a premiere that, like most of his work, had fine craftsmanship but left little impression.
2018-04-18.snippet: His company’s program at the Joyce Theater featured a premiere that, like most of his work, had fine craftsmanship but left little impression.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Like a golden wedding anniversary, the 50th anniversary of a dance company is an achievement that deserves a celebration — more so, since far fewer dance companies than marriages last that long. In both cases, though, you don’t go to the party expecting surprises.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Review: At Lar Lubovitch’s Golden Anniversary, No Surprises

2018-04-18.abstract: Without the Castro legacy to rely on, his successor will face a minefield of tasks that even Mr. Castro failed to complete.
2018-04-18.snippet: Without the Castro legacy to rely on, his successor will face a minefield of tasks that even Mr. Castro failed to complete.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: HAVANA — Raúl Castro, who took over from his brother Fidel 12 years ago and led Cuba through some of its biggest changes in decades, is expected to step down on Thursday and hand power to someone outside the Castro dynasty for the first time since the Cuban revolution more than half a century ago.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Raúl Castro Prepares to Resign as Cuba’s President, Closing a Dynasty

2018-04-18.abstract: Contrasting approaches by two French cartoonists — one of whom was killed in the 2015 Charlie Hebdo attacks — show differing ways of poking fun at the powerful.
2018-04-18.snippet: Contrasting approaches by two French cartoonists — one of whom was killed in the 2015 Charlie Hebdo attacks — show differing ways of poking fun at the powerful.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: PARIS — From his youth in the 1950s until his death in the attack on the Paris offices of Charlie Hebdo in 2015, the French satirical illustrator Georges Wolinski often returned to drawing a particular image: a man standing at the edge of a cliff.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Provoking, or Pondering? What Makes the Best Satire?

2018-04-18.abstract: Readers call her “undeniably relatable” and admire her philosophy of life and her promotion of literacy.
2018-04-18.snippet: Readers call her “undeniably relatable” and admire her philosophy of life and her promotion of literacy.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2018-04-18.headline_main: Recalling Barbara Bush, an Outspoken First Lady

2018-04-18.abstract: James Garish, who married his kindergarten crush, Liz Stipkovits, on Feb. 17, had no expectations about growing old together. But he didn’t expect breast cancer to take his wife so soon.
2018-04-18.snippet: James Garish, who married his kindergarten crush, Liz Stipkovits, on Feb. 17, had no expectations about growing old together. But he didn’t expect breast cancer to take his wife so soon.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When James Garish married his kindergarten crush Liz Stipkovits on Feb. 17 near their hometown, McKeesport, Pa., it wasn’t with the expectations many couples entertain, about raising a family and growing old together.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Bride Dies Two Months After Her Dream Wedding

2018-04-18.abstract: At Ballet Tech, a Manhattan public school, students spend most of the year getting ready for the big show at the Joyce Theater in June.
2018-04-18.snippet: At Ballet Tech, a Manhattan public school, students spend most of the year getting ready for the big show at the Joyce Theater in June.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: At a recent rehearsal for their annual Kids Dance show, 23 middle schoolers at Ballet Tech were limbered up and ready to fly. A violin cried out as four boys strutted confidently across the studio floor, followed by a group of equally poised girls.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Dance Like the Principal Is Watching

2018-04-18.abstract: Many string musicians, professional and amateur, visit David Segal Violins near Lincoln Center for repairs, maintenance and upgrades, including rare finds.
2018-04-18.snippet: Many string musicians, professional and amateur, visit David Segal Violins near Lincoln Center for repairs, maintenance and upgrades, including rare finds.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When Marilyn Stroh hustled into David Segal Violins on West 68th Street in Manhattan, the tiny shop was hopping. A college student in need of a new viola played a sonata on one near the reception area, while a woman inspected the repaired chin rest on her violin. The phone rang. The door buzzer sounded.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Where Broken Violins Get Fixed. And Valuable Ones Get Sold.

2018-04-18.abstract: His and Paolo Taviani’s movies drew notice in their native Italy and beyond; one, “Padre Padrone,” won the Palme d’Or at Cannes in 1977.
2018-04-18.snippet: His and Paolo Taviani’s movies drew notice in their native Italy and beyond; one, “Padre Padrone,” won the Palme d’Or at Cannes in 1977.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Vittorio Taviani, who with his brother Paolo directed films acclaimed in Italy and beyond, including “Padre Padrone,” which won the top prize at the Cannes Film Festival in 1977, died on Sunday in Rome. He was 88.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Vittorio Taviani, 88, Dies; Made Acclaimed Films With Brother

2018-04-18.abstract: The authorities searched the Stuttgart offices of the sports car maker, one of Volkswagen’s most profitable units, and said a Porsche board member was a suspect in an emissions-cheating scandal.
2018-04-18.snippet: The authorities searched the Stuttgart offices of the sports car maker, one of Volkswagen’s most profitable units, and said a Porsche board member was a suspect in an emissions-cheating scandal.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — A top executive at Volkswagen’s Porsche unit was among those targeted when dozens of police officers raided the sports car maker’s headquarters on Wednesday as part of an investigation into emissions cheating, German prosecutors said.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Top Porsche Official Targeted in German Police Raid Tied to Diesel Scheme

2018-04-18.abstract: Two decades into its career, America’s best-known old-time string band is releasing a new album on a major label. But it’s not letting go of its old-time bona fides.
2018-04-18.snippet: Two decades into its career, America’s best-known old-time string band is releasing a new album on a major label. But it’s not letting go of its old-time bona fides.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — When Old Crow Medicine Show, the nation’s foremost old-time string band, joined the roster of a major label last year, its frontman, Ketch Secor, brought a 78 r.p.m. record of the Fisk Jubilee Singers, unearthed from Columbia Nashville’s catalog, as a symbolic gift.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Old Crow Medicine Show Looks to the Future While Picking at the Past

2018-04-18.abstract: The deliciousness of the details in Elaine Weiss’s new book suggests that certain historical figures warrant entire novels of their own.
2018-04-18.snippet: The deliciousness of the details in Elaine Weiss’s new book suggests that certain historical figures warrant entire novels of their own.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: THE WOMAN’S HOUR The Great Fight to Win the Vote By Elaine Weiss Illustrated. 404 pp. Viking. $28.
2018-04-18.headline_main: In ‘The Woman’s Hour,’ the Battle Over the 19th Amendment Comes to Life

2018-04-18.abstract: Readers discuss evictions and other affordable-housing issues.
2018-04-18.snippet: Readers discuss evictions and other affordable-housing issues.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2018-04-18.headline_main: Keeping a Roof Over More Heads

2018-04-18.abstract: Marketers have long had a symbiotic relationship with the social network. But user concerns about data has companies taking a harder look at how they work with Facebook.
2018-04-18.snippet: Marketers have long had a symbiotic relationship with the social network. But user concerns about data has companies taking a harder look at how they work with Facebook.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Advertisers are the lifeblood of Facebook, and the vast, personal reach of the social network has been a marketer’s dream. But now, some companies are taking a harder look at how they work with it and hunting for skeletons in their own data closets.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Facebook’s Current Status With Advertisers? It’s Complicated

2018-04-18.abstract: Readers discuss a man who was distraught over inaction on climate change and set himself afire in a park.
2018-04-18.snippet: Readers discuss a man who was distraught over inaction on climate change and set himself afire in a park.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2018-04-18.headline_main: Viewing a Suicide as an Environmental Protest

2018-04-18.abstract: The resignation of the environmentalist, Kaveh Madani, was a blow to President Hassan Rouhani, who has encouraged Iranian experts abroad to come home.
2018-04-18.snippet: The resignation of the environmentalist, Kaveh Madani, was a blow to President Hassan Rouhani, who has encouraged Iranian experts abroad to come home.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: An American-educated Iranian expert on water who returned to Iran to take a cabinet-level job in the government of President Hassan Rouhani officially resigned in exile on Wednesday, a month after having left the country while under pressure from hard-liners.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Pressed by Hard-Liners, U.S.-Trained Environmentalist Quits Post in Iran

2018-04-18.abstract: A recent retiree asks, Who will I be now?
2018-04-18.snippet: A recent retiree asks, Who will I be now?
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2018-04-18.headline_main: My New Life as a Retiree

2018-04-18.abstract: People who were married were more likely than single people to have melanoma detected in the earlier, more treatable, stages.
2018-04-18.snippet: People who were married were more likely than single people to have melanoma detected in the earlier, more treatable, stages.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Married people are more likely than the unmarried to get timely diagnosis and treatment for malignant skin cancer.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Married People Less Likely to Die From Melanoma

2018-04-18.abstract: The historian and critic, whom the biennale’s president called “a maestro,” will receive the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement.
2018-04-18.snippet: The historian and critic, whom the biennale’s president called “a maestro,” will receive the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Kenneth Frampton, the architectural historian who wrote the pivotal book “Modern Architecture: A Critical History,” will be the recipient of the Golden Lion for Lifetime Achievement at this year’s edition of the Venice Architecture Biennale.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Venice Architecture Biennale to Honor Kenneth Frampton

2018-04-18.abstract: Prosecutors accused the men of planning to bomb apartments where Somali immigrants lived and prayed. Defense lawyers said the F.B.I. overreached.
2018-04-18.snippet: Prosecutors accused the men of planning to bomb apartments where Somali immigrants lived and prayed. Defense lawyers said the F.B.I. overreached.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: WICHITA, Kan. — Federal jurors convicted three men on Wednesday of plotting to blow up an apartment complex where Somali refugees live and pray in Garden City, Kan. The domestic terrorism verdict came at a time when threats against religious and racial minorities are rising nationally, and the case drew interest from the highest levels of the Justice Department.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Kansas Trio Convicted in Plot to Bomb Somali Immigrants

2018-04-18.abstract: Less than a year into France’s new presidency, anti-Macron sentiment is emerging as a potent force.

2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When it had its premiere in Paris in 1733, Rameau’s “Hippolyte et Aricie” set off a war in French opera. You had to choose sides: Were you an old-fogey “lulliste” — a partisan of Lully, the master composer who’d died nearly 50 years before — or a cutting-edge “ramiste”?
2018-04-18.headline_main: Review: France Once Fought Over This Opera. Juilliard Shows Us Why.

2018-04-18.abstract: R. Lee Ermey’s character won over American teenagers with the promise that he could turn them into the most lethal human killing machines in history.
2018-04-18.snippet: R. Lee Ermey’s character won over American teenagers with the promise that he could turn them into the most lethal human killing machines in history.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: It was the fall of 2004, and I was touring a film set at the studio that was adapting my war memoir, “Jarhead.” The screenwriter walked me onto a soundstage that was supposed to look like my Marine Corps boot-camp barracks. It was small and inconsequential compared with the mighty buildings and squad bays on Marine Corps Recruit Depot, San Diego, where I survived grueling training and verbal abuse 16 years earlier. Still, the room gave off an ominous vibe. The drab colors were right. The bunks were tightly cornered. It closely resembled a boot-camp set from a movie I’d watched many times before. A ghost filled the room: Marine Gunnery Sergeant Hartman.
2018-04-18.headline_main: ‘Full Metal Jacket’ Seduced My Generation and Sent Us to War

2018-04-18.abstract: The space rock crashed in a desert in Sudan in 2008, and the flaws in its embedded minerals are like nothing seen in today’s solar system.
2018-04-18.snippet: The space rock crashed in a desert in Sudan in 2008, and the flaws in its embedded minerals are like nothing seen in today’s solar system.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: In 2008, chunks of space rock crashed in the deserts of Sudan. Diamonds discovered inside one of the recovered meteorites may have come from a destroyed planet that orbited our sun billions of years ago, scientists said on Tuesday. If confirmed, they say, it would be the first time anyone has recovered fragments from one of our solar system’s so-called “lost” planets.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Diamonds in a Meteorite May Be a Lost Planet’s Fragments

She was 75.

2018-04-18.abstract: A portrait of a filmmaker in crisis that might have worked better as a comedy sketch.
2018-04-18.snippet: A portrait of a filmmaker in crisis that might have worked better as a comedy sketch.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: “Godard Mon Amour,” the latest offering from the pasticheur Michel Hazanavicius (“The Artist,” “OSS: 117”), chronicles an eventful year or so in the life of the cineaste Jean-Luc Godard. The period covered by the film includes the 37-year-old Godard’s marriage to the 19-year-old actress Anne Wiazemsky (on whose memoir it’s based) and the uprising of French students and workers in May 1968, a revolt that, among other things, shut down that year’s Cannes Film Festival. On being informed of the existence of Mr. Hazanavicius’s project, Mr. Godard — who is now 87 and whose latest film, “Le Livre d’Image,” will be in Cannes next month — is reported to have called it a “stupid, stupid idea.” Au contraire! (All due respect.) It’s a brilliant idea. It just happens to be a terrible movie.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Review: If You Love Godard, You’ll Hate-Watch ‘Godard Mon Amour’

2018-04-18.abstract: China’s proposed tariffs on soybeans would hit hard in Iowa, Kansas, Missouri, North Dakota and other states with highly competitive House and Senate races.

2018-04-18.headline_main: Across Midwest, Farmers Warn of G.O.P. Losses Over Trump’s Trade Policy

2018-04-18.abstract: The essay stirred controversy on Twitter. It was also the subject of debate at the venerable monthly. Now the editor, James Marcus, is out.
2018-04-18.snippet: The essay stirred controversy on Twitter. It was also the subject of debate at the venerable monthly. Now the editor, James Marcus, is out.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: James Marcus wants the world to know that he was fired from his job as the editor of Harper’s Magazine. He is not stepping down voluntarily to work on a book, which he said was the face-saving “official narrative” offered to him by John R. MacArthur, the magazine’s longtime president and publisher. He also said that he had refused to accept a severance payment that was contingent on his signing a non-disparagement agreement.

2018-04-18.abstract: Two teenage sisters share a life where the extraordinary can be ordinary in this play directed by Alex Howarth.
2018-04-18.snippet: Two teenage sisters share a life where the extraordinary can be ordinary in this play directed by Alex Howarth.
2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: Young Katy can summon a huge band at the tip of her fingers: mandolin, piano, strings, horns — they all join in, one after the other, and make a catchy racket. And yet there are only two musicians by her side, deftly triggering loops and samples. That is one of the many beauties of “We Live by the Sea”: It creates an expansive world out of seemingly little.
2018-04-18.headline_main: Review: In ‘We Live by the Sea,’ a New Neighbor Disrupts the Routine

Moylan, the president of Green-Wood Cemetery, was watching the local news and caught Anthony Weiner, then a congressman, calling for a controversial statue, “Civic Virtue,’’ to be removed from the front of a courthouse in Queens and sold on Craigslist. Referencing Classical allegory, the sculpture depicts virtuous good government in the form of a muscular 11-foot-tall man crushing writhing, feminized aquatic creatures meant to represent all that is inimical to it.

2018-04-18.lead_paragraph: When neo-Nazi and alt-right demonstrators attacked counterprotesters in Charlottesville, Va., last August, killing one and injuring several others, many Americans responded with surprise that white supremacists were suddenly in their midst. 2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: I was talking about music recently with a friend who makes his living cloning genes, manipulating molecules and investigating the pathways of the human immune system. This is a person whose intellectual molecules are clearly very well arranged. But he proceeded to tell me that although he loved classical music, when he listened to it he wasn’t able to perceive anything other than his own emotional reactions.

Comey is currently a lot of things: ex-director of the F.B.I., ex-United States attorney, author, moral crusader, “slimeball” (according to President Trump) and so ubiquitous that he is impossible to ignore. 2018-04-19.abstract: In the Portuguese capital, a weekend’s worth of seafood feasts, chic rooftop bars, undulating streets and landmarks, both Old World and futuristic.
2018-04-19.snippet: In the Portuguese capital, a weekend’s worth of seafood feasts, chic rooftop bars, undulating streets and landmarks, both Old World and futuristic.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: Forget Lisbon as the budget capital of Europe. Yes, the seafood is still (relatively) cheap, as is the wine. The old canary-yellow trams still rattle along steep hills, and you’ll never pay more than a euro and change for a pastéis de nata, the classic Portuguese pastry. But today the Portuguese capital is better known for its red-hot culinary scene and fine cultural institutions, including a new world-class museum on the waterfront. The faded Old Europe charm remains, but with a stream of exciting openings and fresh inspiration drawn from across the Atlantic, Lisbon seems primed for a new golden era.
2018-04-19.headline_main: 36 Hours in Lisbon

2018-04-19.abstract: After hiding behind an alter ego for years, the pop star is ready to step into a more authentic self with ‘Dirty Computer.’
2018-04-19.snippet: After hiding behind an alter ego for years, the pop star is ready to step into a more authentic self with ‘Dirty Computer.’
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: On a hot December afternoon, the sky hazy from wildfires that raged just beyond the Los Angeles city limits, a handful of people gathered outside a nondescript Super 8 motel off Sunset Boulevard. Nearly all were dressed head to toe in black: elegant crepe shirts, fitted leather pants, wide-brimmed hats. The group made their way inside to the Girl at the White Horse, a discreet bar nestled in the space below the motel. Here, the air was still hazy — the synthetic kind, from a machine — and lights tinted the room pink and red, colors of the heart. Low vibrational tones, not unlike those coaxed out of Tibetan singing bowls, droned in the background. Most of the invitees worked for radio stations, record labels or awards shows, and while they waited, they ordered cocktails created for the event: “Pynk” (rosé, gin, aperol and grapefruit) or “Screwed” (pineapple-infused tequila, lime, agave with a touch of pepper).
2018-04-19.headline_main: How Janelle Monáe Found Her Voice

2018-04-19.abstract: There’s a sense of wistfulness among aging Cuban exiles in Miami: Cuba will no longer be led by a Castro. But they don’t expect real change anytime soon.
2018-04-19.snippet: There’s a sense of wistfulness among aging Cuban exiles in Miami: Cuba will no longer be led by a Castro. But they don’t expect real change anytime soon.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — The old Cuban fighters gathered under a cloudless South Florida sky and belted out two national anthems — one for their country a few hundred miles south, the one that gave them life, the other for this country, the one that will probably see their death.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Cubans in Florida Have Waited to See Castros Go, but No One Is Celebrating

2018-04-19.abstract: For decades, marriage to a United States citizen has been a virtual guarantee of legal residency. It isn’t anymore under the Trump administration.
2018-04-19.snippet: For decades, marriage to a United States citizen has been a virtual guarantee of legal residency. It isn’t anymore under the Trump administration.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: They had shown the immigration officer their proof — the eight years of Facebook photos, their 5-year-old son’s birth certificate, the letters from relatives and friends affirming their commitment — and now they were so close, Karah de Oliveira thought, so nearly a normal couple.
2018-04-19.headline_main: A Marriage Used to Prevent Deportation. Not Anymore.

2018-04-19.abstract: Chesley Sullenberger, the pilot during the Miracle on the Hudson in 2009, felt a twinge of recognition at the news of Tammie Jo Shults’s calm handling of a midair crisis.
2018-04-19.snippet: Chesley Sullenberger, the pilot during the Miracle on the Hudson in 2009, felt a twinge of recognition at the news of Tammie Jo Shults’s calm handling of a midair crisis.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: The levelheaded response of Tammie Jo Shults, the captain of a Southwest Airlines flight that suffered a deadly midair engine explosion on Tuesday, reminded some of the so-called Miracle on the Hudson in 2009, when an engine failure forced a plane flying over New York City to make an emergency landing in the Hudson River.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Sully Was Impressed by Southwest Pilot’s Emergency Landing

If you’re going to make the drive up the Great Basin Highway in hopes of finding Basin and Range National Monument — the whereabouts of which many locals seem utterly unfamiliar with — you’re going to want to stock up on food and water here, because you probably will (and probably should) get lost along the way.

2018-04-19.snippet: Our technology sector is good at innovation precisely because it is not dominated by the state.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: Is Silicon Valley going to war? In 2013, Amazon beat IBM for a contract to host the United States intelligence community’s data cloud. Microsoft now markets Azure Government Secret, its cloud-computing service designed specifically for federal and local governments, to the Defense Department and intelligence agencies. And last year, Google signed a contract with the Pentagon for Project Maven, a pilot program to accelerate the military’s use of artificial intelligence.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Why Silicon Valley Shouldn’t Work With the Pentagon

2018-04-19.abstract: One’s the U.S. poet laureate. The other is the National Ambassador for Young People’s Literature. Can they bring literature to the masses?
2018-04-19.snippet: One’s the U.S. poet laureate. The other is the National Ambassador for Young People’s Literature. Can they bring literature to the masses?
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: In 2018, the writer and poet Jacqueline Woodson was appointed National Ambassador for Young People’s Literature. The author Tracy K. Smith is in the second of her two years as the poet laureate of the United States. In the midst of National Poetry Month, the two joined up to talk about reading, poetry, black history — and how their missions overlap. These are edited excerpts from the conversation.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Tracy K. Smith and Jacqueline Woodson Talk Reading, Race and Spreading the Gospel of Literature

2018-04-19.headline_main: The Underworld Will Stop in London en Route to Broadway

2018-04-19.abstract: A doctor who suggested that a popular, alcohol-based tonic was dangerous was held for nearly 100 days. He emerged as a public hero.
2018-04-19.snippet: A doctor who suggested that a popular, alcohol-based tonic was dangerous was held for nearly 100 days. He emerged as a public hero.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — For nearly 100 days, a Chinese doctor, Tan Qindong, was jailed for an essay he wrote. He slept beside a toilet, crammed in with other suspects, with little but steamed buns to eat. But his offending article was no dissident political tract.
2018-04-19.headline_main: For Faulting a Chinese Tonic, He Got 3 Months in Jail. Then Cheers.

2018-04-19.snippet: A weakened Angela Merkel, a surge in Italian populism and unresolved Brexit issues have undermined the French president’s push to reinvigorate the E.U.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Last September, the enthusiastic new French president, Emmanuel Macron, laid out big plans for the European Union, intended to give fresh spark and purpose to a bloc preoccupied with migration, populism and Britain’s exit, and to breathe new life into Franco-German leadership.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Macron Had a Big Plan for Europe. It’s Now Falling Apart.

2018-04-19.abstract: The film is a nod to vintage British horror anthologies.
2018-04-19.snippet: The film is a nod to vintage British horror anthologies.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: That “Ghost Stories,” an homage of sorts to vintage British horror anthologies, is earning overwhelming raves on Rotten Tomatoes is more shocking than anything lurking within its frames. Managing to feel at once painfully slow and bafflingly truncated, this creaky triptych of not-so-scary tales is a tame curiosity of movie nostalgia.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: A Paranormal Sleuth Investigates Three ‘Ghost Stories’

2018-04-19.abstract: Catherine Keener stars in the true story of a woman fighting to keep her house from the clutches of eminent domain.
2018-04-19.snippet: Catherine Keener stars in the true story of a woman fighting to keep her house from the clutches of eminent domain.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: In its earnest attempt to present a landmark legal case as a classic underdog story, “Little Pink House,” based on Jeff Benedict’s 2009 book of the same name, succeeds neither narratively nor visually. And not because the setup lacks drama: The true story of Susette Kelo’s yearslong battle to save her waterfront home in a declining Connecticut town would conclude in the U.S. Supreme Court. It’s simply that the writer and director, Courtney Moorehead Balaker, fails to translate that drama into the language of movies.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: Fighting to Save Her ‘Little Pink House’

2018-04-19.abstract: Jason Sudeikis and Ed Harris bond over analog media in this drama.
2018-04-19.snippet: Jason Sudeikis and Ed Harris bond over analog media in this drama.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: “Kodachrome” is based on an article that A.G. Sulzberger, who became the publisher of The New York Times this January, wrote in 2010. It concerned the international rush on Dwayne’s Photo in Parsons, Kan., which became the world’s last processor of the discontinued color film Kodachrome.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: ‘Kodachrome,’ an Ode to Color Film, Now Streaming Near You

2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: In ‘The Devil and Father Amorth,’ a Filmmaker Gets Real

2018-04-19.abstract: Majid Majidi’s new film aims for neorealism but winds up relying on dynamics that are commonplace, if not outright clichéd.
2018-04-19.snippet: Majid Majidi’s new film aims for neorealism but winds up relying on dynamics that are commonplace, if not outright clichéd.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: The veteran Iranian filmmaker Majid Majidi has terrific talent for staging and shooting. His story instincts, however, are more run of the mill. “Beyond the Clouds,” which he wrote with Mehran Kashani, is a tale of a bad kid who rediscovers his good side, and it relies on dynamics that are commonplace if not outright clichéd.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: In ‘Beyond the Clouds,’ a Brother and Sister Struggle in Mumbai

2018-04-19.abstract: The documentary traces the experiences of six women who settled in the United States after the end of World War II.
2018-04-19.snippet: The documentary traces the experiences of six women who settled in the United States after the end of World War II.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: The anguish that underlies “After Auschwitz” is profound. Yet hope still flickers throughout this documentary, which tells the stories of six Jewish women who survived the Nazi death machine and went on to rebuild their lives in the United States.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: ‘After Auschwitz’ Looks at Six Survivors and Their Lives

2018-04-19.abstract: “Lou Andreas-Salomé, the Audacity to Be Free” casts four actresses to show the evolution of a 19th-century writer with an unusual life.
2018-04-19.snippet: “Lou Andreas-Salomé, the Audacity to Be Free” casts four actresses to show the evolution of a 19th-century writer with an unusual life.
2018-04-19.lead_paragraph: “Lou Andreas-Salomé, the Audacity to Be Free” is a thoroughly researched biopic that tells the story of the 19th-century writer Lou Andreas-Salomé, a nonconformist whose unusual life might have been better served by less familiar filmmaking. Beginning with Andreas-Salomé’s youthful renunciation of eroticism and following her through the affairs that would change her mind and make her famous, the movie fights to establish this controversial figure as an integral part of intellectual life in her time.
2018-04-19.headline_main: Review: ‘Lou Andreas-Salomé’ Places a Great Woman in Her Time
