2018-04-26.snippet: Late-night hosts discussed the most recent accusations against the Trump administration’s pick to lead the Veterans Affairs Department.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If you’re interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Stephen Colbert Takes On Ronny Jackson Controversy

2018-04-26.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2018-04-26.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: (Want to get this briefing by email? Here’s the sign-up.)
2018-04-26.headline_main: Ronny Jackson, Golden State Killer, Bill Cosby: Your Thursday Briefing

2018-04-26.abstract: The two Republican presidents are a study in contrasts, each with a profound effect on our country.
2018-04-26.snippet: The two Republican presidents are a study in contrasts, each with a profound effect on our country.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: George H.W. Bush once vomited on the prime minister of Japan. It was a mortifying but innocent incident, the result of a nasty stomach bug. Donald Trump has spent the last couple of days effectively doing likewise on France’s Emmanuel Macron.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Bush 41, Trump, and American Decline

2018-04-26.abstract: As an essential platform for speech, the company owes users due process.
2018-04-26.snippet: As an essential platform for speech, the company owes users due process.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: NEW HAVEN — Tuesday was a huge day for online speech. Facebook finally released the internal rules that its moderators use to decide what kinds of user content to remove from the site, including once-mysterious details on what counts as “graphic violence,” “hate speech” or “child exploitation.” It also announced the introduction of an appeals process for users who want to challenge the removal of their posts.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Facebook Released Its Content Moderation Rules. Now What?

2018-04-26.abstract: President Trump has overturned the Republican establishment, but at what cost?
2018-04-26.snippet: President Trump has overturned the Republican establishment, but at what cost?
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: In the end, the wheelers and dealers faded away, trying to get what they could under cover of darkness. Their loss of stature was abrupt. Only those willing to soldier on as subordinates remained, ceding authority to their leader, President Trump.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Meet the New Boss. Actually Quite Different From the Old Boss.

2018-04-26.abstract: The battle between the White House and blue states raises questions about the limits of federal authority.
2018-04-26.snippet: The battle between the White House and blue states raises questions about the limits of federal authority.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: In the civil war now being waged in this country, the combatants are not the blue and the gray of old. It’s the White House versus the blue states.
2018-04-26.headline_main: The Supreme Court and the New Civil War

2018-04-26.abstract: Gang members who left the notorious gang by embracing God give us clues about how to mitigate its influence.
2018-04-26.snippet: Gang members who left the notorious gang by embracing God give us clues about how to mitigate its influence.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Ernesto Deras cannot explain why he got up from his seat, approached the front of a church in the Panorama City neighborhood of Los Angeles, and started crying uncontrollably.
2018-04-26.headline_main: How to Leave MS-13 Alive

2018-04-26.abstract: He’s been accused of handing drugs out like candy, to people whose medical histories he probably knew nothing about.
2018-04-26.snippet: He’s been accused of handing drugs out like candy, to people whose medical histories he probably knew nothing about.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Dr. Ronny L. Jackson, President Trump’s personal physician and his pick to lead the Veterans Affairs Department, dropped out of the running Thursday morning, after being accused of inappropriately dispensing drugs, including the opioid Percocet, to others, and prescribing himself medication.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Ronny Jackson Should Never Have Headed the V.A. Should He Even Be Practicing Medicine?

2018-04-26.abstract: The expulsion was the latest action in a mounting diplomatic dispute prompted by the discovery of a Filipina maid’s body in a freezer in February.
2018-04-26.snippet: The expulsion was the latest action in a mounting diplomatic dispute prompted by the discovery of a Filipina maid’s body in a freezer in February.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: MANILA — Tensions between Kuwait and the Philippines have been further inflamed after a mounting dispute over the treatment of Filipino workers in the oil-rich Arab state resulted in the expulsion of the Philippine ambassador this week.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Philippine Envoy to Kuwait Expelled After So-Called Rescue of Domestic Workers

2018-04-26.abstract: In considering the restrictions, the justices seem focused on one question: Should the president’s authority have anything to do with his personal beliefs?
2018-04-26.snippet: In considering the restrictions, the justices seem focused on one question: Should the president’s authority have anything to do with his personal beliefs?

2018-04-26.abstract: In considering the restrictions, the justices seem focused on one question: Should the president’s authority have anything to do with his personal beliefs?

2018-04-26.abstract: For people who are not gender conforming, traditional parent names may not fit. Some are trying mash-ups like “Mather” or “Maddie.”
2018-04-26.snippet: For people who are not gender conforming, traditional parent names may not fit. Some are trying mash-ups like “Mather” or “Maddie.”
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: When Amanda Davidson, a 42-year-old Los Angeles-based artist and writer, welcomed her firstborn child in December — a boy named Felix — with her partner Isaac Schankler, 39, a composer, she chafed at the assumptions the medical staff members made about how the pair wanted to identify themselves as parents.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Some L.G.B.T. Parents Reject the Names ‘Mommy’ and ‘Daddy’

2018-04-26.abstract: Thursday: Local trials to watch, idyllic spring weather, and a new side to Prospect Park.
2018-04-26.snippet: Thursday: Local trials to watch, idyllic spring weather, and a new side to Prospect Park.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:48 a.m.
2018-04-26.headline_main: New York Today: Catching Up on the Courts

2018-04-26.abstract: A doctor on a boat that rescued hundreds of migrants trying to cross the Mediterranean Sea recounts how these trips are becoming more dangerous for NGOs and refugees.
2018-04-26.snippet: A doctor on a boat that rescued hundreds of migrants trying to cross the Mediterranean Sea recounts how these trips are becoming more dangerous for NGOs and refugees.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Stinging, salty waves crashed over the deck as frantic figures climbed on board. It was midnight in November, and we were 30 miles off the coast of Libya, where our small ship was quickly filling with scores of terrified, freezing refugees whom we had rescued from the chilly waters. I stepped over an elderly paraplegic man sprawled on the deck so I could wrap blankets around a teenage Egyptian boy battling hypothermia. His eyes rolled back in his head as he tried to stay awake.
2018-04-26.headline_main: What Refugees Face on the World’s Deadliest Migration Route

2018-04-26.abstract: The plan by a new chief executive means that the bank is giving up its efforts to compete on equal terms with Wall Street behemoths.
2018-04-26.snippet: The plan by a new chief executive means that the bank is giving up its efforts to compete on equal terms with Wall Street behemoths.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Deutsche Bank said on Thursday that it would shrink its operations in the United States and Asia and focus on Europe, effectively abandoning its ambition to be a member of Wall Street’s big leagues.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Deutsche Bank Abandons Wall Street Ambitions, and Focuses on Europe

2018-04-26.abstract: Two previous meetings between leaders of the Koreas paved the way for the talks Friday between Kim Jong-un and Moon Jae-in.
2018-04-26.snippet: Two previous meetings between leaders of the Koreas paved the way for the talks Friday between Kim Jong-un and Moon Jae-in.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — In 2000, Kim Dae-jung, then South Korea’s president, flew to Pyongyang to meet with Kim Jong-il, the leader of North Korea — the first time talks had ever been held between leaders of the two sides.
2018-04-26.headline_main: When North Met South: A Short History of Inter-Korean Summits

2018-04-26.abstract: This film set against the backdrop of the 1992 Los Angeles riots is well-acted across the board.
2018-04-26.snippet: This film set against the backdrop of the 1992 Los Angeles riots is well-acted across the board.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The South Central Los Angeles household overseen by Millie Dunbar (Halle Berry) in “Kings” is a super chaotic one. This single woman oversees eight foster children in her apartment. They are raucous and loud, which excites her already easily irritable neighbor Obie (Daniel Craig), a British man who stands out as one of the few white residents in the neighborhood.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: Halle Berry, Daniel Craig and Los Angeles Tensions in ‘Kings’

2018-04-26.abstract: Sadaf Foroughi’s debut feature is visually inventive and dramatically bitter.
2018-04-26.snippet: Sadaf Foroughi’s debut feature is visually inventive and dramatically bitter.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: “Ava,” the first feature from the Iranian-Canadian filmmaker Sadaf Foroughi, is an exquisitely photographed train heading straight for a brick wall. Lurching relentlessly from one conflict to another, the movie distills its emotions — and maintains its momentum — in conversations of remarkably controlled intensity.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Ava,’ a Tehran Teenager Fights Oppression

2018-04-26.abstract: Daniel Jerome Gill’s romantic drama, leaden with Britpop nostalgia, follows some of the most conventional moves of the cinematic playbook.
2018-04-26.snippet: Daniel Jerome Gill’s romantic drama, leaden with Britpop nostalgia, follows some of the most conventional moves of the cinematic playbook.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Britpop is a musical genre I had neutral feelings toward before sitting through “Modern Life Is Rubbish,” a uselessly nostalgic movie named after Blur’s 1993 album. After it, I wondered whether I had been too generous.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Modern Life Is Rubbish,’ a Musician Fights Maturity, Again

2018-04-26.abstract: A pair of fired deputies set out to retrieve an escaped prisoner and appease a crusty old sheriff, but complications ensue.
2018-04-26.snippet: A pair of fired deputies set out to retrieve an escaped prisoner and appease a crusty old sheriff, but complications ensue.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: A pastiche of western tropes too tongue-in-cheek to sell its dramatic intentions, but just sincere enough to smother any intimations of parody, “The Escape of Prisoner 614” never commits to a consistent tone. Or even a consistent setting, really. Although the film takes place in upstate New York in a vaguely 1960s period, the accents sound like the work of actors playing lawman dress-up after too many viewings of “Bonnie and Clyde.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘The Escape of Prisoner 614,’ Tone Escapes as Well

2018-04-26.abstract: In this personal movie, the actress Ashley Bell embarks on an elephant rescue in Thailand that also reveals the threats to the animal’s survival.
2018-04-26.snippet: In this personal movie, the actress Ashley Bell embarks on an elephant rescue in Thailand that also reveals the threats to the animal’s survival.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The actress Ashley Bell is best known for her work in horror movies. Her outstanding credits include “The Last Exorcism” (2010), “Dark Intentions” (2015) and “Psychopath” (2017). Given this filmography, she isn’t necessarily the first person you’d think would produce an informative, emotionally charged documentary about animal cruelty and the people who are trying to stop it.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Love & Bananas,’ Uncovering the Plight of the Asian Elephant

2018-04-26.abstract: The documentary doesn’t figure out how to deal with a woman who essentially owes her fame to the obfuscation of her past.
2018-04-26.snippet: The documentary doesn’t figure out how to deal with a woman who essentially owes her fame to the obfuscation of her past.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The ostensible draw of “The Rachel Divide” is a chance to see Rachel Dolezal — the former N.A.A.C.P. chapter president of Spokane, Wash., who was the subject of a news media firestorm that began in 2015 after reports revealed that she was white — as a human being instead of a caricature.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: ‘The Rachel Divide,’ About Rachel Dolezal, Goes No More Than Skin-Deep

2018-04-26.abstract: The documentary listens to dozens of student and academics who find that the test, and the ACT, fail to accurately gauge potential or ability.
2018-04-26.snippet: The documentary listens to dozens of student and academics who find that the test, and the ACT, fail to accurately gauge potential or ability.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: “Mathematics, science, being able to use the English language: These tests don’t measure it and they don’t improve it — so why do they exist?” the president of Bard College says early in “The Test and the Art of Thinking,” a documentary about the SAT exam.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: ‘The Test and the Art of Thinking’ Is About A) The SAT

2018-04-26.abstract: Isabelle Huppert plays an inept educator who finds new abilities when a laboratory experiment goes awry.
2018-04-26.snippet: Isabelle Huppert plays an inept educator who finds new abilities when a laboratory experiment goes awry.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: As the title character of Serge Bozon’s “Mrs. Hyde” — a peculiar hybrid of science fiction, horror and comedy — Isabelle Huppert appears almost unbearably fragile. Dressed in too-long skirts and too-small sweaters, her skin preternaturally translucent and her collarbone a knife edge, she stands, frozen, in front of a classroom erupting with rowdy students. They can see her vulnerability and scent her ineptitude, and they are contemptuous.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: Zapped by Lightning, a French Teacher Becomes ‘Mrs. Hyde’

2018-04-26.abstract: This movie from the Egyptian director Tamer El Said revolves around a filmmaker at work.
2018-04-26.snippet: This movie from the Egyptian director Tamer El Said revolves around a filmmaker at work.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The Egyptian director Tamer El Said’s “In the Last Days of the City” opens in December 2009, well before the ouster of President Hosni Mubarak in early 2011. Yet it feels like a throwback to an even earlier era of art film in its pacing, in its interest in backdrops and in its willingness to risk being cryptic.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: ‘In the Last Days of the City’ Is an Ode to Cairo

2018-04-26.abstract: Peter Livolsi’s painfully quirky tale features two damaged young men — and a woman obsessed with her long-ago mentor, R. Buckminster Fuller.
2018-04-26.snippet: Peter Livolsi’s painfully quirky tale features two damaged young men — and a woman obsessed with her long-ago mentor, R. Buckminster Fuller.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: As if his name weren’t enough of a burden, Sebastian Prendergast (Asa Butterfield) must also deal with a grandmother, Josephine (Ellen Burstyn), whose controlling ways are capped only by her obsession with her long-ago mentor, the architect and inventor R. Buckminster Fuller.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: Punk and Futurism Collide in ‘The House of Tomorrow’

2018-04-26.abstract: Olivier Assayas’s “Cold Water” follows two French adolescents on the road to nowhere. It is finally getting a theatrical release in the United States.
2018-04-26.snippet: Olivier Assayas’s “Cold Water” follows two French adolescents on the road to nowhere. It is finally getting a theatrical release in the United States.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: “Cold Water,” Olivier Assayas’s paean to adolescent desperation, is as bracing as its title suggests. Screened at the New York Film Festival in 1994, it introduced American audiences to a promising talent who became one of France’s leading filmmakers. Despite positive reviews, “Cold Water” was never commercially released here in part because of difficulty in clearing the rights to material sung by Janis Joplin, Bob Dylan, Leonard Cohen and others.
2018-04-26.headline_main: A Fiery Tale of Teenage Despair, as Fresh as When It Debuted in 1994

2018-04-26.abstract: The second round, which begins Thursday, features a matchup of longtime rivals, a meeting of the top two teams in the East, and a battle of the best in the West.
2018-04-26.snippet: The second round, which begins Thursday, features a matchup of longtime rivals, a meeting of the top two teams in the East, and a battle of the best in the West.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Sure, the division champion Washington Capitals and the two-time defending Stanley Cup champion Pittsburgh Penguins split their four-game season series, but we’re not talking about the regular season anymore. The playoff history between these teams is much more lopsided.
2018-04-26.headline_main: N.H.L. Playoff Preview: Penguins and Capitals Get Reacquainted

2018-04-26.abstract: With unpalatable characters and a crude style, the film makes robbing a comic book convention seem like a bore.
2018-04-26.snippet: With unpalatable characters and a crude style, the film makes robbing a comic book convention seem like a bore.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: As a fading attraction of the comic-book convention circuit, Keith Mahar (Russell Peters) is a regular at Supercon, a fan-driven festival that allows this former child actor to charge fans for his autograph. Relegated to sparsely attended panels for 1980s television, Keith drinks and bellyaches with fellow festival D-listers, Matt (Ryan Kwanten), Brock (Brooks Braselman) and Allison (Maggie Grace). The star of the Supercon convention is Adam King (Clancy Brown), a veteran of a science fiction show akin to “Star Trek” whose ego threatens to overshadow his gigantic Supercon autograph fees. After a confrontation between Keith and King leads the convention’s manager, Gil (Mike Epps, a standout), to remove Keith and his friends from the convention lineup, the group of festival outcasts conspire to rob Supercon.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: ‘Supercon’ Cheats Its Audience Out of a Good Heist

2018-04-26.abstract: Two couples struggle to find serenity as middle age and its multiple discontents come breathing down their necks.
2018-04-26.snippet: Two couples struggle to find serenity as middle age and its multiple discontents come breathing down their necks.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Every now and then I bemoan the scarcity — in terms of national exposure at least — of good regional filmmaking in this country. If you share this view, the New York opening of “Rogers Park” ought to be a welcome event.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Rogers Park,’ Life and Love in a Chicago Neighborhood

2018-04-26.abstract: Deutsche Bank is effectively abandoning its ambition to be a member of Wall Street’s big leagues. That raises one question: Why did it take so long?
2018-04-26.snippet: Deutsche Bank is effectively abandoning its ambition to be a member of Wall Street’s big leagues. That raises one question: Why did it take so long?
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Good Thursday. Here’s what we’re watching:
2018-04-26.headline_main: Three Reasons Deutsche Bank Didn’t Exit Wall Street Earlier: DealBook Briefing

2018-04-26.abstract: Here are five highlights to see from “Birds: A Festival Inspired by Aristophanes,” a citywide festival featuring a range of cultural events.
2018-04-26.snippet: Here are five highlights to see from “Birds: A Festival Inspired by Aristophanes,” a citywide festival featuring a range of cultural events.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: If you took a — forgive the phrase — bird’s-eye view of culture, it wouldn’t take long to see just how much ornithological inspiration has led to some of the greatest art of the past few thousand years. Their flight and liberty, but also their imprisonment, have been metaphorical fodder for titans like Aristophanes, Picasso and Stravinsky. Maya Angelou’s bird sings of freedom.
2018-04-26.headline_main: From Aristophanes to Hitchcock, Celebrating Birds and Culture

2018-04-26.abstract: The U.S. has refused to waive diplomatic immunity despite Pakistan’s demands that the military attaché face trial for the death of a man on a motorcycle.
2018-04-26.snippet: The U.S. has refused to waive diplomatic immunity despite Pakistan’s demands that the military attaché face trial for the death of a man on a motorcycle.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan — An American military attaché has been barred from leaving Pakistan after his sport utility vehicle struck a motorcycle and killed one of its riders this month, in another flare-up of diplomatic tensions between the two countries.
2018-04-26.headline_main: U.S. Military Official Barred From Leaving Pakistan After His S.U.V. Kills Man

2018-04-26.abstract: Accusations leveled against Dr. Ronny L. Jackson’s time leading the White House medical staff led lawmakers to have concerns over his nomination.
2018-04-26.snippet: Accusations leveled against Dr. Ronny L. Jackson’s time leading the White House medical staff led lawmakers to have concerns over his nomination.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — To senior White House aides serving the last three presidents, Dr. Ronny L. Jackson was the war-tested doctor who served in Iraq, helped them cope with their high-pressure jobs and ran his medical staff with the rigor befitting his rank of rear admiral in the Navy.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Isolation of White House Medical Unit Hid Ronny Jackson From Scrutiny

2018-04-26.abstract: The Department of Health and Human Services learned of the missing children only after calling people who took responsibility for the youths when they were released from government custody.
2018-04-26.snippet: The Department of Health and Human Services learned of the missing children only after calling people who took responsibility for the youths when they were released from government custody.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A top official with the Department of Health and Human Services told members of Congress on Thursday that the agency had lost track of nearly 1,500 migrant children it placed with sponsors in the United States, raising concerns they could end up in the hands of human traffickers or be used as laborers by people posing as relatives.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Federal Agencies Lost Track of Nearly 1,500 Migrant Children Placed With Sponsors

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump distanced himself from his longtime lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, on Thursday, saying that a federal criminal investigation was focused on Mr. Cohen’s business dealings and had nothing to do with his legal representation of the president.

2018-04-26.abstract: Protests now sweeping Nicaragua represent a rejection of Daniel Ortega’s blatant aspiration to perpetuate himself and his family in power at any cost.
2018-04-26.snippet: Protests now sweeping Nicaragua represent a rejection of Daniel Ortega’s blatant aspiration to perpetuate himself and his family in power at any cost.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — Forty years ago, on Jan. 10, 1978, my grandfather, Pedro Joaquín Chamorro, was shot and killed in Nicaragua. He was a journalist and civic leader who opposed the dynastic dictatorship of Nicaragua’s Somoza family. Scholars widely cite his assassination as the trigger of the regime’s popular overthrow. My grandfather has lived on as a national symbol of civil liberties — which is why both as his grandson and as a young historian of the Sandinista revolution, I feel I must speak out.
2018-04-26.headline_main: The Beginning of the End for Ortega?

2018-04-26.abstract: Novice and veteran travelers alike will find a lot to love in Copenhagen. Before you go, check out our local guide for tips and pack these essentials for your trip.
2018-04-26.snippet: Novice and veteran travelers alike will find a lot to love in Copenhagen. Before you go, check out our local guide for tips and pack these essentials for your trip.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Copenhagen is a combination of Old World Europe and 21st century modern sensibilities. Both extend deep, beyond the art and architecture to the life and feel of the city. We have tips to help you explore Copenhagen in our local guide. But before you go, pack these essentials to make the most of your trip.
2018-04-26.headline_main: What to Pack for a Trip to Copenhagen

Untold before now, there’s a fundamental flaw in the way the United States military screens claims of civilian casualties that surely deflates the total numbers.

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The first time the musician and artist Cody Critcheloe came to New York, in 2001 when he was 19, his trip turned into a pilgrimage. “I walked around the city trying to find the place where the Mudd Club and Danceteria used to be,” he said. “When I found them, I just stood there, staring ridiculously up at these buildings saying, ‘cool’ — as if they were still there.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Ssion, a D.I.Y. Hero of the Technicolor Underground, Returns Refreshed

2018-04-26.abstract: The generic ballot, the president’s approval rating, recent special elections and a seat-by-seat look all point to a modest edge for Democrats.
2018-04-26.snippet: The generic ballot, the president’s approval rating, recent special elections and a seat-by-seat look all point to a modest edge for Democrats.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: With less than 200 days until the midterm elections, Democrats are generally thought to have a slight advantage in the fight for control of the House. That doesn’t mean they are going to prevail. The polls could be wrong, as all should understand by now, and there’s more than enough time for the national political environment to turn in favor of the Republicans. But these four indicators, for now, are consistent with a Democratic edge. Here’s what they are and what they’re telling us.
2018-04-26.headline_main: What to Keep in Mind When Thinking About the Midterms

2018-04-26.abstract: Investigators used DNA from crime scenes and plugged that genetic profile into an online genealogy database, tracing DNA to the suspect, Joseph James DeAngelo.
2018-04-26.snippet: Investigators used DNA from crime scenes and plugged that genetic profile into an online genealogy database, tracing DNA to the suspect, Joseph James DeAngelo.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — The Golden State Killer raped and murdered victims across California in an era before Google searches and social media, a time when the police relied on shoe leather, not cellphone records or big data.
2018-04-26.headline_main: How a Genealogy Site Led to the Front Door of the Golden State Killer Suspect

2018-04-26.abstract: How did Zedd, Maren Morris and a 23-year-old songwriter turn a few chords into an enormous hit?
2018-04-26.snippet: How did Zedd, Maren Morris and a 23-year-old songwriter turn a few chords into an enormous hit?
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: “Watch How a Pop Hit Is Made” is a six-minute film that touches on themes of artistic collaboration, the creative process and music. Using voice memos, demos, texts and interviews, the film reconstructs the wild ride of how Zedd, Maren Morris and Sarah Aarons, a 23-year-old songwriter, turned a few chords into an enormous hit, “The Middle.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Teaching With: ‘Watch How a Pop Hit is Made.’

2018-04-26.abstract: Gianandrea Noseda says is departing the Teatro Regio Torino, where he has been music director since 2007, amid administrative upheaval.
2018-04-26.snippet: Gianandrea Noseda says is departing the Teatro Regio Torino, where he has been music director since 2007, amid administrative upheaval.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The Italian conductor Gianandrea Noseda, whose American career has taken off in recent years with his appointment as music director of the National Symphony Orchestra in Washington and with high-profile performances at the Metropolitan Opera, announced on Thursday that he was leaving the Teatro Regio Torino, the Italian opera house he has helped restore to prominence over the past decade.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Tumult at an Italian Opera House: A Major Conductor Leaves Turin

2018-04-26.abstract: A reader wants to withhold an invitation to a family party from the sibling who did the same on her wedding day.
2018-04-26.snippet: A reader wants to withhold an invitation to a family party from the sibling who did the same on her wedding day.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: A year ago, my sister got married. Only parents were invited. My sister told me I couldn’t come because she and the groom didn’t want to make his brother, who lives in Berlin, feel obligated to make an expensive trip. When my father questioned this, my sister exploded and eloped without my parents there. A year later, things are still strained. I am planning a 65th birthday party for my mother, who wants my sister to come. I think I’m still owed an apology. My sister demands we respect her choices (without regard for our hurt feelings). Advice?
2018-04-26.headline_main: I’m Still Salty About My Sister’s Elopement

2018-04-26.abstract: In 1987 he broke Lou Gehrig’s record for consecutive games played, only to see his testament to durability exceeded nine years later by Cal Ripken Jr.
2018-04-26.snippet: In 1987 he broke Lou Gehrig’s record for consecutive games played, only to see his testament to durability exceeded nine years later by Cal Ripken Jr.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Sachio Kinugasa, the Japanese slugger who in 1987 broke Lou Gehrig’s record for consecutive games played, only to see his testament to durability exceeded nine years later by Cal Ripken Jr., died on Monday. He was 71.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Sachio Kinugasa, Japanese Baseball’s Iron Man, Is Dead at 71

2018-04-26.snippet: Siberian truck drivers, who haul heavy loads on winter roads made of ice that melts earlier every year, are true believers in climate change.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: TAS-YURYAKH, Russia — At a truck stop at the northern terminus of the Vilyui ice highway in northeastern Siberia, drivers make small talk not about life on the road but rather the life of the road.

2018-04-26.abstract: Khan’s offer to buy Wembley would give the N.F.L. its deepest roots in London, where the Jaguars have played annually since 2013.
2018-04-26.snippet: Khan’s offer to buy Wembley would give the N.F.L. its deepest roots in London, where the Jaguars have played annually since 2013.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Jacksonville Jaguars’ billionaire owner, Shahid Khan, has offered to buy London’s iconic Wembley Stadium, a move that offers perhaps the clearest signal yet that the N.F.L. is increasingly poised to establish a semi-permanent franchise in Britain after years of visits to the city.

2018-04-26.snippet: The Senate Judiciary Committee, on a bipartisan vote, advanced legislation that would allow special counsels like Robert S. Mueller III to appeal their firing.

Mueller III to appeal their firing to a panel of judges and possibly be reinstated.
2018-04-26.headline_main: In Warning to Trump, Senators Advance Bill to Protect Mueller

2018-04-26.abstract: Little tykes are hoisting barbells, sometimes heavier than their own body weight.
2018-04-26.snippet: Little tykes are hoisting barbells, sometimes heavier than their own body weight.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: On a frigid Saturday in February, Etta Nichols strutted proudly into Hall B1 of the Spokane Convention Center in Washington to undertake her third deadlift of the day. This lift is five kilos more than “two times her body weight,” an M.C. boasted over the public-announcement system, eliciting a roar of cheers from the crowd.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Oof! Uhh! Mom? Meet the Peewee Powerlifters

2018-04-26.abstract: Remember “Draft Day,” starring Kevin Costner? Here’s what the film got right about football’s drama-filled night.

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The movie “Draft Day” did not electrify the critics or the box office when it came out in 2014. While praising its lead actor, Kevin Costner, A.O. Scott in The New York Times called it “a marshmallowy melodrama of masculinity in crisis.”

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: PERTH, Australia — The Italian sandwich — the submarine, the hoagie, the hero, the grinder, the wedge — is widely believed to have been invented in Maine in the first years of the 20th century. It was also invented, about 50 years later, in Perth.

2018-04-26.abstract: After a decades-long search to solve a string of rapes and murders in California, Mr. DeAngelo, a former police officer, came under scrutiny last week.
2018-04-26.snippet: After a decades-long search to solve a string of rapes and murders in California, Mr. DeAngelo, a former police officer, came under scrutiny last week.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: From 1976 to 1986, one man struck fear in the hearts of Californians from Sacramento to San Francisco to Los Angeles, killing 12 people, raping at least 45 people and burglarizing more than 120 homes in meticulously planned crimes.

2018-04-26.headline_main: Yawkey Way, Where Red Sox Fans Converge, Will Be Renamed Over Racism Concerns

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Spider webs present an intriguing challenge to evolutionary biologists.

2018-04-26.abstract: A four-part Netflix documentary series recounts a swath of 1960s social and political history, but the man at its center remains elusive.
2018-04-26.snippet: A four-part Netflix documentary series recounts a swath of 1960s social and political history, but the man at its center remains elusive.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: “Bobby Kennedy for President,” a four-part documentary coming out shortly before the 50th anniversary of Robert F. Kennedy’s assassination, sounds like a departure for Netflix. The streaming service’s lineup of original documentary series has been dominated by variations on true crime, with the occasional side trip into environmental scandal or cooking. A comprehensive survey of a major historical figure would be something new.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: In ‘Bobby Kennedy for President,’ a Don Draper of Politics

2018-04-26.abstract: The subscription-based service for movie theater tickets is facing questions about its long-term viability, but executives say they are confident the company will flourish.

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — MoviePass has had a hard few months.
2018-04-26.headline_main: MoviePass Says All Is Well. Even Some of Its Customers Are Skeptical.

2018-04-26.abstract: A jury in Pennsylvania voted to convict Mr. Cosby of sexually assaulting a former Temple University staff member who had looked up to him as a mentor.
2018-04-26.snippet: A jury in Pennsylvania voted to convict Mr. Cosby of sexually assaulting a former Temple University staff member who had looked up to him as a mentor.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: NORRISTOWN, Pa. — A jury found Bill Cosby guilty Thursday of drugging and sexually assaulting a woman at his home near here 14 years ago, capping the downfall of one of the world’s best-known entertainers, and offering a measure of satisfaction to the dozens of women who for years have accused him of similar assaults against them.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Bill Cosby Is Found Guilty of Sexual Assault

2018-04-26.abstract: The best teenage comments from last week’s writing prompts, and an invitation to join the conversation this week.
2018-04-26.snippet: The best teenage comments from last week’s writing prompts, and an invitation to join the conversation this week.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Two writing prompts this week saw conversations develop in real time among students in far-flung locations, something we always love to see.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Dress Codes, Anti-Bias Training, Standardized Tests and Smiles: Our Favorite Student Comments of the Week

2018-04-26.abstract: Alia Shawkat and Laia Costa star in this charmer about strangers who hook up and try to cram a world of togetherness into a day and night.
2018-04-26.snippet: Alia Shawkat and Laia Costa star in this charmer about strangers who hook up and try to cram a world of togetherness into a day and night.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: One of the quiet charms of “Duck Butter,” a sweetly funny, sometimes tough little movie about a woman on a journey into self, is how its modest scale works in its favor. Directed by Miguel Arteta, it mostly takes place over a single day and night, and not much happens by conventional movie standards. Two strangers hook up and, while giddily enjoying their postcoital high, decide to try to cram an entire relationship — a world of togetherness — into the next 24 hours. So they talk, eat, drink and talk some more, regularly taking time out to turn each other on.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Review: ‘Duck Butter’ and the 24-Hour ‘for Real’ Relationship

2018-04-26.abstract: A Spanish court sentenced five men for sexually abusing a woman during the bull-running festival, but cleared them of rape in a case seen as a bellwether of women’s rights.
2018-04-26.snippet: A Spanish court sentenced five men for sexually abusing a woman during the bull-running festival, but cleared them of rape in a case seen as a bellwether of women’s rights.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: MADRID — In a case that was seen as a bellwether for women’s rights in Spain, a court on Thursday sentenced five men for sexually abusing a woman during the bull-running festival of Pamplona, but cleared them of raping her, to the dismay of women’s associations.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Verdict in Pamplona Gang Rape Case Sets Off Immediate Outcry

2018-04-26.abstract: The practice is prohibited, but dozens of lawsuits allege a pattern of humiliating searches of women who consented only to a pat-down.
2018-04-26.snippet: The practice is prohibited, but dozens of lawsuits allege a pattern of humiliating searches of women who consented only to a pat-down.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Jeannette Reynoso dreaded visiting her husband at the Rikers Island jail complex. She knew she would wait hours to be processed, go through several metal detectors and be subjected to a search by dogs sniffing for drugs and weapons.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Women Describe Invasive Strip Searches on Visits to City Jails

2018-04-26.abstract: Courts have barred the parents of the baby from seeking more medical care, calling it contrary to his interests. The Vatican, Poland and Italy have weighed in.
2018-04-26.snippet: Courts have barred the parents of the baby from seeking more medical care, calling it contrary to his interests. The Vatican, Poland and Italy have weighed in.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Alfie Evans does not know it, but he is the subject of a national debate in Britain, international diplomacy and a bitter legal dispute. He is held up as a tragedy, a beacon of hope and an object lesson. And he might not live to turn 2 years old.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Fight Over Alfie Evans, a Brain-Damaged Baby, Divides U.K.

2018-04-26.abstract: Between Bill Cosby’s first trial and this one came the revelations over Harvey Weinstein and other powerful men that invigorated the #MeToo movement.
2018-04-26.snippet: Between Bill Cosby’s first trial and this one came the revelations over Harvey Weinstein and other powerful men that invigorated the #MeToo movement.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The trial of Bill Cosby provides what social scientists might call a natural experiment. In the spring of 2017, a jury could not agree on whether Mr. Cosby had drugged and sexually assaulted Andrea Constand, setting the stage for a retrial.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Did the #MeToo Movement Sway the Cosby Jury?

2018-04-26.snippet: Barbara S. Jones will oversee a review determining whether anything seized from Mr. Cohen by the F.B.I. is protected by attorney-client privilege.

2018-04-26.abstract: Facebook’s chief technology officer testified before a British panel in a hearing that stood in stark contrast to the efforts of American lawmakers.
2018-04-26.snippet: Facebook’s chief technology officer testified before a British panel in a hearing that stood in stark contrast to the efforts of American lawmakers.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Facebook’s chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, escaped tough questioning during congressional testimony this month in part because American lawmakers weren’t well versed about how the social network functions. On Thursday, one of his deputies faced a decidedly sharper inquisition from a panel in Britain.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Facebook Faces Tough Questions in Britain That It Avoided in the U.S.

2018-04-26.abstract: How many more women are we going to allow to die like this?
2018-04-26.snippet: How many more women are we going to allow to die like this?
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Alek Minassian, who plowed a rental van through a busy Toronto sidewalk on Monday, left little doubt as to why he killed 10 people, most of them women. Minutes before his attack, he posted a message on Facebook lauding the mass murderer Elliot O. Rodger and warned of an “incel rebellion” — a reference to an online community of “involuntarily celibate” men who believe women unjustly deny them sex.
2018-04-26.headline_main: When Misogynists Become Terrorists

2018-04-26.abstract: Catalans have come together on the feast of Sant Jordi for centuries. This year, after months of secessionist turmoil, political division was perhaps inevitable.
2018-04-26.snippet: Catalans have come together on the feast of Sant Jordi for centuries. This year, after months of secessionist turmoil, political division was perhaps inevitable.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Since medieval times Catalans have celebrated the feast of their patron, Sant Jordi, or Saint George, on April 23, which happens to coincide with the deaths of both William Shakespeare and Miguel de Cervantes.
2018-04-26.headline_main: For Catalans, a Day of Books, Roses and, of Course, Politics

2018-04-26.abstract: New York’s waters are home to 20 species of whales and dolphins. One man aims to count them all.
2018-04-26.snippet: New York’s waters are home to 20 species of whales and dolphins. One man aims to count them all.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Arthur Kopelman has been monitoring the local whale and seal populations for long enough that he knows some of the regulars by name. There’s the harbor seal with a marking like a hammer behind her right ear that he has followed for 13 years, so he named her Hammerhead Right. And another with a mark under her left front flipper that looks like a vessel out of Star Trek, so he named her Enterprise.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Arthur Kopelman Works the Other Hamptons

2018-04-26.abstract: Obsessing over the trade deficits with China obscures a more important conflict over whether the dollar remains the world’s top currency.
2018-04-26.snippet: Obsessing over the trade deficits with China obscures a more important conflict over whether the dollar remains the world’s top currency.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The escalating trade war between the United States and China, with the Trump administration considering $100 billion in punitive tariffs in response to China’s $50 billion in retaliatory tariffs, obscures a more important source of conflict: China’s desire to someday establish the yuan as a global reserve currency, on a par with the dollar.
2018-04-26.headline_main: A Trade War the U.S. Is Actually Winning, for Now

2018-04-26.abstract: Inside the Queens basement laboratory of this avant-garde drummer, who studies the biology of the human heart and has even invented a martial art.
2018-04-26.snippet: Inside the Queens basement laboratory of this avant-garde drummer, who studies the biology of the human heart and has even invented a martial art.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Calling Milford Graves an autodidact would be basically correct, but it gets at the wrong idea. Known as a game-changing drummer of the 1960s avant-garde, he’s also become a kind of underground thought leader in martial arts, natural healing and cellular biology. That wasn’t just by learning from what was available; he likes to build new systems, reshaping the channels by which information comes to him.
2018-04-26.headline_main: For Milford Graves, Jazz Innovation Is Only Part of the Alchemy

2018-04-26.abstract: Before hashtags and callouts, there was just one public space where women could go to air their grievances: advice columns.
2018-04-26.snippet: Before hashtags and callouts, there was just one public space where women could go to air their grievances: advice columns.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Within days after the news broke about Harvey Weinstein, almost every post in my Facebook feed ended with the hashtag #MeToo. The stories shared sometimes concerned workplace harassment, but they also involved lecherous doctors, relatives or boyfriends. There was a feverishness to the way women were telling them — as if it had just occurred to them how lonely they’d felt.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Dear Abby, #MeToo

2018-04-26.abstract: The country is considering a bill that would relax the total abortion ban that’s been in place there for 20 years. But it must act now.
2018-04-26.snippet: The country is considering a bill that would relax the total abortion ban that’s been in place there for 20 years. But it must act now.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: El Salvador’s draconian abortion law — the procedure is banned there under all circumstances — has led to horrific outcomes. Children as young as 9 have had to bear their rapists’ children. Women who’ve experienced obstetric complications have been imprisoned under suspicion that they sought abortions. And other women have died of conditions that doctors were hesitant to treat because doing so could endanger their pregnancies.
2018-04-26.headline_main: El Salvador’s Chance to Save Women’s Lives

2018-04-26.abstract: Julian Barnes’s novel “The Only Story,” set in England’s not-so-swinging suburban ’60s, explores memory and the romantic obsession of youth.
2018-04-26.snippet: Julian Barnes’s novel “The Only Story,” set in England’s not-so-swinging suburban ’60s, explores memory and the romantic obsession of youth.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: THE ONLY STORY By Julian Barnes 254 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $25.95.
2018-04-26.headline_main: He’s 19. She’s 48 and Married. When They Play Doubles Tennis, It’s a Match.

2018-04-26.abstract: The actress and activist spoke about her experience as a lesbian and a woman of color in the entertainment industry in an interview with Jazmine Hughes of The New York Times.
2018-04-26.snippet: The actress and activist spoke about her experience as a lesbian and a woman of color in the entertainment industry in an interview with Jazmine Hughes of The New York Times.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Samira Wiley, an Emmy-nominated actress and an activist for lesbian, gay and transgender causes, wishes she could sit down with every child who’s struggling with their sexual or gender identity. “There are just so many people, kids, L.G.B.T. kids that genuinely think that their existence is wrong,” she said on Thursday night in an interview with Jazmine Hughes of The New York Times Magazine. “Nothing pulls on my heartstrings more.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Samira Wiley of ‘The Handmaid’s Tale’ Says to L.G.B.T. Youth: ‘We Need You’

2018-04-26.abstract: Mr. Hamill, the founder of Copper Canyon Press, expressed his opposition to the Iraq war by collecting and publishing thousands of antiwar poems.
2018-04-26.snippet: Mr. Hamill, the founder of Copper Canyon Press, expressed his opposition to the Iraq war by collecting and publishing thousands of antiwar poems.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Sam Hamill, who gave up a wayward life to become an accomplished poet and founder of Copper Canyon Press, a leading nonprofit poetry publisher, and whose impromptu protest before the American invasion of Iraq in 2003 became a cri de coeur for artists nationwide, died on April 14 at his home in Anacortes, Wash. He was 74.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Sam Hamill, Poet, Publisher and War Protester, Dies at 74

2018-04-26.abstract: The British designer shares his favorite places in Los Angeles, from a Hollywood costume collection to the Chateau Marmont.
2018-04-26.snippet: The British designer shares his favorite places in Los Angeles, from a Hollywood costume collection to the Chateau Marmont.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The fashion designer Paul Smith is synonymous with color. His vibrant combinations of hot pink, chartreuse and cornflower blue, tangerine, violet and coffee are instantly recognizable, and — like the work of another color enthusiast, David Hockney, whose new show of portraiture is now open at LACMA — they are unmistakably British. Smith, who presented his first men’s wear collection in London in 1976, now designs both men’s and women’s collections, filling his 50 eclectically designed stores around the world with off-kilter takes on classic English tailoring. Recently, he took a trip to Los Angeles to host a dinner with his friend the actor Gary Oldman. We gave Smith a Polaroid camera and asked him to document his weekend for T. The photographs he took, below, are just as saturated with color as you’d expect from the designer who painted his Melrose Avenue store shocking pink.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Paul Smith Captures 48 Hours in Los Angeles — in Polaroids

2018-04-26.abstract: How strong is the temptation to tinker with a published piece? T asked artists including Bill T. Jones, Laurie Anderson and Ntozake Shange to reconsider their celebrated 1980s works.
2018-04-26.snippet: How strong is the temptation to tinker with a published piece? T asked artists including Bill T. Jones, Laurie Anderson and Ntozake Shange to reconsider their celebrated 1980s works.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: When Vladimir Nabokov’s 1928 novel “King, Queen, Knave” made its English-language debut in the 1960s, it was ornamented with hundreds of what its author called “lighthearted and highhanded” alterations. Previously chaste characters masturbated furiously, plain-Jane sentences were buffed to a brilliant sheen and a nameless department-store mannequin was christened “Ronald” — after Ronald Hingley, a Russian scholar who had recently displeased Nabokov.  “From the way Ronald held his racket,” Nabokov wrote in the revised text, “it was obvious he could not hit a single ball — even an abstract ball in his world of wood.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Six Artists Revisit Their Works From the Early ’80s

2018-04-26.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2018-04-26.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: There are a few days left to celebrate National Poetry Month (of course it’s worth celebrating verse year-round), and our recommendations this week start with books by two of America’s leading young poets: Kevin Young and Tracy K. Smith. A slightly older poet (and playwright), William Shakespeare, has his “Macbeth” updated by the Norwegian thriller writer Jo Nesbo. Also this week, Lawrence Wright takes us on a tour of his complicated home state, Texas; David Reich takes us on a tour of the even more complicated science of population genetics; Aliette de Bodard reimagines Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson in a science-fiction universe; and much more.
2018-04-26.headline_main: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week

2018-04-26.abstract: The Mexico City gallery has opened a New York branch, showing movers and shakers from Latin America — and still resisting expectations.
2018-04-26.snippet: The Mexico City gallery has opened a New York branch, showing movers and shakers from Latin America — and still resisting expectations.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: When Kurimanzutto opened in Mexico City in 1999, Mónica Manzutto and her husband, José Kuri, along with the artist Gabriel Orozco, wanted to create something different from an ordinary commercial gallery. Ideas like participation, art spaces as “platforms” or “laboratories,” and “provisional” projects were popular at the time.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Kurimanzutto Expands (Way) North

2018-04-26.abstract: The team replaced the support poles that held up its extended netting with a steel cable after some fans, including Steinbrenner, complained about obstructed views.
2018-04-26.snippet: The team replaced the support poles that held up its extended netting with a steel cable after some fans, including Steinbrenner, complained about obstructed views.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: At their home opener this month, the Yankees unveiled new protective netting at Yankee Stadium, running from the area behind home plate to deep into both corners of the outfield, a response to both the recommendation of the baseball commissioner and three serious injuries sustained by fans last season.
2018-04-26.headline_main: One Yankees Fan Weighs In on New Stadium Netting: Hal Steinbrenner

2018-04-26.abstract: African women face cultural and financial resistance to careers in art, but a Johannesburg residency and an international art fair in Brooklyn may help them succeed.
2018-04-26.snippet: African women face cultural and financial resistance to careers in art, but a Johannesburg residency and an international art fair in Brooklyn may help them succeed.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: In many African countries, where career paths for women can still be limited to practical fields like nursing and teaching, the decision to attempt a career in art is seen as unrealistic. Female artists face enormous cultural and financial resistance. But a Johannesburg residency and an international art fair opening in Brooklyn next week aim to help some young women get a toehold on the ladder.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Two Projects Helping Female Artists in Africa Find Their Voices

2018-04-26.abstract: Young and artist-run spaces are the dynamic specialties of these two boroughs, which have the city’s most dynamic art scene.
2018-04-26.snippet: Young and artist-run spaces are the dynamic specialties of these two boroughs, which have the city’s most dynamic art scene.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: These noteworthy gallery shows outside Manhattan are heavily tilted toward the L train axis that runs through Brooklyn and Queens, from Williamsburg to Ridgewood, and toward the young and artist-run spaces that are those boroughs’ specialties. (For two galleries on the southern edge of Williamsburg, Soloway and Black Ball Projects, take the J train.) Luhring Augustine is not on this list because its show “Sculpture,” running through May 5, was recently reviewed, but it is definitely worth a visit. Altogether, this guide will give you an extensive foundation from which to experience the city’s most dynamic art scene.
2018-04-26.headline_main: 12 Galleries to Visit Now in Brooklyn and Queens

2018-04-26.abstract: Cosby’s persistent pathology was unusual. The fears of his victims, that the man who abused them was too powerful to face consequences, are not.
2018-04-26.snippet: Cosby’s persistent pathology was unusual. The fears of his victims, that the man who abused them was too powerful to face consequences, are not.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Bill Cosby was convicted of sexual assault on Thursday, more than 50 years after Kristina Ruehli says Mr. Cosby sexually assaulted her after giving her drinks that made her pass out; more than 40 years after Judy Huth says Mr. Cosby got her drunk and sexually assaulted her at the Playboy Mansion when she was 15; more than 30 years after the model Janice Dickinson says he sexually assaulted her after giving her wine and a pill.
2018-04-26.headline_main: A Reckoning for Cosby — Now for Others?

2018-04-26.abstract: A neighborhood-by-neighborhood guide to the spring’s best shows.
2018-04-26.snippet: A neighborhood-by-neighborhood guide to the spring’s best shows.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Is the New York art gallery scene thriving or dying? It may be doing both, depending on where you look. Blue-chip galleries are expanding, and a surprising number of international galleries are opening here, too, mostly on the Upper East Side. (Not to mention the prosperous art fairs arriving next week, including Frieze New York, TEFAF and the 1-54 International Contemporary African Art Fair. And they’ll be followed by the big May auctions.)
2018-04-26.headline_main: The 54 Galleries to See Right Now in New York

2018-04-26.abstract: The cruelty of these cuts isn’t a bug, it’s a feature.
2018-04-26.snippet: The cruelty of these cuts isn’t a bug, it’s a feature.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: America hasn’t always, or even usually, been governed by the best and the brightest; over the years, presidents have employed plenty of knaves and fools. But I don’t think we’ve ever seen anything like the collection of petty grifters and miscreants surrounding Donald Trump. Price, Pruitt, Zinke, Carson and now Ronny Jackson: At this point, our default assumption should be that there’s something seriously wrong with anyone this president wants on his team.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Trump’s War on the Poor

2018-04-26.abstract: Begin in NoHo on Great Jones Street, ramble south and east. You’ll uncover outposts from Zurich and South Asia, transplants from Chelsea, and one of the oldest arts centers in town.
2018-04-26.snippet: Begin in NoHo on Great Jones Street, ramble south and east. You’ll uncover outposts from Zurich and South Asia, transplants from Chelsea, and one of the oldest arts centers in town.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: And so the hottest gallery neighborhood in New York is … nowhere in particular! With rents ever higher in Chelsea’s old garages and the Lower East Side’s tenements, nearly a dozen homesteading dealers have moved to a few blocks of terra nullius hemmed in by SoHo, TriBeCa and the Civic Center. Centered on Walker Street, these galleries — a mix of Chelsea refugees, peripatetic veterans of downtown and a few new kids — have imparted fresh energy to one of Lower Manhattan’s last ungentrified zones.
2018-04-26.headline_main: 10 Galleries to Visit Now Around SoHo and TriBeCa

2018-04-26.abstract: Living in a house with friends, playing drinking games and dancing to overplayed pop songs are not incompatible with a just society.
2018-04-26.snippet: Living in a house with friends, playing drinking games and dancing to overplayed pop songs are not incompatible with a just society.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: “Our way of life is under attack,” the keynote speaker said. The women filling the ballroom, many of them wearing a Greek letter lapel pin or a monogrammed sweater, shouted in agreement. It was the 2015 national convention for my sorority, and college administrators and national pundits alike had been deliberating the elimination of Greek life.
2018-04-26.headline_main: The Future of Frats

2018-04-26.abstract: Parents and students at Lenox Academy in Brooklyn said they were shocked by the arrest of Andre Braddy, a math teacher charged with sexually abusing a 14-year-old boy.
2018-04-26.snippet: Parents and students at Lenox Academy in Brooklyn said they were shocked by the arrest of Andre Braddy, a math teacher charged with sexually abusing a 14-year-old boy.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: To his students at the Lenox Academy middle school in Canarsie, Brooklyn, Andre Braddy was a “very nice teacher” who was engaged enough to joke with his students. He was also by turns “really serious,” and disciplined enough to make them concentrate and do their homework.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Brooklyn School Grapples With Teacher’s Arrest on Sex Abuse Charges

2018-04-26.abstract: A sampling of the visual riches available this weekend in Chelsea, the most disdained of New York’s gallery neighborhoods.
2018-04-26.snippet: A sampling of the visual riches available this weekend in Chelsea, the most disdained of New York’s gallery neighborhoods.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Chelsea may be the New York art neighborhood that many people love to disdain. It also may be approaching a tipping point, where new apartment towers outnumber galleries. But the place is not monolithic. Its scores of galleries come in all shapes, sizes and annual budgets, and as usual they offer a ton of art to be seen. Here is but a small sample.
2018-04-26.headline_main: 12 Galleries to Visit Now in Chelsea

2018-04-26.abstract: Ms. Gump served four years in prison for disabling a missile silo, one of her many arrests as a political activist, all while raising 12 children.
2018-04-26.snippet: Ms. Gump served four years in prison for disabling a missile silo, one of her many arrests as a political activist, all while raising 12 children.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: While Jean Dalton was growing up on the South Side of Chicago, her parents became so disgusted by Mayor Richard J. Daley’s ethnocentric and monolithic Democratic machine that they not only enrolled as Republicans but also hid their Irish ancestry from their five children.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Jean Gump, Tireless Fighter for Social Justice, Dies at 90

2018-04-26.abstract: Storms, stars and survival in small spaces — the cosmos in a storefront.
2018-04-26.snippet: Storms, stars and survival in small spaces — the cosmos in a storefront.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Galleries, small and midsize, are having a rough ride. Rents keep climbing. So do art-fair fees. And certain people who might help pay the gallery bills — collectors, big-museum curators — keep not showing up except at a handful of spaces with social cachet and publicity machines. Plus, a sizable portion of the art audience has taken to doing its looking online, raising the question: Why have physical galleries at all?
2018-04-26.headline_main: 10 Galleries to Visit Now on the Lower East Side

2018-04-26.abstract: The Fresh Air Fund provides thousands of children with an unforgettable summer experience. Here’s how you can help.
2018-04-26.snippet: The Fresh Air Fund provides thousands of children with an unforgettable summer experience. Here’s how you can help.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Israel Dudley was 11 years old when he left New York City for the first time. He had no idea what to expect when the Fresh Air Fund sent him to Bristol, Vt., that summer. Nor did he realize that the family who he was about to stay with for two weeks — Deborah and Matthew Dickerson and their three sons — would have such a lasting impact on his life.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Out of the City and Into Fresh Air

2018-04-26.abstract: The arrival of dozens of international galleries and project spaces in a concentrated area has created a thriving scene.
2018-04-26.snippet: The arrival of dozens of international galleries and project spaces in a concentrated area has created a thriving scene.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The Upper East Side — the area called “above East 50th Street” on gallery apps like See Saw and Artforum — is thriving. It’s also experiencing an art-fair effect, with international galleries opening project spaces or satellite galleries in a highly concentrated area: where collectors and curators stay when visiting New York. The galleries that have opened additional spaces on the Upper East Side in recent years include Almine Rech, Boers-Li, Clearing, Galeria Nara Roesler, Galerie Buchholz, Mendes Wood DM and, next month, Kurimanzutto, from Mexico City. I chose shows that were viewable at the time, and I could have provided a list of another 10 galleries just as strong — and another 10 after that. Here is what you can see right now.
2018-04-26.headline_main: 10 Galleries to Visit Now on the Upper East Side

2018-04-26.abstract: The agency’s board voted unanimously to censure Caren Z. Turner, who flashed her P.A. badge and cursed at police officers in a videotaped encounter.
2018-04-26.snippet: The agency’s board voted unanimously to censure Caren Z. Turner, who flashed her P.A. badge and cursed at police officers in a videotaped encounter.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Caren Z. Turner, a Democratic lobbyist, has been flogged for days on social media for berating police officers in New Jersey in a video that went viral. On Thursday, her former peers on the board of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey officially censured Ms. Turner, calling her conduct “outrageous” and “profoundly disturbing.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Port Authority Censures Former Commissioner Who Berated Police

2018-04-26.abstract: If Dr. Ronny Jackson gave sleeping pills to reporters and staff on long flights abroad, he broke the law, a D.E.A. spokesman said. “You could be prosecuted.”
2018-04-26.snippet: If Dr. Ronny Jackson gave sleeping pills to reporters and staff on long flights abroad, he broke the law, a D.E.A. spokesman said. “You could be prosecuted.”
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Trips abroad with the president can be grueling for staff and journalists alike. Long hours, with stops in multiple time zones, are often the norm.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Trump’s Doctor Accused of Handing Out Ambien. D.E.A. Calls the Practice Illegal.

2018-04-26.abstract: To make her documentary series about The New York Times’s coverage of the president, Liz Garbus spent 15 months as a fly on the newsroom wall.
2018-04-26.snippet: To make her documentary series about The New York Times’s coverage of the president, Liz Garbus spent 15 months as a fly on the newsroom wall.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Two weeks after the 2016 election, President-elect Donald J. Trump was in the middle of making the press rounds and had scheduled a meeting with The New York Times. But on the morning of Nov. 22, The Times learned via Twitter that Mr. Trump was canceling. He claimed that the “failing” New York Times had changed the conditions — “not nice.” The paper held its ground, saying it was the Trump team who had tried to change the rules when he asked that the meeting be off the record, which it had refused. Hours later, the president-elect changed course, tweeting the meeting was back on: “Look forward to it!”
2018-04-26.headline_main: A View Inside ‘The Fourth Estate’ During Trump’s First Year

2018-04-26.abstract: For National Poetry Month, we asked four poets to answer the prompt: “How I Write.”
2018-04-26.snippet: For National Poetry Month, we asked four poets to answer the prompt: “How I Write.”

2018-04-26.headline_main: All the Poetry That’s Fit to Print

2018-04-26.abstract: The unusual crossover occurred when Kent Jones, the festival chief, submitted his drama, “Diane,” to the downtown event. He won best narrative feature.
2018-04-26.snippet: The unusual crossover occurred when Kent Jones, the festival chief, submitted his drama, “Diane,” to the downtown event. He won best narrative feature.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The Tribeca Film Festival is known for its crowd-pleasing programming. The crosstown New York Film Festival has an illustrious history of highlighting foreign and art films. But on Thursday, the two institutions seemed to align when Tribeca gave its top award, for best narrative feature, to Kent Jones, the director of both the New York Film Festival and the drama “Diane.”
2018-04-26.headline_main: Tribeca Film Festival Award Goes to New York Film Festival Director

2018-04-26.abstract: The E.P.A. chief said that decisions regarding illegal actions by his office had been made by his staff members without his knowledge.

2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Scott Pruitt, the Environmental Protection Agency chief, had an easier time than expected on Capitol Hill on Thursday as he deflected Democrats’ pointed questions about accusations of ethical infractions and lavish personal spending at the taxpayers’ expense.

2018-04-26.abstract: For decades, those who survived the killer’s attacks or saw loved ones murdered suffered alone. But they bonded together in recent years and celebrated the arrest of a suspect this week.
2018-04-26.snippet: For decades, those who survived the killer’s attacks or saw loved ones murdered suffered alone. But they bonded together in recent years and celebrated the arrest of a suspect this week.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — At 15, in the throes of a teenage rebellion, Debbi Domingo ran away from her mother’s home in Goleta, Calif., a small town near Santa Barbara. Two weeks later, she returned home to a swarm of police cars in the cul-de-sac. Her mother and her mother’s boyfriend had been brutally murdered after being tied up and beaten so badly that detectives were initially unsure of their identities.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Golden State Killer’s Victims: The Families Who Never Gave Up Hope

2018-04-26.abstract: The guilty verdict against Bill Cosby reflects a new understanding of sexual assault and, finally, some change in how victims are treated.
2018-04-26.snippet: The guilty verdict against Bill Cosby reflects a new understanding of sexual assault and, finally, some change in how victims are treated.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: Today’s guilty verdict in the sexual assault case against Bill Cosby closes a chapter left unresolved by last summer’s deadlocked jury. A retrial typically looks much like the first go-round. But in this case, the #MeToo era began between the two trials. So the second trial has become a litmus test of the movement’s impact. Because the jury convicted this time around, it is tempting to think that #MeToo is already improving the criminal justice system’s notoriously poor handling of sexual violence.
2018-04-26.headline_main: The Cosby Jury Finally Believes the Women

2018-04-26.abstract: Joseph James DeAngelo’s arrest occurred more than 30 years after the Golden State Killer’s spree ended. Experts cite cases involving murderers whose crimes ceased long before they were caught.
2018-04-26.snippet: Joseph James DeAngelo’s arrest occurred more than 30 years after the Golden State Killer’s spree ended. Experts cite cases involving murderers whose crimes ceased long before they were caught.
2018-04-26.lead_paragraph: The Golden State Killer’s barrage of rapes and murders began in a gold mining area east of Sacramento in 1976. By 1986, it seemed to have stopped.
2018-04-26.headline_main: Do Serial Killers Just Stop? Yes, Sometimes

I was beaming like a tickled 2-year-old during much of George C. Wolfe’s revival of Eugene O’Neill’s behemoth barroom tragedy, which opened on Thursday night at the Bernard B. Jacobs Theater, with Denzel Washington more than earning his salary as its commanding star.

2018-04-27.snippet: In Italy’s recent elections, half of the voters chose Euroskeptic parties. But that doesn’t mean Italy will abandon the Treaty of Rome.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: MILAN — Eight weeks after Italy’s election, it’s still possible that a government will be formed by the Five Star Movement and the League, two parties that have campaigned passionately against Brussels and the European Union in the past. In the last few days they have quarreled, but it seems sure that one of them, maybe both, will be the force driving Italy’s next government, with the question before it being whether to continue on that anti-European path.

2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The young couple moved to the front of the crowd to look at the painting. After a few seconds, the woman turned around, smiled into her cellphone and took some selfies. Next, she handed her device to her husband, who took more formal shots of her in front of the work. The two then posed arm in arm for selfies together, turned to have a last brief look at the painting — and moved away.
2018-04-27.headline_main: What the Mona Lisa Tells Us About Art in the Instagram Era

2018-04-27.snippet: Willy Ronis captured the French capital and its people with warmth, humanity and compassion, as can be seen in a new retrospective in Paris.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Until his death in 2009 at age 99, the French photographer Willy Ronis was listed in the phone book. Anyone could call him, and the door of his modest apartment in a quiet part of the working-class 20th Arrondissement of Paris was open to all: young photographers, admirers and strangers who recognized themselves in his pictures. The man who addressed everyone with the informal French “tu” was one of the last humanist photographers of the Paris school, alongside Robert Doisneau, Henri Cartier-Bresson and Sabine Weiss.
2018-04-27.headline_main: The Photographer Who Saw Paris With His Heart in His Eyes

2018-04-27.abstract: “Each of my five kids and two sons-in-law was assigned a portion to copy edit. I offered $20 for each typo.”
2018-04-27.snippet: “Each of my five kids and two sons-in-law was assigned a portion to copy edit. I offered $20 for each typo.”
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: FAMILY MAN: Unless you’ve been living under a rock, it won’t surprise you to learn that James Comey’s memoir, “A Higher Loyalty: Truth, Lies, and Leadership,” debuts at No. 1 on the nonfiction list after selling more than 600,000 copies in its first week. The book, which was announced last August, took the former F.B.I. director about six months to complete: “It was a continuous process of writing and then getting feedback from my wife and kids, my agents and my editor, and then rewriting,” he explains. “The final step was a daylong family gathering, where each of my five kids and two sons-in-law was assigned a portion to copy-edit. I offered $20 for each typo and then met in my office individually with each of the seven to review and debate their suggested changes. They made me much better.”
2018-04-27.headline_main: How James Comey Found Mistakes in His Manuscript

2018-04-27.abstract: It may be the hardest topic of all to bring to kids, but these authors and illustrators have made beautiful, useful books about the end of life.
2018-04-27.snippet: It may be the hardest topic of all to bring to kids, but these authors and illustrators have made beautiful, useful books about the end of life.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: Right this moment, somewhere in the world a parent is being skewered by the existential questions of a 3-year-old. Do dogs have birthdays? Do all the ants know each other? Why is that lady crying? When my son was 3, he wanted to know where he was when I was that age. I told him he didn’t exist yet. “No,” he said, firmly, “I was just very, very small.”
2018-04-27.headline_main: How Do You Talk to Children About Death? These Books Can Help

2018-04-27.abstract: A guide to regional and local exhibitions, garden tours, and theater, dance and ​music performances that are not on the usual tourist lists.
2018-04-27.snippet: A guide to regional and local exhibitions, garden tours, and theater, dance and ​music performances that are not on the usual tourist lists.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: It’s the European Year of Cultural Heritage, an ongoing celebration across multiple countries that includes museum exhibitions; tours of gardens and monuments​; theater, dance and ​musical performances; and the reappearance of many long-running annual festivals. Each event is meant to speak to the theme of European cultural heritage in some form or other, according to the European Commission. To that end, many of the activities aim to be both fun and enriching, and appear to be marketed to Europeans rather than to tourists — all the better for travelers seeking novel experiences with a more intimate, local feeling than the usual must-see attractions. Below, a sampling of more than half a dozen events to enjoy (some even for free), ​from now through the end of the year.
2018-04-27.headline_main: A Year of Cultural Celebrations in Europe

2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: On Thursday, a historic walkout by teachers and the support staff closed more than 1,000 public schools in Arizona. The state became the latest and the largest to be swept by a labor insurgency among underpaid educators that started in February in West Virginia, then spread to Oklahoma, Kentucky and, also on Thursday, Colorado. As Jason Riley, a conservative writer, noted with disapproval in The Wall Street Journal: “It isn’t just college campuses. The nation’s K-12 schools are also turning into hotbeds of political activism.”

2018-04-27.abstract: Lucy Thurber’s new play, “Transfers,” draws on her own life as it follows two poor students pitted against each other for a scholarship to an elite institution.
2018-04-27.snippet: Lucy Thurber’s new play, “Transfers,” draws on her own life as it follows two poor students pitted against each other for a scholarship to an elite institution.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: On Monday, Lucy Thurber’s play “Transfers’’ made its debut Off Broadway and proved so popular it quickly received an extended run. The play tells the story of two community college students from the South Bronx — one black, one Hispanic — vying for a scholarship at a prestigious liberal-arts college in the northeast. Ms. Thurber, the Obie-award winning writer of “The Hill Town Plays,” grew up in rural poverty in New England and drew in part on her own experiences navigating the world of higher education. The following conversation took place over lunch and via email; it has been condensed and edited.
2018-04-27.headline_main: A Playwright of Poverty Rejects ‘Hard Luck Porn’

2018-04-27.abstract: The Joyce expert and Latin soul bandleader spends weekends with his family composting, making music and pancakes, and reading obscure books.
2018-04-27.snippet: The Joyce expert and Latin soul bandleader spends weekends with his family composting, making music and pancakes, and reading obscure books.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: By day, Jonathan Goldman, 45, is an associate professor at New York Institute of Technology, where he teaches classes in early-20th-century literature and culture. He happens to be an internationally recognized expert on James Joyce. But that’s just his day job. By night, Mr. Goldman is the bandleader for the Latin soul and boogaloo group Spanglish Fly. Since both Mr. Goldman and his wife, Jamie Favaro, 37, are juggling multiple projects — she works in harm reduction and is also building an online platform on the subject — Sundays are hardly ever a day off for them. “We end up working for at least several hours,” he said. They live on the Upper West Side with their daughters, Charlie, 6, and Dava, 2.
2018-04-27.headline_main: How Jonathan Goldman, Professor and Musician, Spends His Sundays

It was agreed that a sexual interaction occurred between them on a night in early 2004 at his home in the suburbs of Philadelphia.
