2018-04-27.abstract: Justin Strauss, who got his start at the underground Mudd Club, and the Black Madonna share playlists inspired by the era exclusively with T.
2018-04-27.snippet: Justin Strauss, who got his start at the underground Mudd Club, and the Black Madonna share playlists inspired by the era exclusively with T.
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: In late 1979, when the D.J. Justin Strauss first brought a bag of records to spin at the Mudd Club, the downtown New York City bar that’s now the stuff of underground lore, the term “disc jockey” didn’t mean much yet — and it certainly didn’t evoke celebrity status. “It wasn’t anything that anyone thought about — I didn’t think about it,” Strauss says now. “I didn’t wake up and go, ‘I want to be a D.J.’ It just sort of happened naturally.” He had left New York, his hometown, to live in Los Angeles with his power-pop group Milk ’n’ Cookies. The band eventually split and his then-girlfriend persuaded him to come back to the city. “She said, ‘You gotta come. This club opened up and you’d be great to play your records there,’” he remembers. This was the era of the slick, moneyed glamour of Studio 54, and the Mudd Club was, in many ways, a reaction to it. “There were no rules — you could play a rockabilly song next to a rap song or a reggae song or the Buzzcocks or whatever it was — it all made sense and everyone danced,” he said. As for the crowd, it “was just a mix of downtown kids, artists … Keith Haring, Jean-Michel [Basquiat].” Strauss spent the rest of the decade spinning at big — and now shuttered — clubs like Area, the Ritz, Tunnel and Limelight. He ultimately began remixing and producing original tracks; he still D.J.s around the world and has a show on the Lot Radio, based in Brooklyn.
2018-04-27.headline_main: Listen to the Early ’80s: Two Playlists Inspired by Our Culture Issue

Under the artistic direction of Helgi Tomasson, San Francisco has long been among the world’s most elegant and refined companies — but sometimes in past seasons it has seemed too polite, demure, withheld. Not so with “Unbound.”

2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: After the striking political theater that unfolded Friday at the forbidding border between North and South Korea, it seems almost meanspirited to cast aspersions on Kim Jong-un’s motives or to be apprehensive about talks Mr. Kim is expected to have in a few weeks with President Trump. These contacts, after all, stand in stark contrast to the scary talk of nuclear exchanges of only a few months ago, and meeting face-to-face seems better than saber rattling.

2018-04-27.abstract: British subjects brought to England from Caribbean colonies after World War II face deportation in a “really hostile environment.”
2018-04-27.snippet: British subjects brought to England from Caribbean colonies after World War II face deportation in a “really hostile environment.”
2018-04-27.lead_paragraph: The Windrush scandal in Britain is, on one level, uniquely British. It’s about people who were brought from Britain’s Caribbean colonies after World War II to help rebuild England and then, decades later, discarded. But it is also a bitter parable of how governments in prosperous Western societies — the United States very much among them — have turned on dark-skinned migrants as alien interlopers.
2018-04-27.headline_main: When Dark-Skinned Citizens Lose Their Citizenship

2018-04-28.lead_paragraph: “Welcome to our show,” Una Osato, 35, shouted into a microphone from the stage to a standing-room-only crowd in Starr bar in Bushwick, Brooklyn. Ms. Osato was wearing a purple dress adorned with a long, metallic scarf made entirely from recycled materials that stretched  onto the floor and into the first row of the audience. It was a Sunday afternoon, and everyone  was there to see one thing: brASS: Brown RadicalAss Burlesque, a New York City burlesque troupe created  by queer women and women of color to redefine a scene that they say has often failed to provide them, queer and transgender performers opportunities.

2018-04-28.lead_paragraph: Q: Some people in my co-op in Jackson Heights, Queens, leave a mess in the compactor room. The board imposed a $500 fine for anyone caught doing this, but without cameras, catching the culprits is nearly impossible. I received a notice that if the situation isn’t rectified, all the tenants on the floor will be fined $50 each. Can the board really fine an entire group because one person is a slob? What recourse do I have?

It’s on East 54th Street, No. 405, and its nickname, he told me, used to be “four of five,” because that was supposedly the ratio of gay residents.

2018-04-28.snippet: Money would make me powerful, someone nobody could hurt.
2018-04-28.lead_paragraph: My junior year of high school, I entered a creative-writing contest that awarded a significant cash stipend. I faced stiff competition from a number of Ivy League-bound classmates, but I submitted my essay with a reasonable expectation of winning. I am a great writer, a conviction I kept private for fear of sounding obnoxious. When my name was announced at our school’s closing ceremony awards, our class president actually stood up and cried “What?” in outrage and disbelief. What? How could I have beaten someone as smart and talented as him?
2018-04-28.headline_main: I Want to Be Rich and I’m Not Sorry

2018-04-28.lead_paragraph: In 1994 during the height of the Bosnian civil war, when I was head of intelligence for American forces in Europe, I walked through the ruined streets of Sarajevo. A city of once-beautiful steeples, onion-shaped domes and minarets had been devastated by Serbian artillery in the hills rising above the Miljacka River. I wondered what manner of man could pick up a sniper rifle and shoot former neighbors lining up for scarce water at a shuttered brewery.

2018-04-29.abstract: Brantley Hargrove’s “The Man Who Caught the Storm” recounts the life of Tim Samaras, a tornado chaser who designed probes that revolutionized science before he was killed doing what he loved in 2013.
2018-04-29.snippet: Brantley Hargrove’s “The Man Who Caught the Storm” recounts the life of Tim Samaras, a tornado chaser who designed probes that revolutionized science before he was killed doing what he loved in 2013.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: “He wanted to answer the questions people thought were impossible.” That’s how one friend of Tim Samaras described the storm chaser and scientist who died in 2013, along with one of his sons and a colleague, in an Oklahoma tornado. Fifty-five at the time of his death, Samaras had in fact answered some previously impossible questions, using probes of his own design — placed in front of twisters at moments of great danger — to glean facts about what happens in the very center of a tornado. The journalist Brantley Hargrove’s first book, “The Man Who Caught the Storm,” recounts the obsessions and the unlikely achievements of Samaras while also detailing the history of scientists’ often slow pace in understanding this corner of meteorology. Below, Mr. Hargrove, who lives in Dallas and has chased storms himself, talks about his fascination with this story, the many adventures he cut from the final book and more.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: A Dangerous Journey Into the Heart of Tornadoes

2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: “Spider-Man: Homecoming” was a soaring success. “Thor: Ragnarok” opened even bigger. Then “Black Panther” crushed both of them.

2018-04-29.abstract: The country’s justices are lashing back at critics who have denounced the judicial system as a patriarchy that is out of touch with the sensibilities of modern Spain.
2018-04-29.snippet: The country’s justices are lashing back at critics who have denounced the judicial system as a patriarchy that is out of touch with the sensibilities of modern Spain.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Judges in Spain defended the country’s judicial system, after mass protests extended into the weekend in Pamplona, Spain, against what many saw as a light sentence in a sexual assault case.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Spanish Judges Return Fire After Contentious Sexual Assault Ruling

2018-04-29.abstract: In the Boyle Heights neighborhood, a design intervention led by residents and activists unveils a “playground in a box” to reclaim streets for public life.
2018-04-29.snippet: In the Boyle Heights neighborhood, a design intervention led by residents and activists unveils a “playground in a box” to reclaim streets for public life.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The temporary transformation of Fickett Street in Boyle Heights began with yellow shades resembling huge kites suspended over the sun-scorched asphalt. Soon, a thoroughfare known for its speeding vehicles and gang activity became something else entirely — a “play street” in which women gathered for Lotería, or Mexican bingo, and kids fashioned seesaws out of giant snap-together plastic shapes in colors inspired by local Mexican-American murals.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Los Angeles Tests the Power of ‘Play Streets’

2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: The leaders of North and South Korea met for the first time on Friday, struck an accord to work toward peace and pledged to attempt nuclear disarmament. Officials in Japan noted a lack of specific plans in the agreement, and analysts in the country have suggested the tete-a-tete was merely symbolic.

2018-04-29.abstract: Some think the technology that was introduced with Bitcoin has enormous potential. That has a number of countries looking to influence its future.
2018-04-29.snippet: Some think the technology that was introduced with Bitcoin has enormous potential. That has a number of countries looking to influence its future.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Last year, representatives of 25 countries met in Tokyo to work on setting international standards for the blockchain, the technology that was introduced by the virtual currency Bitcoin and has ignited intense interest in corporate and government circles.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Blockchain Will Be Theirs, Russian Spy Boasted at Conference

2018-04-29.abstract: The success of movies like “Avengers: Infinity War” has made it difficult to make truly great pictures.
2018-04-29.snippet: The success of movies like “Avengers: Infinity War” has made it difficult to make truly great pictures.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: Modern Hollywood is ruled by franchises, and these days, there’s no bigger franchise than the Marvel cinematic universe. The release last week of “Avengers: Infinity War” marks the 19th film in the superhero series.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Are Pretty Good Marvel Superhero Movies the Best Hollywood Can Do?

2018-04-29.abstract: Amazon has surprised officials in cities vying for the company’s new headquarters by asking how to avoid soaring housing costs and paralyzing traffic.
2018-04-29.snippet: Amazon has surprised officials in cities vying for the company’s new headquarters by asking how to avoid soaring housing costs and paralyzing traffic.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — When 10 representatives from Amazon visited the Denver area in late January, they did what you’d expect from a company scouting for a place to put its second headquarters. They toured more than a half-dozen potential sites for a new campus and talked about the technical talent available in the area.
2018-04-29.headline_main: One Goal of Amazon’s HQ2: Learn the Lessons of Seattle

2018-04-29.abstract: Mr. Kissin, the Russian-born pianist, was a dynamo at Carnegie Hall, but the Emerson String Quartet’s veteran players seemed ideally matched with him.
2018-04-29.snippet: Mr. Kissin, the Russian-born pianist, was a dynamo at Carnegie Hall, but the Emerson String Quartet’s veteran players seemed ideally matched with him.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: The Russian-born pianist Evgeny Kissin makes infrequent public appearances playing chamber music at all (do I recall a Schubert “Trout” Quintet in a small New York hall some years back?), let alone a whole evening of it. So it was not surprising that he took top billing in a collaboration with the Emerson String Quartet at Carnegie Hall on Friday evening.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Review: Evgeny Kissin and Emerson Quartet Rise to Each Other’s Challenges

2018-04-29.abstract: The state’s Democratic primary raises the question: Who has the truest claim to progressivism in 2018, when both candidates can credibly grab at the label?
2018-04-29.snippet: The state’s Democratic primary raises the question: Who has the truest claim to progressivism in 2018, when both candidates can credibly grab at the label?
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: AKRON, Ohio — Richard Cordray speaks softly and carries a big stack: lime-green index cards, pressed into his shirt pocket, near enough for any sudden onset of note-taking.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Left vs. Left: Richard Cordray and Dennis Kucinich Battle for Governor of Ohio

2018-04-29.abstract: In the 1980s, the attempt to assassinate President Ronald Reagan and the shooting of his press secretary, Jim Brady, led to a call for gun control. Decades later, students who survived the Parkland, Fla., shooting have reenergized the debate.
2018-04-29.snippet: In the 1980s, the attempt to assassinate President Ronald Reagan and the shooting of his press secretary, Jim Brady, led to a call for gun control. Decades later, students who survived the Parkland, Fla., shooting have reenergized the debate.

2018-04-29.abstract: The troupe presented a beautiful world premiere by Richard Alston and three revivals of fascinating rarities by Jerome Robbins.
2018-04-29.snippet: The troupe presented a beautiful world premiere by Richard Alston and three revivals of fascinating rarities by Jerome Robbins.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: New York Theater Ballet is a chamber troupe addicted to modernism, staging works by choreographers, past and present, who have extended and challenged the pure-dance aspects of dance theater. Because plenty of its works are by the dead — Vaslav Nijinsky, Frederick Ashton, Antony Tudor, Agnes de Mille, Merce Cunningham, Jerome Robbins, James Waring — it’s easy to think of it as a nostalgic troupe, picking up small-scale old pieces as an alternative to the ubiquitous Balanchine uptown.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Review: At New York Theater Ballet, Safe Bets Become Bold

2018-04-29.abstract: Maybe last fall’s Alabama Senate race wasn’t a fluke after all.
2018-04-29.snippet: Maybe last fall’s Alabama Senate race wasn’t a fluke after all.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: To understand how Phil Bredesen, a former Democratic governor of Tennessee, has a chance of winning this year’s race to replace Bob Corker as the junior senator from this deep-red state, it helps to know a story making the rounds in Nashville about his likely Republican opponent, Representative Marsha Blackburn.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Can a Tennessee Democrat Pull a Doug Jones?

2018-04-29.abstract: Hope is a scarce commodity in Gaza, which is little more than an open-air prison. A look at how one man ended up at the bloody protests against Israel.
2018-04-29.snippet: Hope is a scarce commodity in Gaza, which is little more than an open-air prison. A look at how one man ended up at the bloody protests against Israel.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: GAZA CITY — No one would ever pick out Saber al-Gerim from the crowds of Palestinians demonstrating against Israel along the heavily guarded fence that has helped turn the Gaza Strip into an open-air prison.
2018-04-29.headline_main: For Gaza Protester, Living or Dying Is the ‘Same Thing’

2018-04-29.abstract: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo came to Israel in the midst of escalating protests in Gaza, but he did not meet with Palestinian leaders and kept the policy focus on Iran.
2018-04-29.snippet: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo came to Israel in the midst of escalating protests in Gaza, but he did not meet with Palestinian leaders and kept the policy focus on Iran.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV, Israel — Secretary of State Mike Pompeo came to Israel Sunday in the midst of the worst crisis in relations between Israelis and Palestinians in years, but he did not meet a single Palestinian representative and mentioned them publicly once.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Pompeo and Palestinians Have ‘Nothing to Discuss’ Amid Gaza Crisis

2018-04-29.abstract: The Angels and Yankees shortstops grew up together in Curaçao but that’s hardly the only parallel in the careers of Andrelton Simmons and Didi Gregorius.
2018-04-29.snippet: The Angels and Yankees shortstops grew up together in Curaçao but that’s hardly the only parallel in the careers of Andrelton Simmons and Didi Gregorius.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: ANAHEIM, Calif. — When Andrelton Simmons, the Los Angeles Angels’ shortstop, slid headfirst into third base with a two-out, two-run, seventh-inning triple that put his team in the lead on Friday night, he pounded the dirt and pointed to his teammates in the third-base dugout.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Anything Andrelton Can Do, Didi Will Try to Do Better

2018-04-29.abstract: Police responding to a call found the 2-year-old unconscious. Her knife-wielding mother attacked two officers, and was shot, the police said.
2018-04-29.snippet: Police responding to a call found the 2-year-old unconscious. Her knife-wielding mother attacked two officers, and was shot, the police said.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: A woman who called the police to her home in Westchester County on Saturday was desperate: “I got a woman on the phone screaming, ‘Please come help me!’” a dispatcher said as he relayed the call over a police radio.
2018-04-29.headline_main: Mother Is Shot Attacking Officers Who Tried to Help Dying Girl, Police Say

2018-04-29.abstract: The modern rule of law is younger than many realize, and not enough Republicans are defending it today.
2018-04-29.snippet: The modern rule of law is younger than many realize, and not enough Republicans are defending it today.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: Edward Levi and Griffin Bell were very different men. One was the son and grandson of rabbis, a legal scholar whose life revolved around the University of Chicago. The other was a country lawyer who became a master operator in the Atlanta legal world. One was appointed to high office by a Republican president, the other by a Democrat.
2018-04-29.headline_main: The Sense of Justice That We’re Losing

2018-04-29.abstract: Generals and researchers provide growing evidence that the administration’s claims about transgender troops are false.
2018-04-29.snippet: Generals and researchers provide growing evidence that the administration’s claims about transgender troops are false.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: Since President Trump announced in March that the Pentagon would prohibit many transgender people from serving in the military, thousands of Americans have been in limbo, not knowing whether their careers were over or whether they would be barred from even joining the armed forces.
2018-04-29.headline_main: A Growing Problem for the Military Transgender Ban: Facts

2018-04-29.abstract: Hank Azaria said he’s willing to step away from the character he has voiced for nearly 30 years. The show’s writers and network executives should let him.
2018-04-29.snippet: Hank Azaria said he’s willing to step away from the character he has voiced for nearly 30 years. The show’s writers and network executives should let him.
2018-04-29.lead_paragraph: “Thank you, come again” — those four words, spoken in an exaggerated Indian accent, have followed immigrants and Americans of South Asian descent like a bad penny since “The Simpsons” premiered in 1989. They helped make Apu, the show’s tightfisted convenience store owner, a household name. And they are often repeated to us, with a sly grin or a guffaw, by the same people who are surprised that we speak English in grammatically sound sentences.
2018-04-29.headline_main: A Reckoning for Apu, ‘The Simpsons’ and Brownface

2018-04-30.abstract: The violent end of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, an unexpected turn of events after he gave up his nuclear program, is likely to serve as a cautionary tale for Kim Jong-un.
2018-04-30.snippet: The violent end of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, an unexpected turn of events after he gave up his nuclear program, is likely to serve as a cautionary tale for Kim Jong-un.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When John R. Bolton looks at North Korea, he sees Libya. It is not a perfect comparison, he acknowledges, but if there is a model for how to peacefully rid a hostile dictatorial state of its nuclear program, he points to the disarming of Libya some 15 years ago.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Libya as a Model for Disarmament? North Korea May See It Very Differently

2018-04-30.abstract: A reporter reflects on an E.P.A. administrator unlike any she’s seen in her 12 years of covering environmental policy.
2018-04-30.snippet: A reporter reflects on an E.P.A. administrator unlike any she’s seen in her 12 years of covering environmental policy.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Covering Scott Pruitt, Beige Career Lawyer and Master of the Non-Answer

2018-04-30.abstract: A blowout of the San Diego Padres kept the Mets atop their division, but inconsistent performances from crucial players are cause for concern.
2018-04-30.snippet: A blowout of the San Diego Padres kept the Mets atop their division, but inconsistent performances from crucial players are cause for concern.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: SAN DIEGO — Through the first month of their marathon regular season, the Mets have rinsed away much of the bitter taste of 2017. The biggest off-season addition, new manager Mickey Callaway, has found his early footing, and the team capped April with its most lopsided win of the season: A 14-2 victory over the San Diego Padres on Sunday.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Mets Finish April on a High Note, but Some Tinkering Remains

2018-04-30.abstract: Efforts to curb gun violence have stalled in part because of the power of the N.R.A. The movement inspired by shootings in Parkland, Fla., aims to change that.
2018-04-30.snippet: Efforts to curb gun violence have stalled in part because of the power of the N.R.A. The movement inspired by shootings in Parkland, Fla., aims to change that.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: There was a time when horror over gun violence stood a chance of prodding national politicians to act on their outrage. Half a century ago, politicians seemed particularly amenable to tougher measures if a shooting victim was one of their own. After the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, and then mere months after the murders of Senator Robert F. Kennedy and the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., Congress was moved in 1968 to enact a gun control law.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Do Stronger Gun Laws Stand a Chance? It’s Been an Uphill Battle.

2018-04-30.abstract: It had been rough for the Cleveland Cavaliers’ supporting cast, but in a key stretch late in Game 7, the non-LeBrons likely saved the series.
2018-04-30.snippet: It had been rough for the Cleveland Cavaliers’ supporting cast, but in a key stretch late in Game 7, the non-LeBrons likely saved the series.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — The statistics say LeBron James has never received less help in the N.B.A. playoffs from a group of teammates than he did in this first-round marathon against the Indiana Pacers.
2018-04-30.headline_main: ‘King’ James Briefly Sat, and His Subjects Carried the Load

2018-04-30.abstract: This week, the series shed the video game analogy and morphed into an ingenious allegory for the internet.
2018-04-30.snippet: This week, the series shed the video game analogy and morphed into an ingenious allegory for the internet.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: For the first season of “Westworld,” the park itself was analogous to a sandbox video game like “Grand Theft Auto,” which offers users a host of challenges but also allows them to explore an open environment without having their experience dictated to them. In our recent “Ask a Showrunner” interview, the show’s co-creator Jonathan Nolan made the “Grand Theft Auto” comparison himself, noting that both had “prompted a similar level of moral hand-wringing” for their consequence-free indulgence of man’s basest impulses.
2018-04-30.headline_main: ‘Westworld’ Season 2, Episode 2 Recap: No Judgment

2018-04-30.abstract: Thousands marched to remember the 10 people killed. While many were proud of the city’s response, others worried about what had motivated the attack.
2018-04-30.snippet: Thousands marched to remember the 10 people killed. While many were proud of the city’s response, others worried about what had motivated the attack.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — Thousands of Canadians turned out for a march and vigil to remember the 10 people killed last Monday, when the driver of a rental van mounted the sidewalk of Canada’s most famous and longest road, Yonge Street, and plowed down more than two dozen pedestrians.
2018-04-30.headline_main: At Toronto Vigil After Van Attack: Sadness, Civic Pride and Unease

2018-04-30.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Monday, April 30, 2018.
2018-04-30.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Monday, April 30, 2018.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: “We’ve literally had some continue using drugs while in the hospital. That’s like trying to do a liver transplant on someone who’s drinking a fifth of vodka on the stretcher.”
2018-04-30.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: Doctors Ask When a Heart Is Not Worth Fixing

2018-04-30.abstract: Axe and Wags have a Last Supper of sorts. Yes, it is absolutely as weird and profane as you might expect.
2018-04-30.snippet: Axe and Wags have a Last Supper of sorts. Yes, it is absolutely as weird and profane as you might expect.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: If there’s one place where we can come together in these divided times, surely it’s to appreciate a show that gives us opening scenes like the one this week: Axe and Wags, sitting at a table with cloth napkins draped over their heads, faces obscured, “for two reasons,” as Wags puts it: “to keep the aromas from escaping, and to hide this shameful and depraved act from God.”
2018-04-30.headline_main: ‘Billions’ Season 3, Episode 6 Recap: Eat or Be Eaten

2018-04-30.abstract: The new minister, a son of Pakistani immigrants, will have the immediate task of quieting the ruckus over the “Windrush generation.”
2018-04-30.snippet: The new minister, a son of Pakistani immigrants, will have the immediate task of quieting the ruckus over the “Windrush generation.”
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain moved swiftly to replace Amber Rudd as home secretary on Monday, promoting Sajid Javid, a son of Pakistani immigrants, in a move that made him the first nonwhite politician to hold one of the most senior British cabinet positions.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Sajid Javid Is Named U.K. Home Secretary, Replacing Amber Rudd

2018-04-30.abstract: Getty Sr. finds himself uncharacteristically shaken, his business sense having seemingly misled him. The consequences appear very, very dire.
2018-04-30.snippet: Getty Sr. finds himself uncharacteristically shaken, his business sense having seemingly misled him. The consequences appear very, very dire.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: So far, “Trust” has shown us that J. Paul Getty Sr. is not exactly what you’d call “good with people,” but his instincts for business are spot on. In this week’s episode, however, those instincts are called into question for the first time. In the final moments of the previous episode, we don’t know if little Paul has survived Primo’s raid at the peaceful farmhouse, when Primo shoots Angelo in the face, and we hear a second shot go off before the episode cuts to black. For about half of this episode, the Gettys believe that Paul Sr.’s paltry counteroffer to the kidnappers’ $17 million demand was a tragic miscalculation — that, for once, Getty’s outsized confidence in his “business” acumen has misled him, only this time the cost was not a barrel of oil but his grandson’s life.
2018-04-30.headline_main: ‘Trust’ Season 1, Episode 6 Recap: A Dead Body Focuses the Mind

2018-04-30.abstract: It was unclear if Dr. Jackson, who withdrew from consideration for secretary of veterans affairs, would stay in the White House or retire from the military.
2018-04-30.snippet: It was unclear if Dr. Jackson, who withdrew from consideration for secretary of veterans affairs, would stay in the White House or retire from the military.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Dr. Ronny L. Jackson, who withdrew from consideration for secretary of veterans affairs last week amid allegations related to his professional conduct, is unlikely to return to his role as the president’s doctor, according to a person familiar with the matter.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Ronny Jackson, Failed V.A. Pick, Is Unlikely to Return as Trump’s Doctor

2018-04-30.abstract: With the influx of international players has come a milieu of swearing on the court in many languages, confounding referees who are often the target.
2018-04-30.snippet: With the influx of international players has come a milieu of swearing on the court in many languages, confounding referees who are often the target.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Enes Kanter of the Knicks wants to make it clear that he no longer swears — in any language. But back when he did, at the start of his N.B.A. career in 2011, he swore exclusively in Turkish. He went his entire first season without referees calling him on it.
2018-04-30.headline_main: A Polyglot N.B.A. Swears by One Thing: That Call Was #@!&

2018-04-30.abstract: New guidelines, including a requirement that airlines make sure gates are free before sending planes to the airport, are expected to be announced Monday.
2018-04-30.snippet: New guidelines, including a requirement that airlines make sure gates are free before sending planes to the airport, are expected to be announced Monday.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Airlines will be prohibited from sending planes to Kennedy Airport during winter storms, like the one that caused chaos there in January, unless they have received assurances that gates will be available on landing.
2018-04-30.headline_main: After Chaos, Port Authority Sets Storm Rules for Planes to Kennedy

2018-04-30.abstract: Next up is a trip to Houston for the first meeting between the Yankees and the Astros since last year’s American League Championship Series.
2018-04-30.snippet: Next up is a trip to Houston for the first meeting between the Yankees and the Astros since last year’s American League Championship Series.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: ANAHEIM, Calif. — A towering home run by Gary Sanchez, a throwback pitching performance by C.C. Sabathia and some tense relief work by Chad Green and Aroldis Chapman were enough to carry the Yankees to a 2-1 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Sunday night at Angel Stadium.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Gary Sanchez’s Homer Gives Yankees a 9th Straight Win

2018-04-30.abstract: As cinemas return, the future of hope and change in my home country is palpable. Grab some popcorn.
2018-04-30.snippet: As cinemas return, the future of hope and change in my home country is palpable. Grab some popcorn.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia — I learned to love movies in a country where cinemas were illegal. My only access to film as a Saudi girl came through our crummy local video shop in suburban Riyadh where I grew up, where women were forbidden to enter. When I was old enough to go on my own, I would wait just outside the door for a male worker to bring me a catalog to flip through, selecting titles that would transport me to places that seemed millions of miles away.
2018-04-30.headline_main: A Day at the Movies in Saudi Arabia

2018-04-30.abstract: Mr. Cameron gathers fellow sci-fi buffs to explore the genre’s rich history in a new series. And “Elementary” returns for Season 6.
2018-04-30.snippet: Mr. Cameron gathers fellow sci-fi buffs to explore the genre’s rich history in a new series. And “Elementary” returns for Season 6.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: James Cameron gathers fellow sci-fi buffs to explore the genre’s history in a new AMC series. And the eccentric Sherlock Holmes of “Elementary” returns for Season 6.
2018-04-30.headline_main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘James Cameron’s Story of Science Fiction’ and ‘Elementary’

2018-04-30.abstract: Every year, through careless management or reckless ambition, a handful of soccer clubs drift uncomfortably close to collapse. In February, Denmark’s Lyngby B.K. came closer than most.
2018-04-30.snippet: Every year, through careless management or reckless ambition, a handful of soccer clubs drift uncomfortably close to collapse. In February, Denmark’s Lyngby B.K. came closer than most.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: KONGENS LYNGBY, Denmark — Mads Byder sent the text message to everyone he could think of, anyone who had the money — and maybe the madness — to help. In the end, he copied and pasted the message 15 times, changing the name of the recipient, but nothing else.

2018-04-30.abstract: The Toronto van attacker was probably familiar with the Islamic State’s vehicle rampages. But did he know what else he shared with the group?
2018-04-30.snippet: The Toronto van attacker was probably familiar with the Islamic State’s vehicle rampages. But did he know what else he shared with the group?
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: As an instrument for delivering publicity, terrorism clearly works. Or at least it did last week, when the hitherto obscure term “incel” went viral after Alek Minassian drove a truck into a crowd of pedestrians in downtown Toronto. Mr. Minassian, just before carrying out his attack, wrote a post on Facebook in which he proclaimed the arrival of an “incel rebellion.” Standing for “involuntarily celibate,” the term is used as a badge of honor among a fringe online subculture of misogynists who say they hate women for depriving them of sex. So now we know.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Sex and Shame: What Incels and Jihadists Have in Common

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — On May 5, 1818, in the southern German town of Trier, in the picturesque wine-growing region of the Moselle Valley, Karl Marx was born. At the time Trier was one-tenth the size it is today, with a population of around 12,000. According to one of Marx’s recent biographers, Jürgen Neffe, Trier is one of those towns where “although everyone doesn’t know everyone, many know a lot about many.”
2018-04-30.headline_main: Happy Birthday, Karl Marx. You Were Right!

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Nature is unscripted and hard to predict. Having recently discovered this reality, Penn State has decided that its 98-year-old, student-led Outing Club shall no longer be allowed to go on outings. Citing the high risk of remote environments and poor cellphone service, the university is recommending that the club restrict its offerings to films and speakers. Students are being funneled into engaging only in previously vetted human constructions.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Nature Is Risky. That’s Why Students Need It.

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: To my great and continuing surprise, I am an orphan. Another way of saying that would just be that I am no longer remotely young, that I am the mother of grown children, that at my next college reunion there will be some classmates who are already talking retirement. People my age have parents in their 80s and 90s, if they have parents at all.
2018-04-30.headline_main: On Being an Orphan, Frequently

Alas, at last count, barely more than one-third have done so, with the rest of Americans leaving it up to the medical profession and ill-prepared family members to decide when and how to provide life-prolonging treatments.

It’s an uncertain, difficult world we live in, sometimes hard to explain, and all the more so when you look around and it’s as if everyone’s mad at you, all the time, even when they say they’re not. Here’s some nickel advice: Take a good long walk after you read The Times in the morning, however you read it, and then cook dinner at the end of the day, even if it’s just ramen from Sevs with a poached egg, scallions and a dusting of sesame seeds. Be active. Take care. That’s the ticket to ride.

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: At an age when most kids spend their waking hours playing video games, the ceramist Marc Armitano Domingo — not yet in high school, and living in Northern California — was learning a 15th-century instrument and yearning to take Communion. “I wished I was more Catholic. My older brothers had to go to Communion and I wanted to be cool like them, but my parents didn’t make me. And so I begged them. I wanted to dress up in the little suits!” says Armitano Domingo, now 21.

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: In a joint statement on Monday, the jurors who voted to convict Bill Cosby of sexual assault last week said that they believed his accuser’s account and were persuaded of his guilt by the facts, not the momentum of social change captured in the #MeToo movement.

2018-04-30.abstract: Did the latest developments leave you shocked? Puzzled? Skeptical? You’re not alone.
2018-04-30.snippet: Did the latest developments leave you shocked? Puzzled? Skeptical? You’re not alone.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: “Avengers: Infinity War” incinerated global box-office records over the weekend, taking in $630 million around the world. But the movie’s earnings are less surprising than its dark conclusion, which surely had fans from Chicago to China stumbling out of theaters with their mouths hanging open. (Read the Times review by A.O. Scott, here as well as his thoughts on the film’s ending.) If the latest developments in the Marvel Cinematic Universe left you puzzled, our roundup of what to read after you’ve seen “Infinity War” should clear up some confusion. Some spoilers lie ahead.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Seen ‘Avengers: Infinity War’? Here’s What to Read About That Shocking Ending

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. — Tyson Cole got hooked on the original Japanese version of “Iron Chef” in the early 1990s, after taking a job as a dishwasher and server at a sushi restaurant here in his adopted hometown.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Tokyo in Texas: Distinctive Japanese Food Is Thriving in Austin

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Spring weather has finally arrived in New York, and it’s just in time for the annual bonanza of contemporary art fairs. There are three art fairs running simultaneously this week in Manhattan and a bevy in Brooklyn, all of them vying for the attention of new collectors, as well as the veterans whose deep pockets make the whole art world spin.
2018-04-30.headline_main: How to Make the Most of the Frieze Week Art Fairs

2018-04-30.abstract: These newly popular long-aged spirits come with a lot of hype and hefty prices, but some are worth the expense.
2018-04-30.snippet: These newly popular long-aged spirits come with a lot of hype and hefty prices, but some are worth the expense.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Cinco de Mayo is not the moment for extra añejo tequila. While plenty of the agave spirit from Jalisco, Mexico, will flow on May 5, in cheap margaritas and shots, the bottles classified as extra añejo — which by Mexican law must be aged more than three years — will mostly stay on the top shelf of the bar, awaiting another day.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Picking an Extra Añejo Tequila Takes Extra Care

2018-04-30.abstract: Jitish Kallat, the Mumbai-based artist with a new show in New York, lets elements like rain and fire affect his practice.
2018-04-30.snippet: Jitish Kallat, the Mumbai-based artist with a new show in New York, lets elements like rain and fire affect his practice.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Jitish Kallat, the Mumbai-based artist whose first show at New York’s Sperone Westwater gallery opened last week, frequently uses unorthodox methods: He labors away in the rain at night, or douses drawings with inflammable liquids and sets them on fire.
2018-04-30.headline_main: An Artist Who Leaves His Work Up to Nature — and Chance

2018-04-30.abstract: In two concerts at David Geffen Hall, the Philharmonic played it safe — at least by its own standards.
2018-04-30.snippet: In two concerts at David Geffen Hall, the Philharmonic played it safe — at least by its own standards.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: What defines the Los Angeles Philharmonic? Is it the music and artistic director Gustavo Dudamel’s exciting performances of symphonies central to the repertory? Or is it the risks the orchestra takes on rarities and new pieces — including what feels like a Year of 1,000 Commissions for its centennial next season? (O.K., not quite that many. But it’s a lot.)
2018-04-30.headline_main: Review: Dudamel and Los Angeles Bring the Noise to New York

2018-04-30.abstract: Shah Marai was Agence France-Presse’s chief photographer in Kabul. He supported five blind relatives as he focused his camera on the human suffering around him.
2018-04-30.snippet: Shah Marai was Agence France-Presse’s chief photographer in Kabul. He supported five blind relatives as he focused his camera on the human suffering around him.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Through the dark days of the 1990s civil war and the Taliban’s oppressive rule, the Afghan photographer Shah Marai never left his country. As the bloodshed continued after the 2001 American-led invasion, he repeatedly expressed a feeling shared by so many Afghans caught in the devastating cycle: “There is no more hope.”
2018-04-30.headline_main: Photojournalist Killed in Kabul Left a Legacy of Images

2018-04-30.abstract: The chef Masaharu Morimoto is marketing Easy Cup sake to help make the beverage easier to understand.
2018-04-30.snippet: The chef Masaharu Morimoto is marketing Easy Cup sake to help make the beverage easier to understand.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Masaharu Morimoto, the chef and restaurateur, wants to see more Japanese cooking at home in America. To his line of cookbooks, knives, grapeseed oils and beer, he has added sake. “Sake is not easy to understand,” he said. “I’m making it easy.” His new sake for everyday drinking, Easy Cup, is a junmai premium sake made from highly polished rice by Gekkeikan, a centuries-old Japanese company. It’s straightforward, mellow and somewhat floral, making it a fine starter sake and excellent to serve chilled with seafood. It comes in a convenient, picnic-ready resealable glass jar at a modest price: Easy Cup Sake, $19.99 for five 7.1-ounce jars, Grand Cru Wine & Spirits, 570 11th Avenue (43rd Street), 646-682-9278, grandcruny.com.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Sake for Everyday Drinking

2018-04-30.abstract: Her imaginative evening bags were sought after by celebrities and royalty. She died only hours after the death of her husband, the painter Gerson Leiber.
2018-04-30.snippet: Her imaginative evening bags were sought after by celebrities and royalty. She died only hours after the death of her husband, the painter Gerson Leiber.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Judith Leiber, the handbag designer whose whimsical creations were prized as collectors’ pieces and frequently displayed as objets d’art, died on Saturday at her home in Springs, N.Y., a hamlet in East Hampton. She was 97.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Judith Leiber, 97, Dies; Turned Handbags Into Objets d’Art

2018-04-30.abstract: The company’s “real” Jewish mustard arrives for retail sales just in time for hot dog season.
2018-04-30.snippet: The company’s “real” Jewish mustard arrives for retail sales just in time for hot dog season.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: For that hot dog off the grill, ditch the pinky-up Dijon. Instead open a jar of New York-style mustard from the Brooklyn Diner restaurants. It’s being sold retail for the first time. Called real Jewish mustard, not the yellow ballpark variety, it’s slightly grainy and vinegary, the better to slap back at fatty meats: Brooklyn Diner Real Jewish Mustard, $5 for nine ounces at Brooklyn Diner restaurants and from brooklyndiner.com.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Brooklyn Diner Makes Its Mustard Available to the Public

2018-04-30.abstract: The magazine Cherry Bombe, which celebrates women in the culinary world, is promoting the poster, which borrows from the traditional choking sign.
2018-04-30.snippet: The magazine Cherry Bombe, which celebrates women in the culinary world, is promoting the poster, which borrows from the traditional choking sign.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Borrowing from the design of the standard Heimlich maneuver poster in restaurants, the magazine Cherry Bombe, which celebrates women in the culinary world, has produced a bold poster showing steps to take in the case of sexual harassment. Karen Leibowitz, a San Francisco restaurateur, came up with the idea and arranged for Kelli Anderson, a Brooklyn graphic artist, to design it: Sexual Harassment P.S.A. Poster, $10, or print at home, cherrybombe.com/86-this.
2018-04-30.headline_main: The New Restaurant P.S.A. Poster: How to Deal With Sexual Harassment

2018-04-30.abstract: More of a comic’s comic than a household name, he is capping a year of triumphs (“S.N.L.” host, sold-out shows at Radio City Music Hall) with a Netflix special.

2018-04-30.headline_main: The Stealth Success of John Mulaney

2018-04-30.abstract: “Coffee Isn’t Rocket Science,” an illustrated book by Sébastien Racineux and Chung-Leng Tran, is a thorough brew.
2018-04-30.snippet: “Coffee Isn’t Rocket Science,” an illustrated book by Sébastien Racineux and Chung-Leng Tran, is a thorough brew.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Coffee may not be rocket science, but despite the title, even a quick spin through this highly detailed volume suggests it might come close. Consider more than 30 pages just about espresso, best served in a china cup at least a quarter-inch thick. For most filter methods, a kettle with a gooseneck spout is essential. A coffee lover is sure to find plenty that’s useful in this illustrated book, which is mostly about making the beverage properly. Coffee around the world, a coffee lexicon, production, equipment, grinding, storing, proportions and temperatures are all in there: “Coffee Isn’t Rocket Science: A Quick & Easy Guide to Buying, Brewing, Serving, Roasting & Tasting Coffee” by Sébastien Racineux and Chung-Leng Tran (Black Dog & Leventhal, $24.99).
2018-04-30.headline_main: Grinding Out the Details of a Good Cup of Coffee

2018-04-30.abstract: Jacob Hadjigeorgis has a new store, Lucky Pickle Dumpling Co.
2018-04-30.snippet: Jacob Hadjigeorgis has a new store, Lucky Pickle Dumpling Co.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Jacob Hadjigeorgis first made his mark on the Upper West Side with pickles: Jacob’s Pickles, then Maison Pickle. It was Maison Pickle’s best-selling shrimp pillow dumpling, an odd winner in a place that specializes in French dip sandwiches, that inspired his latest venture, combining pickles and dumplings. “I’m going with what’s popular,” he said. His new storefront, mostly for takeout, has six varieties of dumplings, with the delicate shrimp among them; three noodle dishes, including a meaty, modestly spicy dan dan; and, of course, pickles to order from a kiosk in the store, an app or online for pickup or delivery. There’s soft-serve in matcha and also a pickle flavor that suggests cucumber frozen yogurt: Lucky Pickle Dumpling Co., 513 Amsterdam Avenue (85th Street), 212-392-5407, luckypickledumpling.co.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Founder of Jacob’s Pickles Goes After the Dumpling Crowd

2018-04-30.abstract: A 14-member collective battling harassment in improvised music is releasing guidelines for more equitable workplaces and expectations for change.
2018-04-30.snippet: A 14-member collective battling harassment in improvised music is releasing guidelines for more equitable workplaces and expectations for change.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Over the past year a steady stream of public testimonials from female jazz musicians has made clear what most already knew privately: Sexism and harassment are deeply ingrained in the improvised-music world.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Women Fighting Sexism in Jazz Have a Voice. And Now, a Code of Conduct.

2018-04-30.abstract: Jim Lahey has added a cafe to his wholesale bakery in Hell’s Kitchen.
2018-04-30.snippet: Jim Lahey has added a cafe to his wholesale bakery in Hell’s Kitchen.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: It’s been nearly 18 years since Jim Lahey moved his Italian-style Sullivan Street Bakery to West 47th Street from SoHo, keeping the name. During that time, he’s tweaked the Hell’s Kitchen location more than once. Now, he’s given it a complete overhaul and will open on Thursday, adding a bright new cafe and upgrading some of the equipment in the big wholesale bakery that may be hidden from view but is the soul of the operation. The menu for the light, airy cafe is the work of the corporate executive chef Morgan Schofield. It starts with breakfast items like brioche French toast and includes soups, salads, pastries and made-to-order or grab-and-go sandwiches. There’s a stretch of retail counter for breads, other baked goods, and Mr. Lahey’s signature Roman pizzas: Sullivan Street Bakery, 533 West 47th Street, 212-265-5580, sullivanstreetbakery.com.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Sullivan Street Bakery Gets a Makeover

2018-04-30.abstract: The live stage production of “Girls & Boys” will come to the Minetta Lane Theater in June, and Ms. Mulligan’s performance will be recorded for an audio play.
2018-04-30.snippet: The live stage production of “Girls & Boys” will come to the Minetta Lane Theater in June, and Ms. Mulligan’s performance will be recorded for an audio play.

2018-04-30.abstract: The documentary follows a Buddhist boy who has been identified as a rinpoche — a reincarnated centuries-old monk.
2018-04-30.snippet: The documentary follows a Buddhist boy who has been identified as a rinpoche — a reincarnated centuries-old monk.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: “In my previous life, I used to live in Kham, Tibet,” Padma Angdu, 9, says in “Becoming Who I Was,” and he’s not the only one in his remote Indian village who believes that he is a rinpoche — a reincarnated centuries-old monk.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Review: ‘Becoming Who I Was’ Looks at a Boy’s Days, and His Past Lives

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: One of Michelle Wolf’s first jokes at the White House Correspondents’ Association dinner involved a certain vulgarity that rode into widespread public use aboard Donald Trump’s “Access Hollywood” bus. To this crowd, it was apparently still a bit shocking. “You should have done more research before you got me to do this,” she said.

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: The unnamed narrator of “Motherhood,” Sheila Heti’s earthy and philosophical and essential new novel, is a writer in her late 30s. She smokes; she’s divorced; she lives with her boyfriend in a Toronto apartment that’s pretty but has mice in the walls.

2018-04-30.abstract: People laughed when Mayor Mike Duggan first predicted that Detroit could emerge from active state oversight this spring. On Monday, it happened.
2018-04-30.snippet: People laughed when Mayor Mike Duggan first predicted that Detroit could emerge from active state oversight this spring. On Monday, it happened.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: For the first time in years, Detroit is in charge of its own budget. A Michigan commission assigned to oversee the city’s financial decisions voted on Monday to end its day-to-day control.
2018-04-30.headline_main: As Detroit Sheds State Oversight, Its Mayor Reflects on Its Path

2018-04-30.abstract: In Georgia, black women are leading a multiracial coalition to elect the nation’s first black female governor.
2018-04-30.snippet: In Georgia, black women are leading a multiracial coalition to elect the nation’s first black female governor.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: When early voting begins today in the Georgia primary campaign for governor, Stacey Abrams, the former minority leader of the Georgia House of Representatives, may very well take a momentous step closer to becoming the first black woman in the nation to be elected governor. Ms. Abrams will have entered that office lifted by the political power of a multiracial coalition led by the Democratic Party’s most powerful voting bloc, black women.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Is Stacey Abrams Assembling a New Democratic Majority?

2018-04-30.abstract: It’s the round for the “good but not great” and the “project.” There aren’t many superstars found here, but every once in a while it produces a gem.

2018-04-30.abstract: His pay raised eyebrows because it was much higher than his predecessors’. It was granted under a special provision to attract top scientists.
2018-04-30.snippet: His pay raised eyebrows because it was much higher than his predecessors’. It was granted under a special provision to attract top scientists.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: The government will lower the $375,000 salary of the new director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Dr. Robert R. Redfield, after reports that he was being paid considerably more than previous directors, the Department of Health and Human Services confirmed on Monday, though it declined to say what his new pay will be.
2018-04-30.headline_main: C.D.C. Director’s $375,000 Salary Will Be Cut

2018-04-30.abstract: The authors argue that America’s predisposition for favoring small business is not just misguided but has had a pernicious effect.
2018-04-30.snippet: The authors argue that America’s predisposition for favoring small business is not just misguided but has had a pernicious effect.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: One of the few remaining topics about which America’s increasingly polarized populace can seem to agree is the relative virtue of small business. Whether you are a Midwestern populist bemoaning the decline of the family farm, an East Coast realist focused on the role of small firms in driving job creation, a Silicon Valley entrepreneur dreaming of disrupting the status quo or just bitter that your favorite local restaurant was replaced by an Olive Garden, everyone, it seems, has reason to embrace small businesses. In the view of Robert D. Atkinson and Michael Lind, the authors of “Big Is Beautiful: Debunking the Myth of Small Business,” America’s predisposition since the 1970s for favoring the little guy is not just misguided but has had a profoundly pernicious effect on our economy and society.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Review: ‘Big Is Beautiful’ Questions the Virtues of Small Business

2018-04-30.abstract: With hipsters and Oliver Stone in attendance, the Fajr International Film Festival reflects a changing, more self-confident society in Iran.
2018-04-30.snippet: With hipsters and Oliver Stone in attendance, the Fajr International Film Festival reflects a changing, more self-confident society in Iran.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — As the veteran American director took the stage at Iran’s Fajr International Film Festival, the audience stood up, clapping and cheering.
2018-04-30.headline_main: As Oscars Pile Up, Iranian Film Grows Up

2018-04-30.abstract: A new study on surveillance finds that Republicans tend to feel pleased about tracking, both online and in real life, while Democrats often feel bad about it.

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Every so often a game comes along that conquers the hearts, minds and thumbs of gamers everywhere. Fortnite: Battle Royale is the latest victor in this category. According to a  report last week from the market research firm SuperData, the game generated $223 million in March, and it begins a new season — with a new theme and a few other changes — on May 1.

2018-04-30.abstract: Thousands of Russians are taking a bold stand against the Kremlin’s efforts to block the popular encrypted messaging service, which refused to give the state access to users’ messages.
2018-04-30.snippet: Thousands of Russians are taking a bold stand against the Kremlin’s efforts to block the popular encrypted messaging service, which refused to give the state access to users’ messages.

2018-04-30.abstract: The rally, which began as a protest of the crackdown on the Telegram messenger app, quickly morphed into a protest against Vladimir V. Putin.
2018-04-30.snippet: The rally, which began as a protest of the crackdown on the Telegram messenger app, quickly morphed into a protest against Vladimir V. Putin.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A demonstration in Moscow against the Russian government’s effort to block the messaging app Telegram quickly morphed on Monday into a protest against President Vladimir V. Putin, with thousands of participants chanting against the Kremlin’s increasingly restrictive bent.
2018-04-30.headline_main: ‘They Want to Block Our Future’: Thousands Protest Russia’s Internet Censorship

2018-04-30.abstract: The reactionary and radical ’80s are being celebrated at an Upper East Side institution, the Kips Bay Decorator Show House.
2018-04-30.snippet: The reactionary and radical ’80s are being celebrated at an Upper East Side institution, the Kips Bay Decorator Show House.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: It’s spring! (Sort of.) A more reliable sign than the balky weather is the Kips Bay Decorator Show House, opening Tuesday in an Upper East Side brownstone. Now in its 46th year, the show house is always a spectacle, a three-dimensional tour into the lives of the 1 percent. (The townhouse is for sale for $51 million.) This year, 22 designers are spread out over seven levels and about 15,000 square feet.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Bright Lights, Big Sofas

2018-04-30.abstract: Plato and existentialism helped more than courses in economics.
2018-04-30.snippet: Plato and existentialism helped more than courses in economics.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: When I arrived at Harvard in 1956 as a freshman, I felt overwhelmed academically. Unlike many of my classmates who had gone to rigorous private schools, I graduated from a Florida public school that in those days rarely sent kids to elite colleges in the North. Even after four years of high school French, I couldn’t pass the exam to get out of the entry-level class at Harvard. In math, I was relegated to the remedial course.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Robert E. Rubin: Philosophy Prepared Me for a Career in Finance and Government

2018-04-30.abstract: Among the newly accepted cases is an appeal from a death row inmate with a rare medical condition he says will cause excruciating pain if he is given a lethal injection.
2018-04-30.snippet: Among the newly accepted cases is an appeal from a death row inmate with a rare medical condition he says will cause excruciating pain if he is given a lethal injection.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court added three cases to its docket on Monday, agreeing to hear disputes about lethal injections, class-action settlements and arbitration.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Supreme Court to Hear Cases on Death Penalty and Class Actions

2018-04-30.abstract: The abductions of three people by armed men in uniforms in 2009 have led an international court to examine accusations of human rights violations by government forces.
2018-04-30.snippet: The abductions of three people by armed men in uniforms in 2009 have led an international court to examine accusations of human rights violations by government forces.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — On a cold night in December 2009, three relatives in the Mexican state of Chihuahua were taken away by a group of armed men in military uniforms and were never seen again.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Missing Mexicans’ Case Shines Light on Military’s Role in Drug War

2018-04-30.abstract: A primer on some of the freshest products and how to use them.
2018-04-30.snippet: A primer on some of the freshest products and how to use them.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: If there’s a universal truth to be drawn from the current makeup landscape, it’s that more is more. So many new products crowd the market that even a beauty hound can become boggled. Sift through them, though, and there are creative new options well worth your attention. Textures, in particular, have become more inventive. Below, a primer on some of the newest and some tips on how to use them.
2018-04-30.headline_main: How to Wear Spring’s Most Inventive New Makeup

2018-04-30.abstract: It was the latest move by a pornographic film star, whose real name is Stephanie Clifford, who says she had an affair with Mr. Trump 12 years ago.

2018-04-30.abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu cited no evidence that Iran violated the nuclear deal, but the accusation may bolster the case for President Trump to pull out.

2018-04-30.abstract: Long before he became a famous auteur, Kubrick was a teenage photographer for Look magazine. An exhibition at the Museum of the City of New York examines his work.
2018-04-30.snippet: Long before he became a famous auteur, Kubrick was a teenage photographer for Look magazine. An exhibition at the Museum of the City of New York examines his work.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Starting in 1945, when he was 17 and living in the Bronx, Stanley Kubrick worked as a New York-based photographer for Look magazine. He joined the staff full time in October 1946, and he quit in August 1950. “By the time I was 21 I had four years of seeing how things worked in the world,” Kubrick told an interviewer in 1972. “I think if I had gone to college I would never have been a director.”
2018-04-30.headline_main: Stanley Kubrick: Before He Wrote Scripts, He Took Photos

2018-04-30.abstract: It was the second death this year for the U.S. military in Afghanistan’s enduring war. Another American was wounded, and several Afghan troops were killed.
2018-04-30.snippet: It was the second death this year for the U.S. military in Afghanistan’s enduring war. Another American was wounded, and several Afghan troops were killed.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — An attack on Monday in eastern Afghanistan killed one American service member and wounded another in the second United States military combat death this year in the enduring war.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Attack Kills American Service Member in Eastern Afghanistan

2018-04-30.abstract: Wendell Jamieson, who had led The New York Times’s metro section for five years, issued an apology before leaving the paper. But the reason for his departure was not disclosed.
2018-04-30.snippet: Wendell Jamieson, who had led The New York Times’s metro section for five years, issued an apology before leaving the paper. But the reason for his departure was not disclosed.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: The New York Times announced on Monday that Wendell Jamieson, the newspaper’s metro editor, had resigned after an internal investigation but did not specify the reason for his departure.
2018-04-30.headline_main: New York Times Metro Editor Resigns, Citing ‘Mistakes’

2018-04-30.abstract: An author and professor for more than four decades, he made criticism a prism on history and society, from pornography to psychoanalysis.
2018-04-30.snippet: An author and professor for more than four decades, he made criticism a prism on history and society, from pornography to psychoanalysis.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Steven Marcus, a Columbia College professor who transformed literary criticism into a lens on history and society by revealing a subculture of Victorian pornography and psychoanalyzing characters in Charles Dickens’s novels, died on April 25 in a Manhattan hospital. He was 89.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Steven Marcus, Columbia Scholar and Literary Critic, Dies at 89

2018-04-30.abstract: Analysts are still waiting for hard evidence that the new tax law is setting off the investment explosion that President Trump and Republicans promised.
2018-04-30.snippet: Analysts are still waiting for hard evidence that the new tax law is setting off the investment explosion that President Trump and Republicans promised.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: After years of costly layoffs and plant closings, things are looking up for the heavy-machinery giant Caterpillar, which forecasts solid global sales growth and increased demand this year. Yet despite the corporate investment incentives at the center of President Trump’s tax overhaul, the company’s executives have no plans to supercharge investment or expansion.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Investment Boom From Trump’s Tax Cut Has Yet to Appear

2018-04-30.abstract: The statement appeared to undercut an argument that Solicitor General Noel J. Francisco made before the Supreme Court, one that the Justice Department now says included a factual error.
2018-04-30.snippet: The statement appeared to undercut an argument that Solicitor General Noel J. Francisco made before the Supreme Court, one that the Justice Department now says included a factual error.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Monday that he would not apologize for campaign statements calling for a “Muslim ban,” appearing to undercut an assertion at a Supreme Court argument last week from Solicitor General Noel J. Francisco. In defending Mr. Trump’s efforts to restrict travel from several predominantly Muslim countries, Mr. Francisco said that the president had already disavowed the statements.
2018-04-30.headline_main: ‘There’s No Reason to Apologize’ for Muslim Ban Remarks, Trump Says

2018-04-30.abstract: The Terrus museum in the South of France collected what curators thought were the works of a local painter. But many of them are counterfeits.
2018-04-30.snippet: The Terrus museum in the South of France collected what curators thought were the works of a local painter. But many of them are counterfeits.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: PARIS — One painting included a castle tower that had been built in the late 1950s. But the artist who supposedly painted it, Étienne Terrus, died in 1922.
2018-04-30.headline_main: French Museum Discovers More Than Half Its Collection Is Fake

2018-04-30.abstract: At least 208 women received diagnoses of cervical cancer after erroneously receiving false negatives in government-funded smear tests.
2018-04-30.snippet: At least 208 women received diagnoses of cervical cancer after erroneously receiving false negatives in government-funded smear tests.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: DUBLIN — The Irish government announced on Monday that it was opening an official inquiry and setting up phone help lines and emergency testing after it emerged that a publicly funded smear test program had mistakenly cleared at least 208 women who later received diagnoses of cervical cancer.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Ireland Investigates Cervical Cancer Screening Scandal

2018-04-30.abstract: Revolution in Iran, the “Troubles” in Belfast, the “Rumble in the Jungle” in Zaire: The Magnum photographer Abbas covered them all and more.
2018-04-30.snippet: Revolution in Iran, the “Troubles” in Belfast, the “Rumble in the Jungle” in Zaire: The Magnum photographer Abbas covered them all and more.

2018-04-30.abstract: He took pictures in troubled areas all over the world, but he was more interested in the causes and aftermath of war than in the killing.
2018-04-30.snippet: He took pictures in troubled areas all over the world, but he was more interested in the causes and aftermath of war than in the killing.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Abbas Attar, an Iranian-born photographer who documented cataclysmic events throughout the world, including the Iranian revolution, and developed a particular interest in the role of religion in them, died on Wednesday in Paris. He was 74.

2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: Dear Diary:

2018-04-30.abstract: Thomas D. Homan, the agency’s acting director, faced opposition from several Senate Democrats — and even some Republicans — who said he was too aggressive in deporting undocumented immigrants.
2018-04-30.snippet: Thomas D. Homan, the agency’s acting director, faced opposition from several Senate Democrats — and even some Republicans — who said he was too aggressive in deporting undocumented immigrants.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Thomas D. Homan, the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement, said on Monday that he would retire from the deportation agency in June, after more than a year of pushing President Trump’s controversial plans to remove thousands of undocumented immigrants from the United States.
2018-04-30.headline_main: ICE Leader, Advocate of Tough Trump Immigration Policies, Will Retire

2018-04-30.abstract: The decision may allow a federal appeals court to rule on whether President Trump’s pre-election statements about Latinos can be considered in the case
2018-04-30.snippet: The decision may allow a federal appeals court to rule on whether President Trump’s pre-election statements about Latinos can be considered in the case
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Brooklyn gave permission to the government on Monday to appeal his recent decision that allowed two lawsuits seeking to preserve a program that shields some undocumented young adults from deportation to cite President Trump’s “racially charged language” against Latinos.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Judge Permits Government to Appeal DACA Lawsuit

2018-04-30.abstract: Jan Koum’s exit is the highest-profile departure from Facebook after months of controversy at the social network. A company executive said security of user data was behind Mr. Koum’s decision.
2018-04-30.snippet: Jan Koum’s exit is the highest-profile departure from Facebook after months of controversy at the social network. A company executive said security of user data was behind Mr. Koum’s decision.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Jan Koum, a founder of the messaging app WhatsApp, sold the service to Facebook in 2014, he explained how deeply he cared about the privacy of communication. Growing up in the Soviet Union during the 1980s — when surveillance was a fact of life — had made him realize the importance of being able to speak freely, he wrote.
2018-04-30.headline_main: WhatsApp Co-Founder Leaving Facebook Amid User Data Disputes

2018-04-30.abstract: The Hall of Fame legend, now 77 and living in Maui, muses about retirement, getting stoned with Willie Nelson, and growing his own strand called “Nellie Kush.”
2018-04-30.snippet: The Hall of Fame legend, now 77 and living in Maui, muses about retirement, getting stoned with Willie Nelson, and growing his own strand called “Nellie Kush.”

2018-04-30.headline_main: Retired N.B.A. Coach Don Nelson Talks Playoffs, Poker and, Uh, Weed

2018-04-30.abstract: The lawsuit claims the disgraced film producer blacklisted the actress after she rejected his sexual advances. Ms. Judd is suing for unfair business practices, defamation and sexual harassment.
2018-04-30.snippet: The lawsuit claims the disgraced film producer blacklisted the actress after she rejected his sexual advances. Ms. Judd is suing for unfair business practices, defamation and sexual harassment.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Ashley Judd sued Harvey Weinstein on Monday, opening a new legal battlefront for the disgraced film producer by claiming that her career withered because he spread lies about her in Hollywood after she rejected his sexual requests.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Ashley Judd Sues Harvey Weinstein, Saying He Harmed Her Career

2018-04-30.abstract: The newest mission to Mars is to launch on Saturday morning. It will search for marsquakes and try to produce a map of the planet’s insides.
2018-04-30.snippet: The newest mission to Mars is to launch on Saturday morning. It will search for marsquakes and try to produce a map of the planet’s insides.
2018-04-30.lead_paragraph: NASA’s Mars InSight spacecraft, scheduled to launch on Saturday, is headed to one of the most boring places on the red planet.
2018-04-30.headline_main: Mars InSight: NASA’s Journey Into the Red Planet’s Deepest Mysteries

2018-04-30.abstract: The InSight spacecraft is heading to Mars to listen for marsquakes and study the planet’s structure.
